loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina is 39 years old and married with five children. With three children currently in school, Gina works very hard to provide for them.

Gina runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 28000 loan through NWTF to buy more items to sell in her general store.

Gina has been in this business for 4 years and sells a variety of items such as bread, snack foods, cooking oil, coffee, soft drinks, etc. 

In the future, Gina would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell in her general store

loans.name: Luchadoras De Yanacoto Group

texts.es: Elizabeth es socia del grupo “LUCHADORAS DE YANACOTO” tiene 39 años es soltera con 2 hijos. Trabaja como domestica hace 7 años. Años atrás se dedicaba  a estudiar en la universidad. Hace 3 años compro una mototaxi con sus ahorros para que su hijo trabaje y estudie a la vez. El préstamo lo invertirá en llantas nuevas para su mototaxi. Su mayor deseo es tener un negocio propio de abarrotes en general. El grupo agradece a los inversionistas KIVA por el préstamo. Elizabeth es la segunda del lado izquierdo viste casaca beige.
texts.en: Elizabeth is a member of the group "Luchadores de Yanacoto." She is 39 years old and is a single mother of two children. She has worked as a housemaid for seven years. Years ago she studied at the university. Three years ago she bought a mototaxi with her savings so that her son could work while studying at the same time. The loan will be invested in new tires for his mototaxi. Her greatest hope is to open her own grocery store. The group is grateful to the Kiva donors for this loan. Elizabeth is pictured second from the left in a beige coat.

loans.use: purchase new tires for a mototaxi.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth describes herself as a determined and optimistic woman. She is applying a loan of KES 26,500 which will be used to purchase a water tank. The main challenge she faces is inadequate water storage facilities to harvest water during rainy season, and irrigation during the dry season.

loans.use: To purchase a water tank.

loans.name: Asha

texts.en:
Asha is married and has four children. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees for her children. 

For the past seven months, she has operated a poultry selling business. She sells to her neighbours and restaurant operators. Her major challenges are the high cost of transportation to her place of operation.

With the KES 30,000 she wants to purchase chicks and chicken feed. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business and improve her living standards.

loans.use: to purchase chicks and chicken feed.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a power scythe

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy tops, pants, shorts, socks, and other things

loans.name: Nargis

texts.en: Nargis is a 33-year-old diligent woman. She is living in Rawalpindi, Pakistan, along with her husband and 2 children. She has been operating a business of selling leather products for 5 years. Currently she needs to purchase new leather products like leather bags, leather pouches etc, and for that purpose she has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan. Her monthly sales would be increased with the addition of new variety of leather products. She is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To purchase leather products

loans.name: Joan

texts.en:
Joan is a married woman, with three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Joan is 32 years old and has two children who are in school.

Joan has a general store business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 19000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell like canned goods, soft drinks, cooking oil, sugar, coffee, eggs, and other groceries in her general store.

Joan has been in this business for 3 years. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell like canned goods, soft drinks, cooking oil, sugar, coffee, eggs, and other groceries in her general store

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita is a 51-year-old married woman and a mother of four children from CPG, Bohol. She has been engaged in a fishing business together with her husband for more than 10 years now. This is the source of their income.
Lolita is asking for a loan to buy fishing nets, lead weights, hooks and others. Through this, her husband will be able to improve his catch, thus giving them more fish to sell in the market.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets, lead weights, hooks and other items

loans.name: Andres Adilio

texts.es: andres de 44 años de edad, se dedica a cultivar la tierra.  Con mucha dedicación cultiva maíz y frijoles, lo cual le permite llevar el  pan de cada día a su hogar. Se caracteriza por ser un hombre trabajador, honrado y responsable. Habita junto a su  grupo familiar el cual está conformado por su esposa y sus cinco hijos.  Junto a su esposa trabajan muy duro para sacar adelante a su familia. Gracias a los conocimientos en la agricultura es como logra llevar el sustento a su hogar, que es su principal fuente de ingresos, dado que es la única forma que conoce para ganarse la vida honradamente.  Con muchos deseos de superación decidió solicitar un crédito ya que necesita invertir en la compra de los insumos agrícolas necesarios como: semillas, abonos, insecticidas, fertilizantes, etc. para la siembra. Confía en Dios y en su trabajo que de esta forma logrará  tener una cosecha abundante la cual le permitirá tener  una mejor calidad de vida para él y su familia.
texts.en: Andres is 44 years old and works farming the land. With great dedication he farms the corn and beans which allow him to bring daily sustenance to his home. He characterizes himself as a hardworking, honorable, and responsible man. He lives together with his family, which consists of his wife and his five children. Together with his wife, he works very hard to get his family ahead. Thanks to his knowledge of agriculture, which is his principal source of income and the only honorable way he knows how to make a living, he is able to support his family. Given his great desire to get ahead in life, he decided to request a loan because he needs to purchase the necessary agricultural supplies for his planting such as seeds, compost, insecticides, fertilizers, etc. He trusts in God and in his work that in this way he will reap an abundant harvest which will allow him and his family to have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizer, insecticides, fertilizers, etc.

loans.name: Saiqa

texts.en: Saiqa is a 32-year-old housewife. She lives with her husband and 3 children in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Since 2005, her husband has had been running a general store, and he works very hard to meet his family’s needs. He needs additional capital for the growth of his business as the demands of his clients are increasing day by day. Therefore his wife Saiqa has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan for her husband's store. He will purchase a variety of products including flour, milk packs, eggs, pulses, detergents, oils, etc. to cope up with the increased demands of his clients. Saiqa and her husband are very hopeful that the loan will be a lucky and productive one for their family.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of products to stock in the store.

loans.name: John

texts.en: John is in his late thirties and married with 6 children. They live in Nyarukika, a rural village quite distant from the main trading centers. John entirely depends on livestock farming as his main source of income. He has benefited from cattle rearing so much that he no longer relies only on proceeds from diary sales but also collects organic manure which he uses to fertilize his gardens and at times sells the excess to other farmers. Currently John would like to start substituting his local breed of livestock with a cross breed which does not require a lot of space but at the same time makes high dairy yields. John’s biggest challenge now is that he has inadequate capital to enable him to fulfill his plan so he has applied for a loan of UGX 1,000,000 from UGAFODE Microfinance LTD.

loans.use: to buy a cross breed cow.

loans.name: Christine

texts.en: Christine describes herself as a caring woman. She is a 27-year-old married woman with a 7-year-old child. She is applying for a loan of KES 11,100 that will be used to purchase a water tank. She operates a salon in the Thika area. This project will take 2 weeks to complete.

loans.use: to purchase a water tank.

loans.name: Luzviminda

texts.en: Luzviminda has operated a motorcycle transport business together with her husband for more than 30 years now. This has been the source of their income. Luzviminda is asking for a loan to buy spare parts like wheels and tires and to pay for the repair of the motorcycle. Through this, they will be able to improve their income. Luzviminda dreams of experiencing a fullness of life.

loans.use: to buy spare parts like wheels and tires and to pay for the repair of the motorcycle.

loans.name: Kou

texts.en:
Kou lives in Sanniquelle, the capital city of Nimba County, which is rich in nature resources. Living conditions are much better than in the capital city of Liberia, and is the second largest populated county in Liberia.

Kou is 49 years old. She did not go to school and she is a widow. She has six children and she said she does not know her children's ages and all have not been to school. With a little money from her older children, who sell some of their farm products, it gave her a small amount of money to establish her business. She said, "I learned local soap making from one of my friends, who learned this trade from a vocational school."

Presently she sells palm oil, local soap, etc., and she spends 9 hours on her business, from Monday to Saturday. A problem she faces is small income. She is requesting a loan to purchase more inventory for her business. Her plan is to one day build a shop.

loans.use: to purchase more inventory for her business

loans.name: Constantine

texts.en:
Constantine is married and blessed with six children, who all attend school. He owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expenses are school fees and food.

Over the years, he has operated a meat goat selling business, selling at the market to town dwellers and passersby. He faces a challenge of high cost of transportation for his business. He dreams of expanding his business and establishing a butcher shop in the near future.

With the 30,000 KES, he wants to purchase six goats for resale to boost his business and earn more profit. He joined Yehu because of favorable loaning policies.

loans.use: to purchase six goats for resale to boost his business

loans.name: La Victoire Group

texts.fr: Le groupement LA VICTOIRE est composé de onze membres qui sont des cohabitantes. La présidente de ce groupement, du nom de Pascaline âgée de 60 ans, est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Dans le but de rehausser le niveau de leur activité afin de mieux faire face à la demande de leur clientèle, ce groupement sollicite pour une quatrième fois l'appui financier de ALIDé. Pascaline est mariée à un certain Christophe. Le couple a cinq enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Pascaline et son mari assurent ensemble les charges de ménage. Il y a environs six ans que Pascaline mène comme activité la vente de divers produits (pâtes alimentaires, sucre, etc.) dans une région du Bénin. Pascaline s'approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans le but de renforcer son activité et de satisfaire sa clientèle, Pascaline sollicite un crédit auprès de ALIDé, ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe LA VICTOIRE. Son ambition est de diversifier davantage son activité afin d'accroître son revenu.
texts.en:
The La Victoire group has 11 members who live together. The leader of the group, Pascaline, is 60 years old and has her hand raised in the picture. This group is requesting ALIDé's financial support for the 4th time, in order to increase their business activities so that they can can better meet their customer demand.

Pascaline is married to Christophe. The couple are raising 5 children who all attend school. Pascale and her husband both take care of the household expenses. Pascaline has been selling various products (pasta, sugar, etc.) for around 6 years in a region of Benin. She gets her supplies at a market in Benin. In order to strengthen her business and satisfy her clientèle, Pascaline is requesting a loan from ALIDé, together with the other members of the La Victoire group. Her aim is to further diversify her business so that she can increase her income.

loans.use: to buy various products (pasta, sugar, etc.)

loans.name: Rafael Orlando

texts.es:
Rafael tiene 52 años de edad, esta acompañado y tiene tres hijos. Desde muy pequeño su abuelo le enseño a trabajar en la agricultura; debido a que no se creció con su padre por que lo abandono y se creció con su abuelo. Cuando Rafael tenía 19 años de edad, su abuelo falleció y empezó a trabajar de manera independiente. A los 22 años de edad se caso y formo su propia familia.  Los insumos agrícolas los adquiere a cuatro kilómetros de su casa, debe pagar un vehiculo para que traslade los insumos agrícolas a su casa y de ahí paga una carreta para que los traslade al terreno en donde tiene sus cultivos ya que existe una distancia de un kilómetro.

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar fertilizantes, abonos, semillas para cultivar 14,000 metros cuadrados de maíz. Con el crédito pretende mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia, al recibir mejores ingresos económicos y podrá hacerle unos arreglos a su casa.
texts.en:
Rafael, 52, lives with his partner and three children.  From a very young age he was taught by his grandfather to work in agriculture.  This is because his father abandoned him and he was raised by his grandfather.  His grandfather passed away when Rafael was 19 so he began working independently.  At age 22 he got married and began his family.  He buys farm supplies in a place four kilometers from his house so he has to hire a vehicle to transport the goods back home.  He also hires a cart to take the supplies to his farmland which is a kilometer away from home.

The loan he is requesting through Fundación Campo is to buy fertilizers and seeds to plant 14,000 meters of corn.  With this loan he wants to improve his family's quality of live, since he will have a better income and can renovate part of the house.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and seeds to cultivate 14,000 meters of corn.

loans.name: Loreta

texts.en:
Loreta is a 41-year-old married woman and a mother of three children from Ubay, Bohol. She has been engaged in a farming business, together with her husband, for more than 10 years now. This is the source of their income.

Loreta is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer and pesticides for the farm. Through this, they will be able to improve their farm as well as their harvest. Loreta dreams of making their business a success and sustainable.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticides for the farm

loans.name: Mercedita

texts.en:
This is Mercidita, 45, a resident of Batasan, Quezon City, Philippines. She is married to Elasio and is mother to her children. She, together with her husband, manages their own household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Mercidita operates a buy and sell business. She sells different products like remote controls, Gillette, Mighty Bond and toothbrushes. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of 500 PHP in sales every day.

To help her continue operation of her business, she is requesting a 10,000 PHP loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy additional stock of supplies and products like remote controls, toothbrushes, Gillette, Mighty Bond and other products needed in her business.

Mercidita hopes that her business will continue to grow. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week. That is where she also find strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for additional stock of supplies and products like remote controls, toothbrushes, Gillette, Mighty Bond and other products  needed in her business

loans.name: Veronica Patricia

texts.es:
Verónica, solicita un nuevo préstamo por la necesidad de seguir trabajando en la venta de tortillas; este le permitirá comprar maíz, leña, entre otros para la elaboración  de tortillas; este le ayudara  para tener más inventario disponible y apoyar a su familia con los gastos que se realizan.
El credito anterior le ha ayudado, ya que las condiciones economicas y las circunstancias familiares han mejorado.
texts.en:
Verónica Patricia is requesting a loan so she can continue her work selling tortillas.  This will allow her to buy corn and firewood, as well as other necessities, to make tortillas so she will have more materials on hand and be able to support her family with their expenses.

The previous loan helped her mprove her economic situation and family circumstances.

loans.use: To buy corn, firewood, etc.

loans.name: Baara Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Timinandia   est constitué de 5 femmes toutes mariées, qui ont une moyenne d’âge de 37 ans et 3  enfants. Elles vivent majoritairement dans des familles traditionnelles dans le quartier Heremakono Nord de la ville de Bougouni. 
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, d’amitié et de commerce. Pour renforcer leurs capacités financières afin de mieux faire leur commerce, elles ont adhéré à l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec laquelle elles sont à leur cinquième prêt. Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce de savons à l’image de Mariam, qui est la seule assise. 
Elle compte acheter avec son  prêt,  15 cartons  de savons auprès des grossistes de la place. Elle effectue ses ventes au marché  et à domicile, en détail au comptant et parfois à crédit  à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 42.000FCFA qui sera  investi dans les activités et rembourser le prêt.
texts.en: The Timinandia group is made up of 5 women who are all married and have an average age of 37 and, on average, 3 children. They mostly live in traditional families in the district of Heremakono Nord, Bougouni town. They got to know each other through neighbourly and business relationships and friendships. They joined the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution in order to strengthen their financial capacity so that they can better do business, and are on their 5th loan. This group of women sells soap, like Mariam who is the only woman sitting down. She plans to use her loan to buy 15 boxes of soap from the local wholesalers. She makes her sales at the market and door-to-door for cash and occasionally credit to a clientèle composed of men and women. She expects to make an average monthly profit of 42 000 francs which she will reinvest in her business and use to repay the loan.

loans.use: to buy 15 boxes of soap.

loans.name: José Pedro

texts.es:
José tiene 31 años de edad, es casado  y tiene cuatro hijos. Desde los 10 años de edad, comenzó a trabajar en la tierra, ya de manera independiente fue a los 20 años; fue su padre quien le enseño. Para comprar los insumos agrícolas debe a caminar a pie desde su casa unos treinta minutos y si anda dinero paga transporte para llegar a la ciudad; pero la mayor parte de veces se va caminando hasta la ciudad tarda una hora en llegar. Para trasladar los insumos paga una carreta para que los lleve hasta su casa. 

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar abono, fertilizantes y pago de mano de obra para sembrar. Así, obtendrá cosecha para la alimentación de su familia y para vender el grano para recibir unos ingresos para comprarle ropa y zapatos a su familia, entre otras necesidades que tienen.
texts.en:
José, 31, is married and has four children.  At age ten, he started learning the farming trade from his father and at age 20 became independent.  In order to buy farm supplies he must walk from his house for about 30 minutes and then pay for transportation to get to the city.  Most of the time he walks all the way to the city, though, which takes an hour.    To get the goods back home he has to hire a cart.

The loan his is requesting through Fundación Campo is to buy fertilizers and hire workers for the planting season.  This will allow him to harvest food for his family and also sell grain.  The income will be used to buy clothing, shoes and other necessities for his family.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and hire workers for planting season.

loans.name: Marco Aurelio

texts.es:
Marco Aurelio es el padre de Paula Andrea una joven de 17 años de edad, la cual sueña con convertirse en una gran chef reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Razón por la cual, su padre la apoya para que materialice su sueño. 
Aunque carecen de recursos económicos, esto no ha sido impedimento para que Paula cumpla su deseo, ya que se encuentran recurriendo  a la solicitud de un crédito con el fin de financiar  su capacitación en cocina básica.
texts.en:
Marco Aurelio is Paula Andrea’s father. She is seventeen years old and dreams of being a recognized chef, locally and internationally. For this reason, her father supports her so that she can make her dream come true.

Their lack of economic resources has not been an obstacle to make Paula’s dream come true. They are now requesting a loan with the intention to pay for her training in basic cooking.

loans.use: to pay for his daughter's training in basic cooking.

loans.name: Badegna Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe  Badegna   est constitué de 5 femmes toutes mariées, qui ont une moyenne d’âge de 37  ans et 4  enfants. Elles vivent majoritairement dans des familles traditionnelles dans le quartier Heremakono Nord de la ville de Bougouni. 
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, d’amitié et de commerce. Pour renforcer leurs capacités financières afin de mieux faire leur commerce, elles ont adhéré à l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec laquelle elles sont à leur troisième prêt et tous les deux prêts précédents furent correctement remboursés. Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce de chaussures à l’image de Maïmouna, qui est la seule assise. 
Elle compte acheter avec son  prêt,  3 cartons  de chaussures de différentes sortes  auprès des grossistes de Bamako. Elle effectue ses ventes au marché  et à domicile, en détail au comptant et parfois à crédit  à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 22.000FCFA qui sera  investi dans les activités et rembourser le prêt.
texts.en: The Badegna group is made up of 5 women who are all married and have an average age of 37 and, on average, 4 children. They mostly live in traditional families in the district of Heremakono Nord in Bougouni town. They got to know each other through neighbourly and business relationships and friendships. They joined the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution in order to strengthen their financial capacity so that they can better do business, and are on their 3rd loan. Both previous loans were properly repaid. This group of women sells shoes, like Maïmouna who is the only woman sitting down. She plans to use her loan to buy 3 boxes of different types of shoes from the Bamako wholesalers. She makes her sales at the market and door-to-door for cash and occasionally credit to a retail clientèle made up of men and women. She expects to make an average monthly profit of 22 000 francs which she will reinvest in her business and use to repay the loan.

loans.use: to buy shoes.

loans.name: Eliana

texts.es: Eliana, de 45 años de edad, está casada con Aliardo con quien tiene un hijo de 14 años de edad,juntos viven en su casa propia.Eliana se dedica a la venta de cosméticos los cuales compra por catálogo y los vende entre sus amistades, familiares y conocidas , muchas veces al contado y otras al crédito ,lleva 11 años en esta actividad y hasta el día de hoy a obtenido muy buenos resultados.En esta actividad puede manejar su tiempo libre y obtener buenos ingresos económicos para apoyar a su esposo. Paralelamente vende ropas para niños y niñas los cuales son vendidos por temporadas.Este será el primer préstamo con la Kiva y se siente agradecida por el apoyo financiero que recibe para seguir adelante.Con el monto solicitado de 800 nuevos soles comprará cosméticos y ropa para niños y niñas.
texts.en:
Eliana, 45, is married to Aliardo and they have a 14-year-old son and all live together in their own house.  Eliana sells cosmetics which she buys by catalogue and offers to her friends, relatives and acqaintances on a cash or credit basis.  She has been in business for 11 years and so far has been making a good profit.  In this line of work she is able to manage her free time while obtaining enough income to help her husband.  

She also sells children's clothing depending on the season.  This is her first Kiva loan and she is very grateful for the financial support she is receiving to help her prosper.  She will use the 800 PEN to buy cosmetics and children's clothing.

loans.use: To buy cosmetics and children's clothing.

loans.name: Ihsan

texts.en: Ihsan is a 31-year-old married man. He is an active borrower of BRAC Pakistan. He lives in Lahore, Pakistan with his family. His wife is a very hardworking and responsible housewife. Ihsan has been in the business of selling milk, which is the only source of income for the family. Currently he is in need of purchasing food for buffaloes to feed them but finds it difficult due to financial constrains. Ihsan has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan. He hopes to provide quality education for his children. He is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To purchase food for buffalo.

loans.name: Mukaramkhon

texts.ru:
Мукарамхон трудолюбивая,ответственная,мудрая женщина в возрасти 56 лет. 1998 году с мужем Мукаррамхон произошёл несчастный случай.   После смерти своего мужа все тяготы жизни легли на плечи Мукаррамхон. На иждивении Мукаррамхон имеет одного ребёнка. Чтобы дать хорошее образование своему ребёнку, прокормить его она начала заниматься оптовой продажей риса.     Рис покупает из местного населения и продаёт на местном рынке. Этот вид деятельности дает очень хорошую прибыль и Мукарамхон очень довольна что занимается этим делом.
На полученный кредит   Мукаррамхон планирует закупить несколько мешков риса и увеличить свой товарооборот.      Мукаррамхон очень благодарна  организации Арванд  и надеется на  поддержку.
texts.en:
Mukaramkhon is a hardworking, responsible and wise woman who is 56 years old. In 1998 Mukaramkhon's husband had an accident. After the death of her husband all life's difficulties were laid on her shoulders. Mukaramkhon has one child. She began to sell rice in wholesale to give good education to her child. She buys rice from the locals and sells it on the local market. This business gives Mukaramkhon good income and she is very satisfied that she does this business.

She plans to use the loan to buy several bags of rice and increase her sales volume. Mukaramkhon is very thankful to the Arvand organization and is hoping for support.

loans.use: to buy several bags of rice.

loans.name: Dilafruz

texts.ru: Дилафрузу 31 год. Она замужем и живет со своей семьей в городе Душанбе. У Дилафруз среднее образование. Она умеет вышивать женские национальные платья и теперь хотела бы начать эту деятельность. Дилафруз планирует принимать заказы у себя дома и в день вышивать одно простое платье и одно платье с вышивкой. Чтобы реализовать свою цель она обратилась за кредитом. Дилафруз просит кредит для приобретения компьютерной швейной машины. Она очень надеется на Вашу поддержку!
texts.en: Dilafruz is 31 years old. She is married and lives with her family in the city of Dushanbe. Dilafruz has secondary education. She can sew women's traditional dresses and now wants to start her own business. Dilafruz plans to take orders at home and sew one simple dress a day and one dress with embroidery. To realize her goal she has come for a loan. Dilafruz is asking for a loan to buy a computerized sewing machine. She hopes for your support very much!

loans.use: to buy a computerized sewing machine.

loans.name: Boutsomé

texts.fr: Revendeuse de produits congelés depuis 2000, Boutsomé est âgée de 40ans. Elle est mariée à un revendeur et a 04 enfants tous scolarisés. L’ainé a 17ans et le dernier 04ans. Son activité se fait dans une boutique et elle est aidée par une personne. Pour renforcer son commerce, elle sollicite son quatrième crédit à WAGES pour atteindre son objectif.  Comme perspectives d’avenir, elle espère multiplier les boutiques et assurer les besoins primaires de la famille.
texts.en:
Boutsomé is 40 years old and has been selling frozen food products since 2000. She is married to a retailer and has four children, all in school. The oldest child is 17 years old and the youngest is 4 years old. 

Boutsomé conducts her business in a shop and is helped by one person. To reach her goal of strengthening her business, she is asking for her fourth loan with WAGES. 

In the future, Boutsomé hopes to open multiple shops and to ensure the basic needs of her family.

loans.use: to buy frozen food products

loans.name: Rosalia Isabel

texts.es:
Rosalia es una mujer de 35 años, es soltera, vive en la ciudad de Camaná, ella es una persona muy amable, trabajadora y entusiasta, que dedica todos sus esfuerzos por salir adelante; lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos y por la necesidad que tuvo de trabajar desde muy joven para ayudar a sus padres, Rosalia no pudo estudiar la carrera profesional de Agronomía que deseaba, en sus ratos libres le gusta ver películas y en algunas ocasiones cocina un riquísimo Seco de Pollo para compartir con su familia.
Por iniciativa propia, con mucho empeño y dedicación, Rosalia se dedica a la agricultura, ella tiene una pequeña parcela donde cultiva frejoles, ella trabaja todos los días por un aproximado de 10 horas, realiza labores de campo y cree que le va bien por su experiencia y por el trato amable que brinda a los demás.
Rosalia se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá cubrir los gastos de abono, riego y cosecha de su cultivo, de esta manera Rosalia podrá asegurar que su cultivo se desarrolle adecuadamente, así pues ella seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de ampliar sus cultivos.
texts.en:
Rosalía, 35, is single and lives in the city of Camaná.  She is a kind, hard-working, enthusiastic person who makes every effort to get ahead.  Unfortunately, due to a lack of economic resources and the need to work from a very young age to help her parents, Rosalía was not able to get the Agronomy degree she would have liked.  In her free time she enjoys watching movies and sometimes even cooks a delicious chicken stew to share with family.

On her own initiative and with much determination and dedication, Rosalia works in agriculture.  She owns a small patch of land where she grows beans and works about ten hours a day on her field chores.  She believes things are going well because of her experience and kindness toward others.

Rosalia is very grateful to Kiva lenders because thanks to your help she will be able to pay for fertilizer, irrigation and harvest costs.  This will insure that her crop develops the way it should, allowing her to continue working and striving toward her goal of expanding her plantation.

loans.use: To pay for fertilizer, irrigation and harvest costs.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 50 years old and she lives in Sanniquelle, the capital city of Nimba County, which is rich in natural resources, where living conditions are much better than the capital city of Liberia, and which is the second largest populated county in Liberia. She did not go to school and she grew up in a rural area of Sanniquelle. Traditionally, she is married, and her husband is a carpenter. They have seven children who were born between 1979  to 1990. Three of her children are in school and live at home.

Ten years ago, Mary received a small amount of money from her husband to establish her business, and since then she has been running a small local shop where she makes and sells local soap and palm oil, etc. She spends 10 hours a day on her business, from Monday to Saturday. Because one of the problems she faces is a small income, she is requesting a loan to purchase more inventory for her business. Her plan is one day to build a modern house.

loans.use: to purchase more inventory for her business.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margeret is married. They live at their own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. 

For years, she has operated a food stall business, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of price fluctuation in her business. She dreams of establishing a big shop in the future. 

With the Kshs 10,000 she wants to purchase one bundle of wheat flour, cooking fat and sugar. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase one bundle of wheat flour, cooking fat and sugar.

loans.name: Gordeous

texts.en:
Gordeous is a resident of Nyamiyaga, who after school, like any other educated person, had big plans for his life. He tried several job hunts but later on realized that life was not a bed of roses. When he married and later got two children, he immediately sought a job as a school security guard, which his former schoolmates discouraged him from doing. However, he was determined to make life meaningful. 

Two years later Gordeous embarked on a piggery project which turned all the odds into a bright future. He now owns a cycle taxi, a permanent house and his children are attending good schools. All his achievements have been attributed to hard work and being focused.

Currently, Gordeous is overwhelmed by the demand for pork and piglets, so he has applied for a loan of UGX 1,000,000 from UGAFODE to improve on his project so as to meet the demands of his customers effectively. He will buy more piglets for raising and then selling.

loans.use: To buy more piglets for raising and then selling.

loans.name: Marivic

texts.en: Marivic runs a sari-sari or variety store business in her place, selling various goods and items to the people there. She is a married woman and has three children. She is asking for a loan to buy more stock to sell like canned goods, candies, noodles, soda, soap and toiletries, rice and others. Through this, she will be able to improve her sales as well as her profit. Marivic hopes to earn more so that she will be able to support her children's schooling.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell like canned goods, candies, noodles, soda, soap and toiletries, rice and others.

loans.name: Mbeyu

texts.en: Mbeyu is taking out another Kiva loan of Kes 35,000. The previous loan enabled her double her monthly income which has been of great help to her family.  With the new loan she wants to expand her business further by purchasing bales of clothes for resale.

loans.use: to purchase bales of clothes for resale.

loans.name: Fatou's Group

texts.fr:
Ce banc villageois abritant le groupe a été créé le 24/07/2006.Il est composé de 7 femmes qui habitent la même localité et ont de bonnes relations sociales; Fatou est la représentante du groupe et a tendu sa main sur la photo; elle est marié et mère de 4 enfants dont 2 filles ,son ainé a 21 ans et son cadet 11 ans.Elle fait du commerce de tissu et de vaisselle.Avec son prêt elle compte acheter 25 pièces de tissu wax,15 pièces de  tissu khartoum,5 pièces de tissu bazin tient, et 4 carton de vaisselles.Elle expose sa marchandise dans sa boutique au marché et a une bonne expérience pour l'avoir fait depuis bientôt 10 ans.
Avec ses bénéfices elle prend en charge les besoins de scolarisation de ses enfants et certaines dépenses de la maison.
texts.en:
This banc villageois was created 24 July 2006. It is made up of seven women who all live in the same area and who all share good social relations. 

Fatou is the representative of the group and has her hand raised in the photo. She is married and a mother of four children, two of whom are girls. Her oldest child is 21 years old and her youngest is 11 years old. 

Fatou sells fabrics and crockery. With this loan, she plans on buying 25 lengths of Wax fabric, 15 lengths of khartoum fabric, 5 lengths of damask fabric, and 4 boxes of dishes. 

She displays her merchandise in a stall at a market and has been doing this for almost ten years. 

With the earnings, she will ensure her children's school-related needs and take care of some of the household expenses.

loans.use: to buy fabrics and crockery

loans.name: Shabir

texts.en:
Shabir is a 27-year-old man who lives with his family in Lahore, Pakistan. Since 2005 Shabir has been running his own hotel near his house, which is a very successful business for his family. He is an active borrower of BRAC Pakistan. 

He is currently in need of purchasing some products for his hotel including beans, eggs, and mutton for cooking. Due to financial constraints, he finds it difficult to purchase these items. Therefore, he has requested a loan from Kiva's partner, BRAC Pakistan. This will not only help him to grow his business but will also increase his net income and savings. He is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy beans, eggs, and mutton for cooking.

loans.name: Ramon

texts.en:
This is Ramon, 65, a resident of Batasan, Quezon City, Philippines. He is married to Elizabeth who is in a buy and sell business, and a father to his children. He and his wife manage their household while operating the business.

Ramon’s business venture is a small computer and arcade shop. In the Philippines especially in urban poor communities, not all families can afford to buy personal computers, portable play stations, or equipments for video games. Children only enjoy this kind of amusement by renting at computer arcades and they pay per hour of usage. Ramon has several arcade units and he earns Php 400 per day. He also has an apartment for additional income.

To help him continue running his business, he is requesting a Php 30,000 loan. He will be utilizing the loan to buy spare parts and for the maintenance of his computer shop business. 

Ramon hopes to be able to grow his business in the coming years. He dreams of helping his family and have a deeper relationship with God. He meets up with his co-fellowship* members to share stories of his work every week and where he can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for spare parts and maintenance of his computer shop business.

loans.name: María Amparo

texts.es: Amparo de 48 años de edad, es una mujer emprendedora y una gran guerrera. Tiene dos hijos menores de edad, por lo cuales lucha a fin de garantirles educación de calidad y mejores oportunidades de vida. Se dedica al oficio de la confección en su tiempo libre debido a que labora en un restaurante. En la actualidad se encuentra solicitando un crédito para capacitarse en cocina básica y poder mejorar la calidad del servicio en su trabajo, lo que le permitirá ser más competente y lograr un ascenso.
texts.en: Amparo is 48 years old and is a very enterprising and feisty woman.  She has two children (both under 18 years old) and she fights every day so that she can guarantee them a good upbringing and better opportunities in life.  Amparo works in a restaurant and sews in her free time.  Amparo is currently applying for a loan in order to do basic training in cooking and to improve the quality of service so offers in her work.  This will give her more skills and give her the chance for a promotion.

loans.use: to pay for basic training in cooking.

loans.name: María Isabel

texts.es:
Isabel de 43 años de edad, es una mujer de negocios, la cual se proyecta como una gran empresaria. Atiende eventos sociales en su localidad y gracias al desarrollo de su actividad puede brindarle a su hijo de 15 años de edad una calidad de vida digna. 
Con el fin de montar una panadería como actividad alterna para mejorar sus ingresos, Isabel se encuentra solicitando un crédito para capacitarse en la elaboración de panes y obtener una mayor productividad. 
Sueña con mejorar su condición económica y garantizarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Isabel is 43 years old and a businesswoman who presents herself as a great entrepreneur.  She attends social events in her local area and, thanks to her work, she is able to provide her 15-year-old son with a decent quality of life.

In order to start her own bread shop to generate another source of income, Isabel is applying for a loan to pay for training in bread-making and to improve her productivity.

Isabel dreams of improving her finances and guaranteeing a better quality of life to her family.

loans.use: to pay for training in bread-making.

loans.name: Noreen

texts.en:
Noreen is a 34-year-old woman. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan with her family. She is a mother of 2 children. She owns a small embroidery business in her house. Her embroidery cloths are liked by everyone. Presently her stock of embroidery materials is almost finished; therefore, she is interested in purchasing a variety of embroidery materials, including colorful threads, beads, stones, needles and fabrics.

For that purpose Noreen has requested a loan from Kiva's partner, BRAC Pakistan. She is hopeful that the loan will be a productive one for her business. With the profit amount she wants to construct her own house. She hopes that she will earn sufficient profit so that she could easily pay back the loan amount as well as construct her house. She is feeling very happy after taking the loan because this will help her to fulfill her needs.

loans.use: To purchase embroidery materials.

loans.name: Marlou

texts.en: Marlou is a jeepney driver from Ubay, Bohol. Jeepneys are the most common public transportation in the Philippines. Marlou needs a loan for his business. He is requesting a loan to buy spare parts like wheels, tires, nuts and bolts, and to pay for the repair of the vehicle. Through this, he will be able to improve his business and maintain the good working condition of the vehicle. Marlou dreams of making his business a success.

loans.use: to buy spare parts like wheels, tires, nuts and bolts, and to pay for the repair of the vehicle.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en: Josephine is 44 years old and married with three children. To support her husband in making a living, she has opted to engage in a hog-raising business. With this activity, she typically generates an income of PHP 1,500 per hog. Since Josephine wants to further grow her business, she is requesting a loan of PHP 12,000. She will use the amount to buy feed and vitamins for her raised hog.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins.

loans.name: Matia

texts.en:
Matia is married and has four school-going children. He is a renowned brewer of potent gin. He learned this trade from his aging father. Matia says that  the reason his product is in high demand is that his brew is made from natural ingredients and has no additives, unlike others on the market.

His main business challenge is that he sells his product to distributors (middle men) who often dilute his product and/or add artificial ingredients. This discredits his brand and his product in the long run. 

Matia now plans to bypass these distributors and sell his local brew directly to consumers, who will pay him fair prices.

In order to fulfill his dream, he has applied for a loan of UGX 1,000,000 from UGAFODE Microfinance. He hopes he will be able to brew more gin with the money and therefore increase his income.

loans.use: To brew more gin.

loans.name: Genadi

texts.en:
Genadi, who is 40 years old, lives in the small village of Akho with his wife and two sons, ages 8 and 13. Genadi has requested a loan from local financial institutions several times so he can start a family business. However, he has not met with success. His loan requests were rejected because of his low income and his family’s poor living conditions. 

The family owns a vineyard and a plot of agricultural land, where fruits and vegetables are grown. They also have a milk cow. Genadi’s wife milks the cow every day to produce dairy products. From the harvested grapes, Genadi makes wine. The family sells the wine, harvested products and dairy products to the villagers and at the local markets. 

Genadi has requested a loan from Credo to start a family business. Genadi has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans to rural poor people who do not have access to credit products. These rural poor people are regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of their low income. 

With his loan, Genadi will purchase inventory to open a pub. He already has a commercial space to use as a bar. Genadi will purchase all the needed materials and inventory and his wife will work there. This will enable the family to generate additional income. This new business initiative, financed with the Kiva start-up loan, will significantly improve the family's living conditions.

loans.use: To purchase inventory to open a pub.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: cover the cost of the complete university course.

loans.name: Anzor

texts.en:
Anzor is 47 years old. He lives in the Batumi district with his 43 year old wife, three sons (Gela, Gocha, and Guram), daughter in-law and retired father. Anzor requested loans from local financial institutions several times for a family business start-up, but without any success. His loan request was rejected all the time, because of low income and the family’s poor living conditions. 

The family's main source of the income is monthly salaries and pensions. Gela is a taxi driver and earns a small daily income. Gocha is working in the military and Guram is an invalid and gets a monthly pension from the local government institutions. Additional family income is Anzor’s father’s monthly pension.
 
Anzor requested a loan from Credo to start up a family business. He has now been approved for a loan within the framework of the new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages the provision of business start-up and re-startup credits, with soft conditions to rural poor people who do not have access to credit products. These rural poor people are regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of their low income. 

With his credit, Anzor will renovate his new apartment to rent it out. He will purchase all the needed materials and pay the workers. As Batumi is a popular district for summer season, not only for locals but also for foreigners, the apartments for renting are highly requested in season. Anzor will renovate his apartment and rent it out to have additional income for his big family. With the increased income he will be able to provide better living conditions for his invalid son and retired father, both of whom need a lot of support due to their conditions.

loans.use: To renovate his new apartment to rent it out.

loans.name: Naila

texts.en:
Naila is a 25-year-old young, energetic and hardworking woman. She is living in Rawalpindi, Pakistan along her husband. Her husband is an auto mechanic by profession and his monthly income is not enough to meet the household expenses. 

Naila wants to educate her children in good schools so that they can have a bright future. Currently she can’t send them to good schools due to the financial constraints because of which she is very worried about their future. She has requested a loan from Kiva’s partner BRAC Pakistan. 

She is a very skilled woman and she wants to open a beauty parlor in her house to generate an alternative source of income for her family. She would purchase cosmetic products like lipsticks, creams, facial scrubs, makeup kits, etc. and would also purchase some chairs for her salon. She is very hopeful for this loan as she could start her business from this loan. She would spend the profit amount on the education of her children and to pay her loan installments.

loans.use: To purchase beauty products.

loans.name: Narcisa

texts.en: Narcisa earns a living through her sari-sari or variety store. She has been in this business for more than 30 years now. Her stock is primarily food such as canned goods, noodles, biscuits and snack foods. Narcisa is asking for a loan to buy additional groceries for the store such as noodles, biscuits, snack foods, sodas, beverages, soap and toiletries. By adding new inventory to her store, she will be able to attract more buyers and increase her profits.

loans.use: to buy additional groceries for her store such as noodles, biscuits, snack foods, sodas, beverages, soap and toiletries.

loans.name: Sajida

texts.en:
Sajida is a 49-year-old married woman and an enterprising woman with many dreams to fulfill. She lives in the area of Rawalpindi, Pakistan. She has been in the business of selling clothes for almost 4 years. She purchases clothes from different areas and sells them in the main market for a profitable amount. 

Sajida is a responsible mother of three children. Her husband makes his living as a daily worker whose income is not sufficient to meet the needs of the family members. She faced many problems in her early married life; there were days when her children often slept without having any food. But now her contribution to the family income is playing a vital role in fulfilling the needs of the family members. 

To cope with the increasing demand during the summer season, she has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan to purchase a variety of clothing in different colors. She hopes to get an increase in her net income and wishes to spend part of the profits on the improvement of her house. She is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To purchase a variety of clothing.

loans.name: Guram

texts.en:
Guram is 51 years old. He lives in the small village of Martvili District with his wife and son. Guram requested loans from local financial institutions several times for a family business start-up but without any success. His loan request was rejected all the time because of low income and the family’s poor living conditions. 

The only source of income for the family is from agricultural activities. In particular, they have 3 milking cows whose milk is used in cheese production. Besides, they have a plot of agricultural land where 400 nut trees are grown. They sell the harvested nuts at local markets at a good price. It is hardly enough for food for the family. According to Credo estimations, the family belongs to the subsistence poor category. 

Guram requested a loan from Credo to start up a family business. He has now been approved for a loan within the framework of the new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages the provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to rural poor people who do not have access to credit products. These rural poor people are regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of their low income. 

With his credit Guram will open an auto repair workshop. After the workshop is opened, Guram will repair cars and increase the income of his family. The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva Start-up loan, will significantly improve the living conditions of the family.

loans.use: to open an auto repair workshop.

loans.name: Nelfa

texts.en: Nelfa earns a living through her sari-sari or variety store business selling various goods and items to the people in her place in Ubay, Bohol. Nelfa is asking for a loan to buy more stock to sell like canned goods, candies, sugar, noodles, soap, toiletries and others. With this, she will be able to attract more buyers to her store.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell like canned goods, candies, sugar, noodles, soap, toiletries and others.

loans.name: Nerissa

texts.en: Nerissa is a farmer from the town of Ubay, Bohol. She has been engaged in this business for more than 5 years now. She is a married woman and a mother of two children. Nerissa is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer and pesticides for the farm and sacks for storage. Through this, she will be able to improve her farm as well as her harvest.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticides for the farm and sacks for storage.

loans.name: Raquel

texts.en: Raquel runs a sari-sari or variety store business selling various goods and items. She lives with her husband and two children in Ubay, Bohol. Raquel is asking for a loan to buy canned goods, soda, noodles, beverages, soap, detergents and others. With this, she will be able to attract more buyers in her store and augment her sales and income. In the future, Raquel hopes to make her business a success and a sustainable source of income.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, soda, noodles, beverages, soap, detergents and others.

loans.name: Bernice's Group

texts.en:
Bernice's group consists of some married women and one widow. These women are, on average, 48 years old and have children. They all live in extended traditional families in the neighborhood of Teshie, in the greater Accra region.

The members of the group know one another through family, neighborhood and friendship ties. They sell doughnuts, 'gari' (made from cassava tubers, it is similar to potato flour), rubber bowls, sachet water, jeans and cassava dough. They are on their fifth group loan with ID-Ghana.

Bernice is a 39-year-old jeans seller. She is planning to buy two bales of used clothing from wholesalers in Accra. She will resell her merchandise to a retail customer base consisting of both men and women.

She is expecting to make an average monthly profit of GHC 100, which will be used to meet the needs of her family. A part of her profits will also be reinvested in her business. 

They need a total of GHC 3,600 to be able to expand their businesses.

loans.use: To buy jeans and sell them to customers.

loans.name: Amtul's Group

texts.en:
Amtul  is a 33-year-old woman who is living in Punjab, Pakistan, with her husband and three children. 

Since 2000, her husband has been running a handbag shop, which is the only source of income for their family. They belong to a poor family and his income is inadequate to run the household. 

As a member of a three-person lending group, Amtul has requested a loan from Kiva's partner Brac Pakistan. The loan will help her husband to purchase rexine (leathercloth) and canvas sheets to make bags to sell. As they have no other source of income, with the help of this loan, her husband will be able to grow his business. 

Amtul dreams of the higher education of her children. She hopes that the financial issues of her family will resolve soon and she can start putting aside savings for her children's education. She is grateful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To purchase rexine and canvas sheets for making handbags.

loans.name: Sahei Group

texts.en: Nemneilhing's husband used to teased her by saying, “If you marry me, you will have to learn how to raise chickens.” Newly married, Nemneilhing is raising chickens now along with her husband! She belongs to Sahei JLG Group and she represents the featured borrower for the group. She is pictured with her hand raised. Poultry is a family business for Nemneilhing’s in-laws. Her in-laws have now handed over the responsibility for raising chickens to Nemneilhing, and she is working hard to make more profits than before. Nemneilhing and her husband both work side by side to make their chicken poultry farm a flourishing and successful one. She feeds them and also takes care of them. Since the family’s main source of income is through selling the chickens, Nemneilhing also learns all the possible tips for raising chickens. She is very interested and hopeful that she will do great. The challenging parts, she says, are that the feeds are bought from the market, which is costly, and when the poultry is infected with contagious diseases. The loss is huge because the village is far from the city, and veterinary doctors can’t reach them easily. The chickens are sold for profit when they are fully grown. They are sold in the village and in the neighbouring villages as well. Her husband usually takes the chickens to the town market too. With this Kiva loan, she will purchase 100 more chickens. She says the income from the poultry business is the only source of income for the family, and it is not sufficient to manage the household expenses and run the business. She is glad that Kiva and WSDS are providing financial aid to help her raise more chickens and make more profit. The rest of the group members have a piggery and vegetable selling business.

loans.use: to purchase 100 more chicks to raise and sell for profit.

loans.name: Tamaz

texts.en:
Tamaz is 32 years old. He lives in the small village of Terjola District with his wife, son, parents, brother, daughter-in-law and two cousins. Tamaz requested a loan from local financial institutions several times for family business start-up, but without any success. His loan request was rejected all the time, because of low income and family’s poor living conditions. 

The only source of income for the family is from agricultural activities. In particular, they have 4 milk cows and 4 calves, whose milk is used in cheese products. Besides that, they have a vineyard with 450 grapevines and a 0.9 hectare plot of land where different kinds of vegetables are grown. It is hardly enough for food for the family. According to Credo estimations, the family belongs to the subsistence poor category. 

Tamaz requested a loan from Credo to start-up a family business. Tamaz has now been approved for a loan within the framework of the new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to rural poor people, who do not have access to credit products. These rural poor people are regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of their low income. 

With his loan Tamaz will purchase a minibus. After the minibus is purchased, he will get orders to transport cargo and can generate income.  This will increase the income of his family. The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva Start-up loan, will significantly improve the living conditions of the family.

loans.use: to purchase a minibus and get orders to transport cargo

loans.name: Rodella

texts.en:
Rodella runs a halo-halo stall in her place in Ubay, Bohol. Halo-halo is a popular dessert in the Philippines. It is made of shaved ice, milk, fruit and other sweet ingredients. This is the source of Rodella's income. 

Rodella is asking for a loan to buy more ingredients for her halo-halo business like milk, sugar, fruit and others. Through this, she will be able to improve her stall and augment her income.

loans.use: to buy more ingredients for her halo-halo (dessert) business like milk, sugar, fruit and others

loans.name: Eldar

texts.en:
Eldar is 24 years old. He lives in Varsimaani village, Dusheti district, with his 64-year-old father, retired mother, retired grandmother, brother Dimitri and sister Eter. Eldar requested a loan from local financial institutions several times for family business start-up, but without any success. His loan request was rejected all the time, because of low income and the family’s poor living conditions. 

Eldar’s parents are working at a local government office on small monthly salaries. His sister Eter is working at a local shop. His brother is an invalid and gets a monthly pension from local government institutions. Additional family income comes from Eldar’s grandmother’s monthly pension. 

Eldar requested loan from Credo to start-up family business. Eldar has now been approved for a loan within the framework of the new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to rural poor people, who do not have access to credit products. These rural poor people are regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of their low income. 

With his credit Eldar will purchase car washing equipment. He wants to start a car washing business. For this business he will use the space in the family garden. After purchasing the equipment, Eldar will wash the cars himself and earn additional income for the family to support them and provide better living conditions.

loans.use: To purchase car washing equipment and start a car wash business

loans.name: Wey

texts.en:
Wey lives in Montserrado County, the capital city of Liberia. It is well known as the commercial city  of Liberia. She is 24 years old and married with a two-year-old child, who is in school and lives at home.

 For the past ten years Wey has been selling dried fish in the community market. She started this business with the help of her husband and learned this way of selling from her mother. She spends 8 hours at her business and she uses a taxi most of the time to get her goods to her table. She said about herself: I am business-minded, and I like my business because it gives me more profit. She is requesting a loan to buy more dried fish to expand her sales. She wants to get more money to educate her child.

loans.use: to buy more dried fish to expand her sales

loans.name: Silvestre

texts.en:
Silvestre runs a 'sari-sari' or variety store in his place in CPG, Bohol. He has been in the business for more than 15 years now. This is the source of his income. 

Silvestre is asking for a loan to buy more stock like rice, canned goods, candies, sugar, noodles and other items. In the future, Silvestre has hopes of making his business a success.

loans.use: to buy more stock like rice, canned goods, candies, sugar, noodles and other items

loans.name: Claudia Inés

texts.es:
Claudia Inés de 30 años de edad, es una mujer humilde y de escasos recursos económicos, debido a la dificultad para emplearse por su condición educativa, optó por montar su propio negocio y generar ingresos para el sostenimiento de su familia. Se dedica a la venta de comidas rápidas en el sector donde reside. Diariamente comienza su faena de cinco de la mañana a seis de la tarde. 
Su mayor preocupación es la pobreza en la que vive, razón por la cual desea trabajar fuertemente y brindarle a su familia mejores condiciones de vida. 
Hoy se encuentra solicitando un crédito que invertirá en la compra de una vitrina calentadora y surtido, con el propósito de aumentar su ventas y mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Claudia Inés is 30 years old.  She is a humble woman of limited financial resources due to her difficulties finding work with her educational condition.  She decided to start her own business and generate income to support her family.  She sells fast food in the area where she lives.  She works from 5:00am until 6:00pm.

Her biggest worry is the poverty in which she lives, which makes her want to work hard and provide better living conditions for her family.  She is requesting this loan to purchase a warming display and stock so that she can increase her sales and improve her profits.

loans.use: to purchase a warming display and stock.

loans.name: Tita

texts.en:
Tita has been engaged in a motorcycle transport business together with her husband for more than six years . This is the source of their income. 

Tita is asking for a loan to buy spare parts like wheels, tires, fuel and nuts and bolts. Through this, they will be able to improve the working condition of the motorcycle and augment their income.

loans.use: to buy spare parts like wheels, tires, fuel and nuts and bolts

loans.name: Ramaz

texts.en:
Ramaz is 47 years old. He lives in the small village of Terjola District with his wife, two children, daughter-in-law and an infant grandchild. Ramaz requested a loan from local financial institutions several times for family business start-up, but without any success. His loan request was rejected all the time, because of low income and the family’s poor living conditions. 

The only source of income for the family is from agricultural activities. In particular, they have 4 milk cows, whose milk is used in cheese products. Besides, they have a vineyard with 400 grapevines and a hectare plot of land where different kinds of vegetables are grown. They sell the harvested products and cheese locally. It is hardly enough for food for the family. According to Credo estimations, the family belongs to the subsistence poor category. 

Ramaz requested a loan from Credo to start-up a family business. Ramaz has now been approved for a loan within the framework of the new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to rural poor people, who do not have access to credit products. These rural poor people are regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of their low income. 

With his credit Ramaz will build a greenhouse. After the greenhouse is built, they will grow tomatoes and greens there. They will sell the harvested tomatoes and greens at local markets. This will increase the income of their family. The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva Start-up loan, will significantly improve the living conditions of the family.

loans.use: to build a greenhouse and sow tomatoes and greens

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en: Victoria runs a 'sari-sari' or variety store business in her place in CPG, Bohol. Victoria is asking for a loan to buy more stock to sell like canned goods, rice, seasonings and cooking ingredients, snack foods, sodas and beverages, soap and detergents. With this, she will be able to improve her store and cater for more buyers thus augmenting her sales and income.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell like canned goods, rice, seasonings and cooking ingredients, snack foods, sodas and beverages, soap and detergents

loans.name: Virginio

texts.en: Virginio is a fisherman from the town of Ubay, Bohol. He is a married man and has been in the business for more than 15 years now. Virginio is asking for a loan to buy fishing nets, lead weights and paint for the boat. Through this, he will be able to improve his catch, thus giving him more fish to sell in the market. Virginio has hopes of making his business a stable source of income.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets, lead weights and paint for the boat

loans.name: Marlon Jose

texts.es:
Marlon,38 años de edad, casado, tiene un hijo de 12 años de edad el y su familia habitan en la ciudad de Granada, él se dedica a fabricar muebles actividad que realiza desde los 25 años empezó como ayudante en un taller cerca de su casa poco a poco fue adquiriendo experiencia desde aprender a cortar, limpiar y pulir la madera hasta lograr elaborar diferentes tipos de muebles. En la actualidad él tiene su pequeño taller donde tiene dos ayudantes que le apoyan en hacer los pedidos. 
Él está requiriendo el crédito para comprar madera, pegamento, pintura, sener, lija para pulir la madera. El crédito le permitirá tener materia prima para elaborar los pedidos que tiene de puertas y ventanas. Quiere ampliar su taller poder dar empleo a más jóvenes que desean aprender asi como el empezó.
texts.en:
Marlon is 38 years old, married, and has a 12 year old child.  He and his family live in the city of Granada.  Marlon has worked making furniture for 25 years.  He started as an assistant in a workshop close to his home and little by little acquired experience from learning to cut, clean, and sand the wood to being able to make different types of furniture.  Currently he has his own small workshop where he has two assistants who help him fulfill the orders.

He is requesting this loan to purchase wood, glue, paint, paint thinner, and sandpaper to finish the wood.  This loan will allow him to have materials to make the orders he has for doors and windows.  He wants to expand his workshop to give employment to more young people who wants to learn just like how he started.

loans.use: to purchase wood, glue, paint, paint thinner, and sandpaper to finish the wood.

loans.name: George

texts.en:
36-year-old George lives in Zestaponi district with his retired father. George requested a loan from local financial institutions several times for family business start-up, but without any success. His loan request was rejected all the time, because of low income and the family’s poor living conditions.
 
The family owns a vineyard. From the harvested grapes George makes wine and sells it locally at the markets to earn a small monthly income. Their additional income is George’s father’s monthly pension. 

George requested a loan from Credo to start-up family business. George has now been approved for a loan within the framework of the new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to rural poor people, who do not have access to credit products. These rural poor people are regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of their low income. 

With his credit George will open a butcher shop. He will purchase refrigerators, a packing machine and all the needed products. In his shop George will be selling fresh meat as well as frozen meat products.  He has a commercial space in a populous area. It will help his shop to have good numbers of customers. George will work hard and long hours to make his business successful and profitable. Part of the profit will be used for reinvesting in the same business and another part for improving family living conditions.

loans.use: To open a butcher shop

loans.name: Francisco

texts.es:
Francisco es un joven de 23 años de edad, que busca alternativas para salir adelante y colaborarle a su madre con los gastos del hogar. Motivado por algunos amigos decidió dedicarse a  la venta de ropa, actividad, que le ha permitido mejorar su calidad de vida. 
Su mayor deseo es ingresar a la universidad y graduarse como un gran profesional. 
En la actualidad se encuentra solicitando un crédito que invertirá en la compra de mercancía con el fin aumentar sus ventas y reunir el dinero que necesita para comenzar sus estudios.
texts.en:
Francisco is a 23 year-old young man who is looking for a way to make a good life for himself and help his mother with the household expenses. Following the advice of some friends of his, he decided to start selling clothing - which has allowed him to improve his quality of life.
His greatest wish is to go to college and graduate to become a successful professional.
He is currently requesting a loan to invest in the purchase of merchandise with the aim of increasing his sales and getting enough money together to be able to start his studies.

loans.use: to buy clothing to sell.

loans.name: María Leonor

texts.es:
María de 42 años de edad, es madre de un hijo y desde hace algunos años se separó de su cónyuge. Motivo por el cual ha debido trabajar incansablemente para garantizarle a su hijo educación y mejores oportunidades de vida.
Cuenta que hace algún tiempo creo un negocio, pero fracasó quedando en banca rota debido al poco conocimiento que tenía del mercado y la competencia. Hoy desea iniciar nuevamente con su proyecto de empresa de confección, por lo cual se encuentra solicitando un crédito para recibir asesoría en la creación de su empresa y no cometer los errores de su primera experiencia. 
Espera que poder aprender bases sólidas sobre la administración, costos de producción y ventas.
texts.en:
María is 42 years old and has one son. She has been separated from her husband for some years now, which is why she has had to work tirelessly to give her son a good education and better opportunities in life. She says that she started her own business some time ago, but that it failed and ended in bankruptcy because she did not know enough about the market and competition.

Today María would like to start again with her own business making clothing. She is requesting a loan to receive professional advice and training in the creation of her business, because she does not want to make the same mistakes she did the first time. She hopes to gain a solid basis in business administration, production costs, and sales.

loans.use: to pay for professional advice and training in the creation of her own clothing making business.

loans.name: Mónica Patricia

texts.es:
Mónica tiene 40 años de edad, se dedica a la venta de jugos desde hace más de cinco años, actividad que le permite adquirir los recursos para su sostenimiento. Con el fin de mejorar la calidad en el servicio y aumentar su nivel de ventas, se encuentra solicitando un crédito para capacitarse en conservas de frutas. 
Sueña con tener un gran negocio dedicado a la venta de alimentos, mejorar sus condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Mónica is 40 years old. She has sold juices for more than five years. This business allows her to acquire resources for supporting herself. In order to improve the quality of her service and increase her sales, she is requesting a loan to get training on preserving fruit. 
She dreams about having a big business selling food and improving her quality of life.

loans.use: with preserved fruit training.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: El cliente  vive junto a su esposa y su hijo en casa propia, él se dedica al cultivo de maíz y frijol  desde hace 6  años y ha ganado experiencia valiosa que le permite obtener las mejores cosechas, el terreno donde siembra esta ubicado en una zona de alta incidencia agrícola, y muy cercano a su vivienda, cuando su cosecha ya esta lista la almacena en los graneros o sacos que muestra la fotografía,  comercia en todos los alrededores de la comunidad y se ha hecho de mucha clientela que lo prefieren porque todo lo que vende es de primera calidad, a precios accesibles y con un buen servicio, el desea realizar una nueva inversión que le permita aumentar la producción por eso solicita un crédito que le permita comprar: semilla, fertilizantes, abonos, herbicidas, etc. el cliente  tiene buenas referencias de pago asegura que podrá saldar la deuda y a la vez tiene esperanza que llevara a su hogar seguridad económica.
texts.en: The client lives together with his wife and son in their own home. He has worked for six years farming corn and beans and has gained invaluable experience which allows him to obtain good harvests. The land where he farms is located in a major agricultural region near his home. When his crop is harvested he stores it in barns or in sacks like you see in the photograph. He sells his grains all around his community. He has many customers who prefer to buy through him because everything he sales is of the highest quality, at accessible prices, and he provides good service. He hopes to make another investment that will allow him to increase his production. For this reason he is requesting a loan that will allow him to purchase seed, fertilizers, compost, herbicides, etc. This client has good payment references and assures that he will be able to pay down the debt while also bringing financial security to his household.

loans.use: purchase seed, fertilizer, compost, herbicides, etc.

loans.name: Jennifer's Group

texts.en:
This group consists of six partners residing in Teshie. They are Nancy, Tsotsoo, Patience, Jenifer, Janet and Emelia. They have been together since 2011 and are still doing very well. They sell clothes, plates, bags, ready-made items, foodstuff, underwear and fresh fish.

Patience, the leader, is 32 years old and sells bags and ready-made clothing. She is married to Israel a 45-year-old driver. They have two children. She has been doing this for the past eight years. On 25th March, 2011, she took out her first loan of GHS 200. Through her dedication and seriousness in her business, she has been able to build up trust with ID Ghana. 

For her 5th loan, she is requesting the amount of GHS 1,200 to help her boost the business and to satisfy her customers in and around the community.

All members together need a total amount of GHS 2,900 to buy more goods to sell to their respective customers in the community.

loans.use: To buy more ready-made clothing and bags to sell to customers

loans.name: Khatuna

texts.en:
40-year-old Khatuna lives in Batumi district with her 50-year-old husband and two children (21 and 16 years old). Khatuna requested a loan from local financial institutions several times for family business start-up, but without any success. Her loan request was rejected all the time, because of low income and the family’s poor living conditions. 

Khatuna’s husband is a tinsmith. He is working on private orders and earns a small monthly income which is rarely enough to cover their food expenses.

Khatuna requested a loan from Credo to start-up a family business. Khatuna has now been approved for a loan within the framework of the new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to rural poor people, who do not have access to credit products. These rural poor people are regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of their low income. 

With her credit Khatuna will purchase inventory for her newly opened beauty salon. She has opened the salon recently and needs to add more inventory to start the business. Khatuna is a professional stylist, so she will work in the salon herself in order to decrease the expenses and increase the income. The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva Start-up loan, will significantly improve the living conditions of the family.

loans.use: To purchase inventory for her newly opened beauty salon

loans.name: Potola

texts.en:
Potola is 50 years old. She lives in Martvili District with her husband. Potola requested a loan from local financial institutions several times for family business start-up, but without any success. Her loan request was rejected all the time, because of low income and the family’s poor living conditions. 

The only source of income for the family is from their agricultural activities. In particular, they have 2 milk cows and a calf. Potola milks the cows every day and produces cheese for selling.
