Besides that, they have a plot of land, where 100 nut trees are grown. They sell the harvested nuts locally at a good price. It is hardly enough for food for the family. According to Credo estimations the family belongs to the subsistence poor category. 

Potola requested a loan from Credo to start-up family business. Potola has now been approved for a loan within the framework of the new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to rural poor people, who do not have access to credit products. These rural poor people are regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of their low income. 

With her loan Potola will begin to buy and sell cheese products. She plans to purchase cheese products from wholesalers and then resell them with a price markup among the villagers. This will increase the income of her family. The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva Start-up loan, will significantly improve the living conditions of the family.

loans.use: to purchase cheese for resale

loans.name: Sajida

texts.en:
Ms. Sajida is 33 years old  and a married woman, a mother of five children. She has been running a business of animal sales and purchase for many years. She buys animals (baby goats & baby cows) at low prices, raises them up and then sells them near Eid-ul-Azha (a religious event in Muslim countries like Pakistan).  She has gradually improved her business with the support of Kashf Foundation.

Currently she has requested a loan of Rs.35,000 to purchase two more goats. She is in her 3rd loan cycle with good repayment history.  She hopes to grow her business and dreams of giving a good and quality education to her children through all her hard work in her business.

loans.use: to purchase two more goats.

loans.name: Roheela

texts.en: Roheela is a 33-year-old woman and the mother of four children. She is trying hard to fulfill their demands, including food, health, clothing, and education. Her husband’s income is not sufficient to meet the family’s expenses alone, and, thus, she started her business of sewing gloves to contribute to the family income. She has attained a regular list of customers. However, due to a lack of availability of funds, she is unable to meet the daily demands of her customers. For this reason, she requested a loan of 20,000 PKR to buy one more sewing machine with spools of thread. With this loan, she would be able to complete orders of her customers. She hopes to grow her business and dreams of giving a good and quality education to her children through all her hard work in her business.

loans.use: to buy one more sewing machine with spools of thread.

loans.name: Maria Deysi

texts.es:
María es una mujer de 27 años de edad joven y madre de 2 hijos los cuales dependen de ella y su pareja en todos los aspectos el mayor esta en la primaria y el menor en el kínder. Ella tiene un grado de educación primario no completo el cual pudo cursar hasta el 3 grado de educación; pero no pudo seguir por la falta de apoyo económico. Ella tiene mucha experiencia en el trabajo de la agricultura ya que sus padres le enseñaron desde muy pequeña a trabajar la tierra en donde es cultivado el café. Sus clientes son los diferentes compradores que llegan a la zona y también las bodegas en la zona urbana donde es vendido su producto directamente. Los terrenos que ella y su pareja cultivan son propios gracias a una herencia por parte de sus padres y los suegros los cuales están ubicados a una distancia de 800 metros de su casa de habitación al cual se traslada a pie diariamente para dar asistencia y mantenimiento.  

Hoy en día ella solicita ayuda para la compra de abono y fertilizantes para el mantenimiento de sus cultivos ya que con este apoyo podrá proteger sus cultivos de café ya que de esa forma estará más seguro de plagas entre otros.

Su sueños es mejorar día a día sus cultivos poder incrementar un poco más sus cosechas en variedad y calidad ya que sus hijos son la prioridad más grande, sus estudios y otras necesidades que diariamente se presentan para el mejoramiento de su familia.
texts.en:
María is a 27-year young woman and mother of 2 children who depend on her and her partner for everything.  The older one is in primary school and the younger one in kindergarten.  She has a primary level education, but did not complete it.  She was able to study until 3rd grade, but was not able to continue due to the lack of economic support.

She has a lot of experience working in agriculture, since her parents taught her from a young age to work the land where coffee is grown.  Her customers are the different buyers that come to the area, and also the grocery stores in the urban area where her product is sold directly.

The lands that she and her partner farm are their own, thanks to inheritances from her parents and her in-laws.  The lands are located a distance of 800 meters from their residence, and they travel there everyday on foot in order to tend to and maintain the crop.

Today, she is applying for assistance for the purchase of manure and fertilizers for the maintenance of her crops, since with this assistance, she will be able to protect her coffee crops to make them safer from infestations and other things.

Her dream is to improve her crop day by day, and increase her harvests a bit in terms of variety and quality.  Her children, their studies and other needs that arise daily are her greatest priority to get her family ahead.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and manure for her coffee crops.

loans.name: Bushra

texts.en:
Ms. Bushra is 38 years old and a married woman, running a business of milk selling with her husband for six months. The other person shown in the picture is her husband. They have three buffalo and one cow in milk and sell their milk in the city, along with butter and cheese that they make from the milk.  Bushra looks after the buffaloes and performs the task of collecting milk from them while her husband sells it in different places on a daily basis. They are happily doing it together to support their family.

Bushra has two children and she needs to earn much more to meet their everyday expenditures including food, clothing and education. In order to make higher profits, she requested a loan of Rs. 20,000 to buy one more buffalo to cater for more customers. They hope to have an increase in their production capacity which ultimately helps in generating more income.

loans.use: To buy one more buffalo to cater for more customers.

loans.name: Rafael Carmelo

texts.es:
Rafael es un hombre de 55 años, es soltero, vive en la ciudad de Camaná, el es una persona muy amable, trabajador y entusiasta, que dedica todos sus esfuerzos por salir adelante; lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos y por la necesidad que tuvo de trabajar desde muy joven para ayudar a sus padres, Rafael no pudo estudiar una carrera profesional, en sus ratos libres le gusta viajar para visitar a su familia y en algunas de estas ocasiones cocina un riquísimo Chupe de Camarones para compartir con su familia.
Por iniciativa propia, con mucho empeño y dedicación, Rafael trabaja como maestro constructor, el realiza diversas obras como viviendas, locales y demás construcciones, el trabaja todos los días por un aproximado de 10 horas y cree que le va bien por los buenos acabados de sus trabajos y por el trato amable que brinda a los demás.
Rafael se encuentra muy agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar el mejoramiento de su vivienda, ya que desea hace el tarrajeo, pintado de paredes y mejoramiento del techado de su hogar, de esta manera Rafael tendrá mayor seguridad y bienestar.
texts.en:
Rafael is a 55 year old man.  He is single, lives in the city of Camaná, and is a very friendly, hardworking, and enthusiastic person who puts forth all of his efforts to get ahead.  Unfortunately he had to go to work at an early age to help his parents, due to lack of financial resources.  He was not able to study for a professional career, but he likes to visit his family and at times cook a delicious Chupe de Camarones to share with his family.

On his own initiative and with great dedication, Rafael works as a master construction worker and does various jobs such as working at local homes and other construction projects.  He works about 10 hours a day and believes that things are going well for him because of the friendly treatment he gives to others.

Rafael is very grateful to the Kiva lenders and thanks to their help he has been able to make improvements to his home and he wants to put the finishings on it, paint the walls, and improve the roof.  In this way Rafael will have better security and wellbeing.

loans.use: to make home improvements.

loans.name: Ghulam  Kubra

texts.en:
Ghulam Kubra is 45 years old. She is the mother of three children. She is obtaining her third loan with Kashf Foundation.
Three years ago, she started a business of selling milk. She initiated her own business by buying a buffalo to support her family when her husband was the only breadwinner at that point in time. With the passage of time, her sales increased, as did her income. This has all happened due to her courage and determination.
Because of her work, she is respected in her home. She helps her husband in all family matters, as well as financial matters.
Now, she wants to buy food for her buffaloes, and, thus, she applied for the loan of 40,000 PKR. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. She is very thankful to Kashf for its support.

loans.use: to buy food for her buffaloes.

loans.name: Sultana

texts.en:
Mrs. Sultana is 40 years of age. She has expertise in embroidery and has been using her skill to provide financial support to her family for over four years. She started this line of work at a very young age. 

During the initial years of her business she barely made enough money to purchase the required material. Today she is proud to be famous in her community as the best at making beautiful patterns with thread and beads. Her designs are much in demand and she has managed to consolidate a clientele that allows her to contribute to the expenses of her home. 

Sultana has three children; two of them are school-going. Her husband is doing a job at Ganj Glass but his salary is 10,000/- which is not enough to meet all household expenses. Sultana wants to grow her business so she requested a loan of RKR 30,000 to buy raw materials such as thread, sequins and pearls in large quantities to meet the increasing demand of her customers. Her loan amount has been approved.

loans.use: To buy raw materials such as thread, sequins and pearls in large quantities.

loans.name: Aracelly Del Socorro

texts.es: Aracelly, habita en la ciudad de Granada de oficio comerciante, es dueña de una pequeña abarrotería, ella es una de las buenas clientas que paga ha tiempo sus cuotas, sus negocios ha crecido poco a poco gracias a los financiamientos que ha recibido, esta agradecida su crédito Kiva le ha ayudado a mantener surtido su negocio de productos básicos que le solicitan sus clientes.   Hoy está requiriendo el financiamiento para comprar arroz, azúcar, aceite, frijoles, maíz al por mayor. Ya que son productos de consumo familiar que le piden constantemente. Además que esto le permitirá atraer más clientes y mantener su negocio estable y mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Aracelly lives in the city of Granada and is a merchant who owns a small grocery store. She is one of our good clients who makes her payments on time. Her business has grown little by little, thanks to the loans she has received. Aracelly is grateful for her previous Kiva loan which enabled her to keep her store stocked with the basic products her customers request.  

Now, Aracelly is requesting financing to purchase rice, sugar, cooking oil, beans, and corn at wholesale. These products are constantly in demand since they are regularly consumed by families. In addition, this will permit her to attract more customers, maintain a stable business, and improve the quality of life of her own family.

loans.use: buy rice, sugar, cooking oil, beans, and corn at wholesale to sell.

loans.name: Teona

texts.en:
Teona is 27 years old. She lives in Kutaisi district with her husband and mother in-law. Teona requested a loan from local financial institutions several times for family business start-up, but without any success. Her loan request was rejected all the time, because of low income and her family’s poor living conditions. 

Teona is trading in clothes and household goods. She purchases at the wholesale price and resells with a price markup among her villagers. Her husband is a seller at the local shop and earns a small monthly income. Khatuna’s mother in-law is a cook at a restaurant. The total family income is rarely enough to cover their monthly expenses.

Teona requested a loan from Credo to start-up family business. Teona has now been approved for a loan within the framework of the new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to rural poor people, who do not have access to credit products. These rural poor people are regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of their low income. 

With her credit Teona will rent a counter at the local market. She will be able to purchase more stock of clothes and household goods and have a better choice to offer her clients. Having a counter at the market will help Khatuna to bring more regular customers and generate better profit. Part of the profit will be used for purchasing more products in order to expand the business; another part will be used for her family's well-being.

loans.use: To rent a counter at the local market for trading in household goods and clothes.

loans.name: Shagufta

texts.en:
Ms. Shagufta is a 36-year-old married lady who has been involved in the business of elastic sales for many year and makes enough to contribute to the family income. She purchases elastic in bulk and after packaging it, sells it to the people of her community. 

Shagufta is a mother of five children and is trying hard to fulfill their needs, including food, health, clothing, and education. She has gradually improved her business with the support of Kashf Foundation. In order to grow her sales, she requested a loan of Rs. 30,000 from Kashf Foundation to purchase elastic in large quantity. She expects a boost in her earnings and wishes to spend part of the profits on the expansion of her business.

loans.use: to purchase elastic in large quantity.

loans.name: Kubra

texts.en: Ms Kubra is a 48-year-old married woman. She is very talented and excels in her work of stitching and cloth selling. She has gotten a lot of appreciation from her community. She has accepted the fact that if her husband works alone for their family he will not be able to meet the expenses of their household. She, together with her husband, manages their household while operating a business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses. She has requested a loan of PKR. 25,000 to purchase more reels of thread with packs of buttons, zippers, lace and fabric in various colors. In this way she will be able to meet the increasing demand consistently. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. Kubra hopes to grow her business and dreams of improving her family support through all her hard work.

loans.use: to purchase more reels of thread with packs of buttons, zippers, lace and fabric in various colors

loans.name: Margoth

texts.es:
Margoth de 44 años de edad, se dedica a la confección a terceros, labor que aprendió de su madre quien le enseño el oficio. Su negocio surgió debido a que renunció a su trabajo con el propósito de poder dedicarles tiempo a sus dos hijos de 14 y 9 años de edad. 
Con el fin de agilizar la entrega de los pedidos pendientes, Margoth requiere de la compra de una maquina fileteadora, que le permita aumentar sus ingresos y a futuro conseguir nuevos clientes.
Sueña con poder reunir el dinero suficiente para adquirir vivienda propia y mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Margoth is 44 years old and works as a dressmaker, a trade that she learned from her mother. She started her own business after resigning from her job so that she could spend more time with her children aged 14 and 9. 
In order to complete her pending orders more quickly, Margoth needs a serging machine. This purchase will allow her to increase her income and secure new customers in the future. 
Her dream is to be able to save enough money to buy her own house and improve the quality of life of her family.

loans.use: to buy a serging machine

loans.name: Parveen

texts.en:
Ms. Parveen is a 57-year-old married woman and mother of four. She had a difficult time after her husband's business failure. She decided to work with her husband and to support her family for a better future. 

Two years ago she began stitching work in her house. She stitches for the people living around her house and uses the income to support her entire family. However, due to lack of availability of funds, she is unable to meet the daily demand of her customers. 

She is currently in her 1st loan cycle and has borrowed Rs 30,000 from Kashf. She intends to use this loan amount to buy raw materials including cloth, thread of different colors, laces, zips, etc., to create a means of increasing revenue so she may be able to generate a healthier source of income.

loans.use: To buy raw materials including cloth, thread of different colors, laces, zips, etc.

loans.name: Abda

texts.en:
Ms Abda is a 50-year-old, married woman. She has been running a business of selling ladies' clothes for the past five years. She purchases a variety of clothes from the main city and then sells it to people in her vicinity. She has become famous for selling good quality clothes in different designs and colors. 

She is the mother of three children and is trying hard to fulfill their demands including food, health care, clothing, and education.  Abda has requested a loan of Rs. 45,000 from Kashf Foundation to buy a stock of different ladies’ clothes by taking into account the taste of her customers. In this way, she will be able to earn more income through greater sales. She hopes to have a good experience with this new loan and wants to grow her business. She dreams of giving a good quality education to her children through all her efforts in her business.

loans.use: to buy stock of different ladies’ clothing

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to make home improvements.

loans.name: Kauser

texts.en:
Ms Kauser is a married woman and she is 45 years old. She runs a milk production business, by rearing cattle in her home for the last 4years. Her husband is a driver but his income alone is not sufficient. 

She has eight children and four of the children are school going. Every mother wants to give better future to her children so that they can spend a respectable life so she is working hard within the boundaries of her house. She sells milk in her community. 

She is in her 4th loan cycle and she has requested a loan of Rs. 45000 to purchase another cow. She has said that they are a very poor family. She took a loan from Kashf foundation in 2009 to purchase a cow. 4 years later she has one buffalo, and two cows. Her business of milk selling is growing day by day.

loans.use: to buy a cow

loans.name: Shamim's Group

texts.en:
Shamim is a 35 year old house wife. She lives in Lahore, Pakistan. She is the mother of 3 children. Her husband owns an electronic shop in the market which is the only source of income for the family. He sells a variety of electronic goods in his shop. Presently he is interested in offering more variety to his customers which will help him to increase his net income and savings as well. However due to the lack of funds he finds it difficult. 

Therefore his wife Shamim has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan so that she can help her husband to purchase electrical wires, cables, diodes, etc. so that he can sell them in the market at a profitable price. With the profit her husband wants to grow his business in the future. Shamim is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy electrical wires, cables, diodes, etc

loans.name: Uzma

texts.en: Uzma is a 36-year-old energetic lady. She has three children. Her husband is a laborer, and his income is not enough to meet his family’s needs. In order to overcome the financial problems, Uzma decided to help out her husband by doing an animal sales business, and then she requested a loan from Kashf Foundation to provide full support to her family. She is obtaining her fourth loan with Kashf Foundation and strongly believes that she has improved her living standard and that her children are receiving a good education due to good income sources. She requested a loan of 40,000 PKR to purchase more cattle and wants to enhance her business to become a successful lady who makes strong efforts for her family. Currently, after a hard struggle, both Uzma and her husband are successfully running a cattle rearing business. She is a good example for women in her community.

loans.use: to purchase more cattle.

loans.name: Perveen

texts.en: Perveen is a 51-year-old married woman. She is a vigorous lady, and, for the past five years, she has been running a business of clothing sales. Perveen buys clothes in different fabrics with various colors and designs from the market at wholesale rates and then sells them to the people of her community. She has a varied customer base and is able to earn enough through her business. She is obtaining her sixth loan, requesting a loan of 35,000 PKR from the Kashf Foundation to buy a wide variety of summer clothes in different colors and designs to attract more customers and to expand her inventory. She expects a boost in her earnings with her loan, and she plans to spend part of her profits for the betterment of her family members.

loans.use: to buy a wide variety of summer clothes in different colors and designs.

loans.name: Shahida

texts.en: Ms. Shahida is 36 years old, married and the mother of three children. The man shown in the photo is Shahida’s husband, who is a driver by profession and provides transportation services using his three-wheeled rickshaw. He has been driving a rickshaw for many years as a way to meet family expenses, but now the vehicle requires proper maintenance to keep it functional. That is why Shahida has applied for a loan for Rs 25,000 for her husband, who will use the money to buy new tires for his vehicle. This will help him drive more smoothly and provide better transport service to his passengers. Shahida is hopeful that this loan will be a productive one for her husband and will bring positive changes to his business.

loans.use: to buy new tires for her husband's vehicle.

loans.name: Shehnaz

texts.en: Ms Shehnaz is a 46 year old married lady who has been running a small general store in her community for many years.  She offers a variety of grocery items at a reasonable price and has retained many customers who regularly shop at her store. She makes enough to provide for her family. To make her store fully stocked she has requested a loan for Rs 25,000 which she will use to buy rice, sugar and flour from the market at lower rates. In this way she will be able to meet the increasing demand consistently. Shehnaz wishes to utilize part of her revenues to increase her business capital.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar and flour from the market at lower rates.

loans.name: Zaib

texts.en: Ms Zaib is 46 years old and married. For the last two years, she has earned a living by running a beauty parlor. She offers many services to her customers, including makeup, hair styling and facials. Because she provides good service, she has become very famous in her street. In order to meet the increasing demands of her customers, she would like to buy a great variety of cosmetics products for her business.  But because she does not have much cash, she contacted the Kashf Foundation to apply for her first loan. She needs Rs 20,000 to buy hair care and skin products and bleaching and whitening creams in large quantities. She hopes to cater to more customers with this loan, which will also help her meet household expenditures. Her daughter assists her in beauty parlor and is standing with her mother in the picture.

loans.use: To buy hair care and skin products and bleaching and whitening creams.

loans.name: Sughran

texts.en: Sughran is a 57-year-old widow. She has been successfully running a small general store for the last five years. After the death of her husband, it was very tough for Sughran to manage her household needs with the small income of her children, and, thus, she decided to start a small general store. Now, she is playing a very important role for her family. To grow her business with the increasing demand in her store, she requested a loan of 30,000 PKR to buy packs of salt, biscuits, and beverages. She is expecting a boost in her earnings and dreams of expanding her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy packs of salt, biscuits, and beverages.

loans.name: Rigoberta

texts.es:
Rigoberta es una mujer de 34 años de edad madre soltera de 2 hijos los cuales dependen de ella en todos los aspectos los cuales ya terminaron su primaria completa y la ayudan con las diferentes actividades en el campo que a diario ella en compañía de su hermano hace. Ella tiene un grado de educación primario completo el cual pudo terminar gracias al esfuerzo, dedicación y apoyo que sus padres le brindaron; pero no pudo seguir por la falta de apoyo económico. Ella tiene mucha experiencia en el trabajo de la agricultura ya que sus padres le enseñaron desde muy pequeña a trabajar la tierra en donde es cultivada la hortaliza como también el café. Sus clientes son los diferentes compradores que llegan a la zona y también las bodegas en la zona urbana donde es vendido su producto directamente. Sus cultivos están ubicados a 2 kilómetros de su casa de habitación al cual se trasladan diariamente a pie para dar asistencia técnica para evitar daños en sus cosechas.

Hoy en día ella solicita ayuda para la compra de insumos como ser: abono, fertilizantes, foliares entre otros para el mantenimiento de sus cultivos ya que con este apoyo podrá proteger sus cultivos de café y hortalizas y estará más seguro de plagas entre otros.

Su sueños es mejorar día a día sus cultivos poder incrementar un poco más sus cosechas en variedad y calidad ya que sus hijos son la prioridad más grande, sus estudios y otras necesidades que diariamente se presentan para el mejoramiento de su familia.
texts.en:
Rigoberta is 34 years old and is a single mother with two children who depend on her for everything. Her children have finished primary school, and they help her with different activities in the fields that Rigoberta does daily with her brother. Rigoberta completed one grade of primary education – which she was able to do thanks to her parents’ effort, dedication and support – but she was not able to continue her studies because of a lack of economic resources. She has a lot of experience working in agriculture, since her parents taught her from a very young age how to work the land and where to grow vegetables and coffee. She sells her crops to different buyers who come to the area where she lives, as well as directly to grocery stores in urban areas. Her crops are located two kilometers from her house, and she travels to them each day on foot to care for them so she can prevent damage to her harvest.

Today Rigoberta is requesting a loan to buy agricultural inputs such as manure and other fertilizers to maintain her crops. With this loan she will be able to protect her coffee and vegetable crops against insects and other pests.

Rigoberta’s dream is to continue improving her crops so that she can increase the size, variety and quality of her harvests. She says that her children are her greatest priority – especially their studies – but also all of the other things that come up daily that her family needs or that can improve their quality of life.

loans.use: to buy agricultural inputs such as manure and other fertilizers for her coffee and vegetable crops.

loans.name: Ada Isabel

texts.es:
Ada es una mujer de 30 años de edad joven y madre de 3 hijos los cuales dependen de ella y su pareja en todos los aspectos los 2 mayores están en la primaria. Ella tiene un grado de educación primaria completa la cual pudo cursar hasta gracias al esfuerzo y empeño de parte de sus padres para que ella pudiese tener un conocimiento básico; pero no pudo seguir por la falta de apoyo económico. Ella tiene mucha experiencia en el trabajo de la agricultura ya que sus padres le enseñaron desde muy pequeña a trabajar la tierra en donde es cultivado el café el cual lo aprendió por tradición familiar. Sus clientes son los diferentes compradores que llegan a la zona, vecinos y amigos que conocen la calidad de su producto. Los terrenos que ella y su pareja cultivan son propios gracias a una herencia por parte de sus padres y otra parte gracias al esfuerzo y trabajo que ellos han puesto para poder ir creciendo poco a poco los cuales están ubicados a una distancia de 2 kilómetros de su casa de habitación al cual se traslada a pie diariamente para dar asistencia y mantenimiento.

Hoy en día ella solicita ayuda para la compra de abono y fertilizantes para el mantenimiento de sus cultivos ya que con este apoyo podrá proteger sus cultivos de café ya que de esa forma estará más seguro de plagas entre otros.

Su sueños es mejorar día a día sus cultivos poder incrementar un poco más sus cosechas en variedad y calidad ya que sus hijos son la prioridad más grande, sus estudios y otras necesidades que diariamente se presentan para el mejoramiento de su familia.
texts.en:
Ada is a 30-year-old young woman, mother of 3 children who depend on her and her husband in all aspects. The 2 oldest are in primary school. Ada has a diploma from primary school, which she obtained thanks to the efforts and enterprise of her parents who wanted her to have basic knowledge. But she could not continue beyond that for lack of economic means. 

Ada has much experience working in agriculture. Her parents taught her from a young age to work the earth where they cultivated coffee, and she learned from family tradition. Her customers are different buyers who come to the zone, plus neighbors and friends who know the quality of her product. 

The lands that Ada and her husband work are their own, thanks to an inheritance from their parents, plus another portion, earned through their own effort and the work they have done to be able to continue growing little by little.  The fields are located some 2 kilometers from their residence, a distance they cover daily on foot to care for and maintain their plants.

Now, Ada is requesting aid to purchase manure and fertilizers for maintaining their plants, since with this help they will be able to protect their coffee plantings. In this form, the harvest will be more secure from plagues and other threats.

Ada's dreams are to improve her crops day to day and be able to increase the variety and quality a little more. Her children and their studies are her highest priority, as well as other necessities which present themselves daily, and the betterment of her family.

loans.use: buy manure and fertilizers for maintenance of her coffee plants.

loans.name: Mónica Janeth

texts.es:
Mónica, es una mujer soñadora, esforzada y con grades deseos de buscar un mejor futuro para su hijo de 6 años de edad. Laboró por varios años en una tienda de mascotas, en donde adquirió los conocimientos sobre el oficio.
Desde hace un año decidió independizarse y montar su negocio dedicado a la venta de concentrados, accesorios y medicina canina.
Mónica se siente satisfecha con los logros alcanzados y desea seguir creciendo dentro del mercado local, por lo cual se encuentra solicitando un crédito que invertirá en la compra de mercancía con el propósito de ampliar su portafolio de productos y mejorar su nivel de ventas.
texts.en:
Mónica is a woman with dreams, who is strong and has a strong desire to seek out a better future for her six year old son. She worked for many years in a pet store where she acquired knowledge about this type of work.

A year ago she decided to make herself independent and start a business dedicated to the sale of pet food, accessories and canine medicine. 

Mónica feels satisfied with the achievements she has made and hopes to continue growing within the local market. For this reason she is requesting this loan to invest in the purchase of mercahandise. She plans to widen her product offerings and increase her sales.

loans.use: to buy pet food, accessories and canine medicine.

loans.name: Omaira

texts.es:
Omaira a sus 52 años de edad es una emprendedora quien inició su negocio con el fin de generar una fuente de ingresos para su sustento y el de sus dos hijos. Se dedica a la venta de productos por catálogo desde hace cuatro años desde su vivienda.  En la actualidad requiere de la compra de surtido (perfumes, cosméticos y accesorios) y una vitrina para exhibirlos, con el fin de  incrementar sus ventas para el día de las madres. 
Espera generar mayores ingresos que le permitan mejorar su calidad de vida y cumplir el sueño de tener su propio almacén.
texts.en:
Omaira, at the age of 52, is an entrepreneurial woman who began her business with the goal of generating a source of income to support herself and her two children. She has been selling catalog products for four years from her home. Now she needs to purchase stock (perfumes, cosmetics, and accessories) and a display case to show it in, with the goal of increasing her sales for Mothers' Day. 

She hopes to generate more income, which will allow her to improve her quality of life and achieve her dream of having her own store.

loans.use: to buy stock (perfumes, cosmetics, and accessories) and a display case to show it in

loans.name: Kubra

texts.en: Ms. Kubra is a 37-year-old married woman. She is the loving mother of four children, two daughters and two sons. She enjoys her business of weaving rugs and shawls and, with the support of Kashf Foundation, she has built a successful business. Kubra has in-depth knowledge of high quality weaving, and her husband helps in her work, making rugs and shawls and also delivering to the people who live out of town. She earns enough for a hand-to-mouth existence and has gradually improved her business. She is now in her fifth loan cycle, and she is applying for a loan of PKR 20,000 to buy raw materials, such as wool and threads, as well as cutters and tools. In this way, she would be able to increase her sales, which would ultimately help in generating more income.

loans.use: to buy raw materials and equipment. such as wool, thread, cutters, and tools, for her business of weaving rugs and shawls.

loans.name: Tamseela

texts.en:
Tamseela is a 33-year-old married woman. She has been successfully running a small general store in her community for the past four years. She offers various goods for daily use. She has good communication skills and counts on a good client list. She earns insufficient income to support her family. Her husband supports in her business.

Tamseela is the mother of four children. She is motivated to provide for her family. As she wants to grow her business, she requested a loan of Rs 25,000 to buy stock of rice, sugar, flour and other grocery items from the market at lower rates. She then would be able to meet increasing demand consistently. She is in her fourth loan cycle and has shown excellent repayment behavior. She wishes to utilize part of revenue to deal with personal expenses and to increase business capital.

loans.use: to buy stock of rice, sugar, flour and other grocery items for resale.

loans.name: Sumaira

texts.en: Sumaira is a 27-year-old married woman and the mother of five children. The man shown in the photo is Sumaira’s husband who has been a rickshaw driver for the past three years. Sumaira's husband purchased a rickshaw with the support of Kashf Foundation three years ago. Now, after three years, the rickshaw needs repair work, so Sumaira applied a loan of Rs. 30,000 for her husband. In this way her husband will be able to replace the body of the rickshaw and this will ultimately help him drive more smoothly and provide better transport services to his passengers. Sumaira is hopeful that this loan will be a productive one for her husband and will bring positive changes to his business.

loans.use: to replace the body of the rickshaw used in the business.

loans.name: Parveen

texts.en: Parveen is a hardworking women. She is married and provides for four children. She decided to work with her husband and to support her family for a better future. Thirteen years ago, she start stitching the garments of different people in her house. She stitches for the people living near her house and uses the income to support her entire family. However, to meet the daily demands of her customers, she needs more funds. She is currently in her seventh loan cycle and has borrowed Rs 40,000 from Kashf. She intends to use this loan amount to buy raw materials, including cloth, threads of different colors, laces, zips, etc., to create a means of increasing revenues so she may be able to generate a healthier source of income.

loans.use: to buy raw materials, including cloth, threads of different colors, laces, zips, etc.

loans.name: Rose's Group

texts.en: This group consists of two members, Rose and Diana. They sell provisions, sachet water and soap, in the community. They have been together from 2011 to date and are doing very well. Rose is a 56-year-old who sells sachet water and soap. She is a widow and lives with two grown children. She has been in this business for eight years. She works from Mondays to Saturdays. This is her fifth loan, and she needs  GHS 1,000 to buy 50 bags of sachet water and 3 boxes of soap to sell to her customers. She has been able, through her business, to provide her grown-up children with quality educations. She is grateful to ID Ghana. The group members need a total of GHS 2,000 to buy more items to sell to their customers in the Teshie community.

loans.use: to buy 50 bags of sachet water and 3 boxes of soap to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Safia

texts.en: Safia is a 57-year-old married woman. She has five children and Safia's world revolves around them.  Her husband’s income is not sufficient to provide clothing and other necessities for their children. Safia was wise enough to create another source of income in the home and she adopted stitching as the second source of income for the home. She is now experienced enough to make all kinds of designs and she fulfills the demands and designs of her customers. Safia now wants to buy more spools of thread with packs of buttons, laces and zippers in various colors. Her current season has gone smoothly, and as the summer season has started, she is getting more orders for stitching. For this reason, she requested a loan of 10,000 PKR from Kashf Foundation. She will surely separate savings from profits, which she will use for providing better facilities for her children.

loans.use: to buy more spools of thread with packs of buttons, laces and zippers in various colors.

loans.name: Ramzana

texts.en: Ramzana is a 48-year-old married woman. She has been successfully running a small general store with her husband at the corner of her house. She has three years of experience in this field. Her husband also assists her by purchasing stock of goods from the market as he has maintained many contacts over the years. Ramzana is the mother of four children and is motivated to provide her family with good quality food, clothing and health. She wants to grow her business, so she requested a loan of 25,000 PKR to buy packs of salt, biscuits and beverages to meet the increasing demand in her store. She is expecting a boost in her earnings and dreams of expanding her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy packs of salt, biscuits and beverages for resale.

loans.name: Ansa

texts.en:
Ansa is a 23-year-old married woman. She currently has five goats. At first, she used to purchase goats and sheep and sell them at the festival of Eid-ul-Azha (Muslim Holy Festival), and gradually, she increased the number of goats. Her business is good enough to help her lead a decent life.

Ansa is the mother of one child. The man shown in the photo is Ansa’s husband, who also assists in her business. She is in the fifth loan cycle and has a strong association with Kashf Foundation. She has taken several loans and each time she has paid back her loan in full and on time. Now she has requested a loan of Rs. 30,000 to buy more of goats. This way, she will be able to generate more revenue. She wishes to utilize the part of revenue for her child's health and education.

loans.use: to buy goats.

loans.name: Abida

texts.en: Abida is a 43-year-old married woman. She, along with her husband, has a business selling milk. The man shown in the photo is Abida’s husband. They have gained 20 years of experience in this field, and over time they have become famous in their community for providing good quality milk. They make enough to meet the family expenses. They have two milking cows, and now Abida has requested a loan of Rs. 30,000 to purchase another cow. She hopes to get an increase in the production capacity of milk, which ultimately helps in generating more income.

loans.use: to purchase another cow.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy basic ingredients wholesale (flour, eggs, sugar)

loans.name: Perveen

texts.en: Ms. Perveen is 43 years old and a married woman, the mother of two children. The man shown in the photo is Perveen’s husband, who is a driver by profession and provides transportation services using his three-wheeled rickshaw. He has been driving a rickshaw for many years to meet the family's expenses, but now the rickshaw needs proper maintenance to keep it running its routine. For this reason, Perveen has applied for a loan of PKR 35,000, for her husband’s use. He wants to buy new tires and have some repairs done on his vehicle. This will help him to drive more smoothly and to provide better transport service to his passengers. Perveen is hopeful that this loan will be a productive one for her husband and will bring positive changes to his business.

loans.use: to buy new tires and make some repairs on her husband's rickshaw.

loans.name: Humaira

texts.en: Ms. Humaira is a 25-year-old single lady; she has been in the business of sewing clothes for five years and is proud to be contributing to her household income. When Humaira was not earning, her family was going through a severe financial crisis, which compelled her to use her sewing skills in a productive manner. She has established a good clientele, but she is having difficulty in fulfilling large orders. That’s why she applied for a loan of PKR 20,000, which will be used to purchase spools of thread in various colors, as well as packets of buttons, laces and zippers. She is hopeful of increasing her income and wishes to spend part of the revenue on the betterment of her family members.

loans.use: to buy more spools of thread in various colors, as well as packets of buttons, laces and zippers, for her sewing business.

loans.name: Levan

texts.en: Levan is 32 years old. He lives in Kutaisi District, West Georgia, with his wife and two sons (5 and 6 years old). Levan applied for loans from local financial institutions several times for a family business start-up, but without any success. His loan applications were always rejected, because of his low income and the family’s poor living conditions. Levan is works as a security provider at the local bank. His wife is a seller in the local shop. They both receive small monthly salaries. Levan applied for loan from Credo to start up a family business. He has now been approved for a loan within the framework of the new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and re-startup credits on soft conditions to rural poor people, who do not have access to credit products. These rural poor people are regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of their low income. With his credit, Levan will purchase play equipment for children. He will place the equipment in the local park. The park has been newly renovated, and local people are spending a lot of time there, in the fresh air with their families. Levan hopes to earn a good profit from this business in order to provide better living conditions for his family.

loans.use: to buy play equipment for children to install in the local park.

loans.name: Ameer

texts.en: Ameer is 47 years old, married and the mother of four children. Her husband is working in a textile mill, but his income is not enough to meet the family's needs. Ameer has been running a business of cattle rearing for many years. She buys animals (baby goats and baby cows) at low prices, raises them, and then her husband sells them out in the market at higher prices. She has gradually improved her business with the support of Kashf Foundation. Currently she requested a loan of Rs. 25,000 to purchase more cattle. She hopes to grow her business and dreams of giving a good and quality education to her children through all her hard work in her business.

loans.use: to purchase more cattle.

loans.name: Rozina

texts.en: Rozina is 25 years old and married. Four years ago, she started her business of animal purchasing and sales. She buys animals (baby goats and baby cows) at low prices, raises them, and then sells them out in the market at higher prices. In order to purchase two more goats, she contacted Kashf Foundation and applied for a loan of Rs. 20,000. She hopes to grow her business and dreams of giving a good and quality education to her two children through all her hard work in her business.

loans.use: to purchase two more goats.

loans.name: Faiza

texts.en: Faiza is 23 years old and single. She started her business of sewing clothes to contribute to the family income. She is well familiar with stitching techniques. At present, she enjoys a great client list and has gained a lot of appreciation and popularity in her community. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns enough to lead a decent life. To help her continue the operations of her business, she requested a loan of Rs. 30,000 to buy a stock of thread with packs of zippers and buttons in various colors to meet increasing demand. That way, she would be able to meet the demands of her customers without fail. In addition to repaying the loan, she will use part of the revenue to handle personal expenses.

loans.use: to buy a stock of thread with packs of zippers and buttons in various colors to meet increasing demand.

loans.name: Tatli

texts.en:
Tatli is 51 years old and married. She is the mother of three children. They live in a village in the northern part of Kosovo. Tatli’s husband works at the primary school. Tatli is a very hard worker and has had a lot of experience working on her land for many years. She works with agricultural machinery on farmland belonging to other people in her area. This is how she earns a living. 

Now she is in need of a loan to buy new working tools for a tractor. With the help of this loan, she can expand and facilitate her work. She is able to support her family through her business efforts. She hopes to keep earning her own living in order not to ask for help from others. Tatli is hoping in the near future to buy a milk cow. Her goal is to save money for her family's future.

She wants to thank all Kiva lenders!

loans.use: to buy working tools for a tractor.

loans.name: Marcela Cristina

texts.es:
Marcela de 33 años, es madre de un hijo de tres meses de edad, y en conjunto con su esposo laboraron por más de 12 años en una panadería. Desde hace seis meses tomaron la decisión  de independizarse y crear su propio negocio, con el fin de mejorar la condición económica y dedicarle más tiempo a su hijo. Se encuentra solicitando un crédito que invertirá en la compra de una vitrina exhibidora y capital de trabajo para abrir una nueva línea de repostería.
Sueña con acreditar su negocio y darlo a conocer en el sector, con el fin de alcanzar el punto de equilibrio y hacerlo sostenible en el tiempo.
texts.en:
Marcela is 33 years old and mother to a three year old. She and her husband worked in a bakery for more than 12 years. Six months ago, they decided to become independent and start their own business with the aim of improving their financial situation and to be able to spend more time with their son. They are requesting a loan to invest in the purchase of a display counter and other supplies to start up a new line of desserts. 
Her dream is to position her business in the market and make it well-known in its area so that it can break even and become sustainable in the future.

loans.use: to buy a display counter and pay for supplies.

loans.name: Sumaira

texts.en: Ms. Sumaira is a 30-year-old married woman. She has been in the beauty parlor business for two years. She offers many facilities to her customers, such as make-up, hair styling and facials. Through providing her best services, she has become very famous in her street. In order to meet the increasing demand from her customers, she is interested in buying a hair dryer and a greater variety of cosmetics products for the parlor and, for this reason, she applied for a loan of PKR 40,000. She is hopeful to have more and more customers. With the help of the loan, she will not only purchase a variety of products but will also able to meet her household expenses.

loans.use: to buy a hair dryer and a greater variety of cosmetics products for the beauty parlor.

loans.name: Nasreen

texts.en: Ms. Nasreen is a 52-year-old married woman and the mother of three. She has been running a business trading fabric for many years. She buys a variety of fabrics from the main city and then sells them to the people of her neighborhood. She has become famous in her community for selling good quality cloth. Nasreen applied for a loan of PKR 25,000 from Kashf Foundation to buy a stock of different fabric for the summer season, taking into account the choices and tastes of her customers. In this way, she would be able to earn more income from her greater sales. She hopes to have a good experience with this new loan and wants to grow her business. She dreams of giving a good  quality education to her children, through all her hard work in her business.

loans.use: to buy a stock of different cloth for her trading business.

loans.name: Maryum

texts.en: Ms. Maryam is a 48-year-old married woman. She is a vigorous lady and, for the past 10 years, has been running a bedding business. Maryam buys bed sheets of different fabrics in various colors and designs from the market at wholesale prices and then sells them to the people of her community. She has a varied customer base and is able to earn enough through her business. Maryam is requesting a 20,000 PKR loan from the Kashf Foundation to buy a wide variety of bed sheets in different colors and designs to attract more customers and expand her inventory. Maryam expects a boost in her earnings with her loan and she plans to spend part of her profits for the betterment of her family members.

loans.use: to buy a wide variety of bed sheets in various colors and designs for her business.

loans.name: Samina

texts.en: Ms. Samina is a 25-year-old, vigorous, lady and the mother of two children. She has been sewing clothes for many years and is now experienced enough to make all kinds of designs. She sews for the people of her community and uses the income to support her entire family. However, due to a lack of funds, she is unable to meet the daily demand from her customers. For this reason, she applied for a loan of PKR 25,000 from Kashf Foundation. She intends to use this loan to buy more spools of thread in different colors, as well as packets of laces, zippers and buttons, to create increase her revenues, so that she may able to generate a healthier source of income. She is in her second loan cycle and thankful to Kashf for its tremendous support.

loans.use: to buy more spools of thread in various colors, as well as packets of laces, zippers and buttons, for her sewing business.

loans.name: María Eloida

texts.es:
María, es una microempresaria de 42 años de edad quien se dedica a la confección a terceros. Labor que aprendió gracias a una hermana la cual le enseño todo lo relacionado con este oficio. María desde hace 5 años montó su taller en su vivienda. Trabaja de 08:00 a.m. a 5:00 p.m y de esta manera genera los recursos para la educación y la alimentación de sus cuatro hijos.
En la actualidad se encuentra solicitando un crédito que invertirá en la compra de una máquina plana con el propósito de ampliar su producción y mejorar su condición económica.
Su gran sueño es expandir su microempresa y tener la oportunidad de emplear a personas que han sido víctimas del desplazamiento forzado.
texts.en:
Maria is a microbusinesswoman of 42 who sews for third parties, work that she learned thanks to a sister who taught her everything related to this trade. Maria set up her workshop in her home five years ago. She works from 8 am to 5 pm, and in this way she generates the resources for the education and feeding of her four children.

Now she is applying for a loan that she will invest in the purchase of a flat-bed sewing machine, with the goal of expanding her production and improving her economic condition.

Her great dream is to expand her microbusiness and have the opportunity to employ people who have been victims of forced displacement.

loans.use: to buy a flat-bed sewing machine

loans.name: Rashida

texts.en: Rashida is a 50-year-old married woman and has had a business selling milk with her husband for five years. She has two cows and one buffalo and sells their milk to many of their neighbors, along with butter and cheese that they make from the milk. She looks after the buffalo and performs the task of collecting milk from them and selling it to different places on daily basis. She is the mother of five children and needs to earn much more to meet their everyday expenditures, including food, clothing and education. In order to make huge profits, she requested a loan of Rs 50,000 to buy one more milking buffalo in order to cater to more customers. She hopes to get increase in the production capacity of milk, which ultimately helps in generating more income.

loans.use: to buy one more milking buffalo in order to cater to more customers.

loans.name: Aaliya

texts.en: Aaliya is a 30-year-old married woman doing a business of milk sales for the past year. She has two milking cows; she sells their milk to many of her neighbors, along with butter and that she makes from the milk. Her business is good enough help her lead a decent life. She has two daughters who attend school. She is very motivated to provide them with a beautiful life, with a good education, food and clothing. She has improved her business to meet day-to-day expenses of life. It’s her second year with Kashf Foundation; she is happily running her business through support of it. Now she has requested a loan of Rs 20,000 to purchase one more cow as well as feed for its calves. She hopes to have an increase in her production capacity, which ultimately helps in generating greater income.

loans.use: to purchase one more cow as well as feed for its calves.

loans.name: Balqees

texts.en: Balqees is 55 years old and married. She has been running a business of animal purchasing and sales for many years. She buys animals (baby goats and baby cows) at low prices, raises the, and then sells them out in the market at higher prices. She has gradually improved her business with the support of Kashf Foundation. Currently, she has requested a loan of Rs. 10,000 to purchase one more cow. She is in her second loan cycle with a good repayment history. She hopes to grow her business and dreams of giving a good and quality education to her children through all her hard work in her business.

loans.use: to purchase one more cow.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy soft drinks, cement, and water

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more beans and local rice

loans.name: Musrat

texts.en: Musrat is a 28-year-old woman and the mother of two children. She is a very talented lady and excels in her work of stitching. She has gotten a lot of appreciation from her community. She makes enough to contribute to the family's income as her husband’s income is not sufficient to meet the needs of the family members alone. She, together with her husband, manages their household while operating a business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses. She has now requested a loan of Rs. 30,000 to purchase more spools of thread with packs of buttons, zippers and laces in various colors. In this way, she will be able to meet increasing demand consistently. She hopes to grow her business and dreams of giving a good and quality education to her children through all her hard work.

loans.use: to purchase more spools of thread with packs of buttons, zippers and laces in various colors.

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam is 21 years old. She lives in Kutaisi District with husband and infant daughter. Mariam requested a loan from local financial institutions several times for a family business start-up, but without any success. Her loan request was rejected every time because of low income and the family’s poor living conditions. 

Mariam’s husband works at a private company as a distributor and earns a small monthly income. It is hardly enough to provide food for the family. According to Credo's estimations, the family belongs to the subsistence poor category. 

Mariam requested a loan from Credo to start up a family business. Mariam has now been approved for a loan within the framework of the new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to rural poor people who do not have access to credit products. These rural poor people are regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of their low income. With this credit, Mariam will purchase a special apparatus for cleaning the face. As she is a cosmetologist, she plans to work at a local beauty salon as she will purchase the needed equipment. She thinks that business will be profitable as the beauty salon is very popular in Kutaisi. The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva Start-up loan will significantly increase the income of their family and they will be able to improve the living conditions of their infant daughter.

loans.use: to purchase a special apparatus for cleaning the face.

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Daniel lives in the Eldoret area of Kenya, which is extremely fertile for agriculture. He has four children and has been doing this agricultural work for two years. His primary income sources are milk, eggs, and crops.

He stated what is most enjoyable about farming are the returns he gets from selling eggs. His biggest challenge is poultry diseases. Animals on the farm have been given no names. 

Daniel was asked why he chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan, to which he replied, "because of training programs."  This client was also asked what was learned during Juhudi's required micro-finance training session: poultry keeping.

His highest monthly expense is farming costs. When asked how this loan will benefit his family, Daniel replied that he will expand his farm.

As part of Juhudi's loan appraisal process, each borrower's assets are evaluated. Daniel owns the following: a cow, poultry, and a bicycle, but does not own a pig, pump, motorcycle or automobile. Juhudi Kilimo also tries to measure any change in living standards based on this loan. This borrower has in the household a mosquito net, TV and DVD, but does not have electricity, solar power, running water or a sewing machine.

Note: To create this loan profile, Juhudi Kilimo used a mobile device to gather information in the field and send the data to a central online repository, thus reducing paper use, making the process more efficient and keeping costs down.

loans.use: to purchase poultry.

loans.name: Osman

texts.en: Meet 29-year-old Osman from the Waterloo Eastern area in Sierra Leone. He is married and has one child, 10 years old. His child is currently going to school, and he also has three additional dependents at home. In 2004, Osman established his local food enterprise in a busy market area. He began his business because he was trained in business and wanted to develop himself and his family. He operates his business from morning to night, seven days per week. At present he is facing problems with transportation from the provinces to his place of business. Osman is applying for a loan in order to buy more rice, local food (benni), and powdered corn, for resale. He hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow him to have his own permanent business structure and take good care of his family. In the future, Osman plans to build a big house . He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more rice, local food (benni), and powdered corn, for resale.

loans.name: Maribel Deysi

texts.es:
La cliente Maribel vive en Guayaquil. Comenzó su negocio cuando se separo de su esposo, y tuvo que buscar una alternativa para poder generar ingresos. Poco a poco fue mejorando sus ingresos debido a la venta de de ropa, cosmeticos. 

Poco a poco a mejorado su negocio por eso quiere seguir para poderle dar una buena vida a sus dos hijos. Pero para poder capitalizar los estudios de sus hijos necesita un préstamo para comprar una computadora y así enseñarles desde pequeños el manejo de la misma.
texts.en:
Maribel lives in Guayaquil.  She started her business when she separated from her husband and had to find an alternative that would allow her to generate income.  She has been gradually increasing her income from her business selling clothing and cosmetics.

Step by step, she's been improving her business, and she wants to continue to be able to give her children a good life.  However, in order to enhance her children's education, she needs a loan to buy a computer.  This way, she can teach them to use a computer from a young age.

loans.use: to buy a computer

loans.name: Vicenta Maria

texts.es:
La cliente Vicenta vive en Guayaquil. Comenzó su negocio cuando se vio en la necesidad de tener otro ingreso ya que con los de su esposo no le alcanzaban, y tuvo que buscar una alternativa para poder generar ingresos. Poco a poco fue mejorando sus ingresos debido a la venta de de ropa, cosméticos, artículos de hogar.

Poco a poco a mejorado su negocio por eso quiere seguir para poderle dar una buena vida a sus dos hijos. Pero para poder capitalizar los estudios de sus hijos necesita un préstamo para comprar una computadora y asi ellos que aprendan e investiguen los trabajos que le envian de la escuela.
texts.en:
Vicenta lives in Guayaquil.  She started her business when she saw the need to have other income because her husband’s was not enough.  She had to look for an alternative in order to be able to generate income.  Little by little she was improving her income by selling clothes, cosmetics, and household items.

She has improved her business little by little.  That is why she wants to continue to be able to give her two children a good life.  However, she is not able to pay for her children’s education.  She needs a loan in order to buy a computer.  This way they will learn and investigate the homework they get from school.

loans.use: to buy a computer.

loans.name: Batanai Maoko Group

texts.en: Greetings from Zimbabwe! This is 52-year-old Cecilia from Masvingo. Cecila is a widow with five children. Cecilia runs a retail business which sells clothes,shoes,tomatoes, and maize. The business has been in operation for 10 years. She says the main challenge is that of high transportation costs. With her portion of the loan Cecilia intends to buy clothes,tracksuits,radios and solar panels. She says the extra income generated as a result of this loan will allow her to increase her number of livestock. In the future Cecilia plans to own a shop.

loans.use: to buy clothes,tracksuits,radios and solar panels

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy items like meat and beans.

loans.name: Ulfat

texts.en: Ulfat is 46 years old, married, and the mother of six children, all of whom attend school. The man shown in the photo is Ulfat’s husband. He is a hawker and it is the major source of their income. He sells different items, like balloons, plastic goods and games on his cycle to the people of his community. In this way, he earns sufficient amount of income to meet the family expenses. In order to meet everyday expenditures with educational expenses, more income is required, so Ulfat contacted Kashf Foundation and applied for a loan of Rs. 25,000. Her husband will utilize this loan amount to purchase more items, such as plastic bowls and boxes, toys, and games, to increase his sales. Ulfat is hopeful that this loan will be a productive one for her husband and will bring positive changes to his business. Their dream is to maximize their profits from this business and have a better standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase more items, such as plastic bowls and boxes, toys, and games.

loans.name: Edina

texts.en:
Edinah lives in the Litein area of Kenya. She has five children and has been farming for seven years. Her primary income sources are milk, eggs, and crops.

She stated what is most enjoyable about farming is the farming. Her biggest challenge is poor weather. Animals on the farm have been given the names of 'Seroy.'

Edinah was asked why she chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan, to which she replied, good training. This client was also asked what was learned during Juhudi's required micro-finance training session: "It gives loan in groups."

Her highest monthly expense is school fees. When asked how this loan will benefit the family, Edinah replied that it will bring more income to meet the family's needs.

As part of Juhudi's loan appraisal process, each borrower's assets are evaluated. Edinah owns cows and poultry, but does not own items like pigs, a pump, a bicycle, motorcycle or automobile. Juhudi Kilimo also tries to measure any change in living standards based on this loan. This borrower has in the household a mosquito net, but does not have electricity, solar power, running water, sewing machine, TV, or DVD player.

Note: To create this loan profile, Juhudi Kilimo used a mobile device to gather information in the field and send the data to a central online repository, thus reducing paper use, making the process more efficient and keeping costs down."

loans.use: to purchase poultry.

loans.name: Suraiya

texts.en: Suraiya is a married 44-year-old mother of two children. She accepted the fact that if only her husband works for their family, they will not be able to support the family. She has had a tailoring business for seven years in order to help her husband meet the expenses of the household with the educational needs of their children. That is why she started tailoring at home, to support her family well. She, together with her husband, manages their household while operating a business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses. Now she has requested a loan of Rs. 15,000 to purchase more spools of threads with packs of buttons and laces. In this way, she will be able to meet increasing demand. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. Suraiya hopes to grow her business and dreams of giving a good and quality education to her children through all her hard work in her business.

loans.use: to purchase more spools of thread with packs of buttons and laces.

loans.name: Flor

texts.es:
Flor, de 60  años de edad, es madre soltera de un hijo de 20 años de edad con quien vive en su casa propia.Flor se dedica a la venta de productos comestibles en la tienda ubicada en su hogar.LLeva 8 años en este negocio y
le gusta mucho pues no tiene que salir mucho de casa  y puede apoyar en lo que su hijo necesite.
Agradece mucho  el apoyo que le brinda su menor hijo,  quien está siempre a su lado para ayudarle algunas veces en la atención de sus clientes, ahora desea seguir trabajando mucho y poder comenzar a ampliar y ofrecer mayor variedad de productos a sus clientes.Este es el crédito número 03 con Kiva, está muy contenta de saber que tiene un apoyo financiero, ya que así se sentirá segura de avanzar con su negocio.  Por otro lado se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas de manera puntual.Con el monto solicitado de 1500 soles, comprará productos como arroz, azúcar, aceites, golosinas, bebidas gasificadas y otros, para poder ofrecer en mayor cantidad y variedad a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Flor, age 60, is the single mother of her 20 year old son with whom she lives in her own house.  Flor sells food products in the store that is located in her house.  She has had the business for eight years.  She likes it a lot.  She does not have to leave home a lot, and she is able to help in whatever her son needs.

She is very grateful for the support of her minor son.  He is always at her side to help her.  Sometimes he helps tend to her customers.  She now wishes to continue working a lot and to be able to start expanding and offering a greater variety of products to her customers.

This is her third loan with Kiva.  She is very happy to know that she has financial support.  This way she is sure to advance in her business.  She pledges to make her payments punctually.  She will use the requested 1,500 soles to buy products like rice, sugar, cooking oil, candy, soft drinks, and others.  

She will do this in order to be able to offer her customers a greater quantity and variety.

loans.use: to buy products like rice, sugar, and cooking oil, among others.

loans.name: Dagoberto

texts.es:
Dagoberto tiene 39 años de edad, esta acompañado  y tiene dos hijos. Desde los 12 años de edad, comenzó a trabajar en la tierra, le ayudaba a su padre a sembrar granos básicos y al cuido de ganado. Para comprar los insumos es una odisea, la ciudad en donde los compra esta a dos horas de su casa caminando a pie; porque el transporte es escaso y para trasladar los insumos lo hace en una carreta por eso ya llega a su casa en la noche, el viaje es bastante largo. 

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar abono, fertilizantes y pago de mano de obra para sembrar. Así, obtendrá una cosecha abundante que le permita alimentara  su familia y otra parte para venderla y obtener ingresos para los demás gastos del hogar.
texts.en:
Dagoberto, age 39, is in a relationship and has two children.  He started working the land when he was 12 years old.  He helped his parents grow basic grains and care for the livestock.  

Buying supplies is an odyssey.  The city where he buys them is two hours, walking on foot, from his house.  Transportation is scarce, and in order to transport the supplies he uses a cart.  Therefore, he arrives at his house at night.  The trip is pretty long.

The loan that he is requesting from the Fundación Campo is to buy compost and fertilizers and to pay for the labor to plant.  This way he will get an abundant harvest that will allow him to feed his family.  He will sell the other part of the harvest, and he will get income for the other household expenses.

loans.use: to buy compost and fertilizers and to pay for the labor to plant.

loans.name: Teresa Margaríta

texts.es:
Teresa tiene 37 años de edad, esta casada  y tiene un hijo de 7 años de edad. Ella posee 20 años de dedicarse a la ganadería y a la agricultura; actividades que aprendió de sus padres; antes era empleada. 

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar ganado de repasto. Fertilizantes y funguicidas para el cultivo de maíz. El crédito le servirá de mucho, por que en esta época no se cultiva en el lugar donde vive y debido a eso se dedica a cuidar animales para engordarlos y posteriormente venderlos.
texts.en:
Teresa, 37, is married and has a 7 year-old child.  She has been raising livestock and farming for 20 years, an activity that she learned from her parents.  Before, she worked as an employee.

She is requesting a loan from the Fundacion Campo to buy grazing cattle, and fertilizers and fungicides to cultivate corn.  This loan will help her a lot, because in this season it's not possible to cultivate crops in the area where she lives, and so she devotes her time to caring for animals, fattening them so that she can later sell them.

loans.use: to buy grazing cattle, and fertilizers and fungicides to cultivate corn

loans.name: Sergio

texts.es: Sergio, de 42 años es un hombre amable y bueno.  Es soltero y vive en su casa propia la cual construyo con mucho esfuerzo y trabajo.El negocio de Sergio consiste en el alquiler de mototaxis, razón por la cual van a su casa 02  personas a quienes alquila sus vehículos. Lleva realizando éste negocio hace más de 03 años y le ha permitido tener un ingreso económico fijo para su hogar. Espera poder seguir haciendo éste negocio, para más adelante incrementar su flota con algunos vehículos más.Este es el primer crédito con Kiva, por tanto está muy contenta de saber que tiene un apoyo financiero, ya que así se sentirá segura de avanzar con su negocio.  Además está muy comprometida en cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas.Con el monto solicitado de 800 soles, comprará piezas y repuestos para el mantenimiento de sus vehículos que se encuentran deteriorados por el uso constante y el paso del tiempo.
texts.en:
Sergio is 42 years old, and is a good and friendly man. He is single and lives in his own house, which he constructed with a great deal of work and effort. 

Sergio's business is renting mototaxis, so two people come to his home and he rents them his vehicles. He has been running this business for more than three years, and it has allowed him to have a steady income for his household. 

He hopes to be able to continue operating this business so that later on he can increase his fleet with a few more vehicles. This is his first loan with Kiva, so he is very happy to know that he will have the financial assistance, as this way he will feel more secure in moving forward with his business. 

In addition, he is very committed to making his installment payments. With the amount applied for of 800 soles, he will buy replacement parts for maintaining his vehicles, which are in poor condition due to constant use and the passage of time.

loans.use: To buy replacement parts for his mototaxis.

loans.name: Bayardo De Jesus

texts.es: Bayardo, 56 años de edad de oficio comerciante, dueño de una mini pulpería y venta de comida ya tiene  más de 1 año con este negocio, el cual empezó con ahorros que tenía y con apoyo de su esposa quien le sugirió poner la venta de comida al mismo tiempo. Este negocio es familiar ambos comparten las actividades laborales entre atender la pulpería y la venta de comida a domicilio. También realiza comida para eventos. Pues el desea conseguir otros ingresos que le permita brindarle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia. Él solicita el financiamiento para comprar jugos, gaseosas, agua embotellada, granos básicos, productos de limpieza, enlatados, avenas, snacks etc. Desea poco a poco ir surtiendo su pulpería y poner un comideria de platos caseros.
texts.en:
Bayardo, 56, is a merchant by profession; he owns a small store grocery store and food business that he’s had for more than a year.  He started it with savings he had and with support from his wife who suggested he start selling food too.  This is a family business and they both share the work tasks among tending to the store and making home food deliveries.  He also caters events because he wants to get other sources of income to provide better quality of life for his family.

He’s asking for financing to buy juice, soft-drinks, bottled water, basic grains, cleaning supplies, canned goods, oatmeal, snacks, etc.  He’d like to gradually stock his grocery store and to open a home-cooked meals eatery.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for his store.

loans.name: Anita De Jesús

texts.es:
Anita tiene 30 años de edad, esta acompañada y tiene dos hijos. Se dedica a los oficios domésticos y al cuidado de  su casa ya que se preocupa por tener su casa limpia y en buenas condiciones para vivir y  que su familia pueda tener las condiciones adecuadas.  La señora se dedica a la prestación de servicio de lavar y planchar ropa y de mas oficios domésticos que le generan ingresos para solventar los gastos en el hogar, ya que se a dedicado a los oficios domésticos desde que tenia 12 años de edad; oficio que aprendió de su madre y desde entonces la señora tiene 18 años de que aprendió y ahora trabaja en una casa particular donde tiene 2 años de trabajar ofreciendo los servicios oficios domésticos.


El prestamoque esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar  400 Bloques, 18 Bolsas de Cemento, 1.5 Quintal de hierro de 3/8, 1 Quintal de hierro de liso, 12 Cuartones de 5 Metros, 12 Cuartones de 3 Metros, 8 Laminas Zincalum, 2 Libras de Clavos, para construir una cocina; ya que la que tiene actualmente es de bahareque y le causa muchos problemas en la época lluviosa.

Mejorara su condición de vida teniendo una vivienda en optimas condiciones; ya que estos momentos se encuentra en mal estado la parte de la cocina ya que el suelo se inunda en la época lluviosa; pero con el crédito construirá la cocina para que su familia tenga mejores condiciones de vida, debido a  que de ella dependen 2 hijos uno de 3 Años y el otro de 5 años de edad.
texts.en:
Anita, 30, has a spouse and two children.  She does domestic chores and tends to her house because she wants to have a clean house and good living conditions so her family can have adequate conditions.  She takes in laundry and ironing and does other domestic chores that generate income to cover household expenses; she’s been working doing domestic chores since she was 12-years-old.  She learned this occupation from her mother and since then she’s been working for 18 years.  She’s now employed in a private home and has been working there for two years doing domestic chore

The loan she’s asking Fundación Campo for is to buy 400 concrete blocks, 18 sacks of cement, 1-1/2 quintal of rebar, 3/8 quintal of smooth iron, 12 5-meter beams, 12 3-meter beams, 8 metal sheets and two pounds of nails to build a kitchen because the one she has now is made of mud and reeds and it has many problems in the rainy season.
