Her living conditions will improve having a house in optimal conditions because the kitchen is currently in poor condition because the floor floods during the rainy season but she’ll use the loan to build the kitchen so her family will have better living conditions.  Her two children who are 3 and 5 years of age depend on her.

loans.use: to buy building supplies.

loans.name: Norma Isabel

texts.es:
Norma es una mujer de 35 años de edad joven y madre de 5 el mayor estudio y pudo graduarse de la secundaria los otros tres le ayudan con las diferentes actividades en el campo y el ultimo de 11 meses de nacido los  cuales dependen de ella y su pareja en todos los aspectos. Ella tiene un grado de educación primaria no completado el cual pudo cursar hasta 3 grado y agradece el esfuerzo y sacrificio por parte de sus padres para que ella pudiese tener un conocimiento básico; pero no pudo seguir por la falta de apoyo económico. Ella tiene mucha experiencia en el trabajo de la agricultura ya que sus padres le enseñaron desde muy pequeña a trabajar la tierra en donde es cultivado el café el cual lo aprendió por tradición familiar. Los terrenos que ella y su compañero de hogar cultivan son propios gracias a una herencia por parte de sus padres los cuales están ubicados a una distancia de 300 metros de su casa de habitación al cual se traslada a pie diariamente para dar asistencia y mantenimiento en compañía de sus hijos y su pareja.

Hoy en día ella solicita ayuda para la compra de abono y fertilizantes para el mantenimiento de sus cultivos ya que con este apoyo podrá proteger sus cultivos de café ya que de esa forma estará más seguro de plagas entre otros.

Su sueños es mejorar día a día sus cultivos poder incrementar un poco más sus cosechas en variedad y calidad ya que sus hijos son la prioridad más grande, sus estudios y otras necesidades que diariamente se presentan para el mejoramiento de su familia.
texts.en:
Norma is a 35 year-old woman and mother of five.  Her oldest has graduated from secondary school, and three of the others help her with the various activities in the fields.  Her youngest is 11 months old.  Her children depend on her and her partner in all aspects.  Norma has a 3rd grade education.  Thanks to her efforts and sacrifice on the part of her parents, she was able to get a rudimentary education, but she was not able to continue due to a lack of financial resources.  

Norma has a lot of experience working in agriculture, because her parents taught her to work the land from the time that she was very young.   She learned through family tradition how to grow coffee.  The land that she and her partner cultivate is their own, thanks to an inheritance from their parents.  The land is located 300 meters from the house where they live.  Norma walks there each day along with her partner and children to care for and maintain her coffee crops.

Norma is now requesting help to buy organic and chemical fertilizers to maintain her crops, since with this support she will be able to protect her coffee plants.  With these supplies they will be more resistant to pests and other threats.

Norma's dream is to continue improving her crops so that she can increase the size, variety and quality of her harvests. She says that her children are her greatest priority – especially their studies – but also all of the other things that come up daily that her family needs or that can improve their quality of life.

loans.use: to buy organic and chemical fertilizers to maintain her coffee crops

loans.name: Nehemias Gamaliel

texts.es:
Nehemias tiene 32 años de edad, esta acompañado y tiene un hijo. Se dedica al comercio desde hace 18 años, vende calzado desde que tenia 14 años de edad;  pero ahora quiere incrementar su negocio y ampliarlo con otros productos como ropa de diferentes estilos, para niños, jóvenes y adultos.


El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar 10 Docenas de blusas, 6 Docenas de pantalones para jóvenes, 5 Docenas de pantalones juveniles, 5 Docenas de pantalones para niño, 2 Docenas de calzonetas, 2 Docenas de camisas juveniles, 2 Docenas de camisas para niño. Con la inversión comprara más mercadería para incrementar su comercio  ya que distribuye la mercadería en diferentes pueblos y su esposa le apoya a vender.


Su visión,  es que su negocio aumente  y tener diversas cosas para ofrecer a sus clientes. Posee un puesto de venta en el municipio y los días miércoles tiene puesto de venta en una ciudad y también sale a vender a distintos pueblos para vender mas rápido la mercadería y obtener mayores ganancias. Él es una persona responsable y luchadora que se preocupa por darle a su familia las condiciones de vida adecuadas y espera que con la inversión en su negocio poder tener una mejor calidad de vida.



Su deseo, es seguir creciendo y descubrir  nuevas zonas donde pueda vender su mercadería y tener nuevos clientes para tener mayor cobertura y tener mayores ganancias.
texts.en:
Nehemias, 32, has a spouse and a son.  He’s been a merchant for 18 years; he’s sold shoes since he was 14 years of age but he’d now like to expand the business and add other products like various styles of clothes for children, young adults and adults.

The loan he’s asking Fundación Campo is to buy 10 dozen blouses, 6 dozen pants for young adults, 5 dozen pants for youth, 5 dozen pants for children, 2 dozen shorts, 2 dozen juvenile shirts and 2 dozen children’s shirts.  With this investment he’ll buy more merchandise to increase trade since he sells the merchandise in various towns and his wife helps him sell.

His vision is that his business grows and to have various things to offer his customers.  He has a sales stand in town and on Wednesdays sells in a city and also goes out to various towns to sell his merchandise more quickly and earn higher profits.  He’s a responsible, hardworking man who strives to give adequate living conditions to his family and hopes that with this investment in his business will be able to have better quality of life.

His wish is to continue growing and discover new zones where he can sell his merchandise and to have new customers to have wider coverage and higher profits.

loans.use: to buy clothes.

loans.name: Villa Universitaria Group

texts.es:
¡Saludos desde Perú! Este es el grupo Villa Universitaria
 
Teresa es uno de sus miembros.Ella tiene 41 años es soltera y madre de 02 hijos de 17 y 08 años respectivamente. Teresa vive en casa de sus padres, allí tiene su negocio; una  Bodega bazar donde vende todo tipo de productos entre abarrotes, gaseosas y útiles de librería. Teresa siempre mantiene su bodega surtida para que sus clientes puedan estar contentos, son 07 años que tiene este negocio al cual le dedica muchas horas semanales, gracias a los ingresos que percibe por su trabajo puede costear la manutención de sus hijos y ayudarlos en sus estudios. Teresa ha solicitado este préstamo para comprar más productos para su bodega de esa manera quiere que su negocio siga prosperando para que pueda ser uno de los mejores en su barrio, obtener este préstamo le da tranquilidad;se siente muy feliz y agradecida a los inversores que hacen posible que ella y su grupo puedan obtener esta ayuda.
Teresa aparece en la foto con polo color plomo con rayas azules.
texts.en:
Greetings from Peru!  This is the communal bank "Villa Universitaria."

Teresa is one of the members.  She is 41 years old, and is the single mother of 2 children aged 17 and 8.  Teresa lives in her parent's house, and that is also where her business is located.  She has a general store where she sells all types of groceries, soft drinks and school supplies.  Teresa always keeps her store well stocked to keep her customers happy.  She's had the business for 7 years, and she spends many hours there each week.  Thanks to the income that she earns through her work, she can afford to support her children and help them with their education.  

Teresa is requesting this loan so that she can buy more products for her store.  In this way, she hopes to keep her business prospering so that she can be one of the best in the neighborhood.  This loan is giving her peace of mind; she feels very happy and grateful to the lenders who are making it possible for her and her group to obtain this assistance.  

In the photo, Teresa is the one wearing the gray shirt with blue stripes.

loans.use: to buy products for her store

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es: Rosa, de 21 años de edad es una mujer amable y buena, esta casada con Juan de 23 años, con quiene tiene 02 pequeños,juntos viven en su casa propia.El trabajo de Rosa consiste en la venta de ropa de segunda mano y para poder vender y tener buenas ganancias se va a los pueblos y caseríos cerca de la ciudad, en donde vende o hace intercambio de prendas con los pobladores.Desea seguir trabajando para seguir progresando y mas adelante vender ropa nueva para seguir con su desarrollo laboral.Este será su primer crédito con Kiva, está muy contenta de saber que tendrá un apoyo económico que le permitirá tener un incremento en su inversión. Por otro lado se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual.Con el monto solicitado 500 soles comprará mas ropa para seguir con su venta, además de comprar algunos productos que le hicieron pedido en los caseríos que visita.
texts.en:
Rosa, 21, is a kind, good woman married to Juan, 23, with whom she has two little ones; they all live together in a house that’s theirs.  Rosa’s work consists in selling second-hand clothes and in order to sell and earn good profits she goes to nearby towns and settlements where she sells or trades clothes with the inhabitants.  She wants to continue working to make progress and later on sell new clothes to continue developing in business.

This will be her first Kiva loan and she’s very happy to know that she’ll have financial support that will make it possible for her to increase her investment.  On the other hand, she commits to make her payments punctually.  She will use the requested 500 soles to buy more clothes to continue with her sales; she will also buy some products that have been ordered in some of the settlements she visits.

loans.use: to buy second-hand clothing at wholesale.

loans.name: Roseli

texts.es: Roseli, tiene 29 años de edad esta casada y vive acompañada de su esposo y su hijo en su casa propia.Su principal actividad es brindar sus servicios de niñera, hace dos años que viene desempeñándose como tal, se inicio buscando ingresos extras para mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia y mejorar la infraestructura de su hogar. Ya que es en su casa donde cuida a los niños que tiene a su cargo. Al principio se le presentaron muchas dificultades ya que no tenía un lugar apropiado para que desempeñe su actividad. Pero gracias a Dios y al apoyo de su familia salio adelante y venció todas las dificultades que se le presentaron.Con los ingresos extras que recibe, y de las ganancias que percibe de la venta de quesos, actividad complementaria que realiza los fines de semana, espera mejorar la infraestructura de su casa para brindar un mejor servicio.Esta es su primer crédito con Kiva, y esta muy agradecida por la oportunidad que se le presenta para obtener una línea de financiamiento el cual le será muy útil para su desempeño laboral.En esta oportunidad solicitara S/.1500 soles el cual lo invertirá en mejorar la infraestructura de su casa con cemento y ladrillos.
texts.en:
Roseli, 29, is married and lives with her husband and son in her own house.  Her main activity is providing childcare services.  She’s been working as such for two years.  

She started out seeking extra income to improve her family’s quality of life and to improve her home’s infrastructure since that’s where she cares for the children she has in her care.  At first, she had many difficulties because she did not have an appropriate place to carry out her activity.  But thanks to God and to her family’s support, she moved ahead and overcame all the difficulties that arose.  With the extra income she earns and the profits she gets from selling cheese, a complimentary activity she does on weekends, she hopes to improve her house’s infrastructure in order to provide better service.

This is her fist Kiva loan and she’s very grateful for the opportunity she’s getting to access a line of credit that will be very useful for her business.  On this occasion, she’ll request 1,500 soles to improve the infrastructure of her house with cement and bricks.

loans.use: to buy cement and bricks.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane lives in Nkubu, in the Meru region of Eastern Kenya. She is married and has three children. She has been doing farming for 15 years. Her main sources of income are tea leaves, potatoes, bananas, maize and beans.

She wants to purchase poultry, and so she has requested a loan of KES 40,000 from Juhudi Kilimo. She says that the loan will give her family better eating habits and provide quality education for her children.

She chose Juhudi Kilimo because it offers loans on reducing balance basis, and the funds are so encouraging and welcoming.

loans.use: to purchase poultry.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es: Rosa a sus 33 años de edad vive en su casa propia a lado de su esposo y sus 4 hijos.Rosa se dedica a la venta de comidas por eso tiene un puesto en el mercado de su localidad en donde vende diferentes platos típicos como caldo de gallina, juanes,entre otros. Al principio cuando era soltera solía vender con su mama, ayudándola en el negocio, pero hace varios años, cuando se caso lo hace sola en dicho puesto , además vende gallinas en su hogar.Anteriormente no podía independizarse y poner su propio negocio, pero gracias a su trabajo y al apoyo de su familia pudo establecerse y ahora cuenta con un negocio estable , con las ganancias que obtiene de la venta de comida, espera seguir creciendo y mejorar su negocio para ofrecer un mejor servicio y aumentar sus ventas.Este es el primer crédito con Kiva, y esta muy agradecida por el apoyo económico que recibe ya que le ayudara a mejorar su negocio razón por la cual se compromete a ser puntual con sus pagos.  Rosa, invertirá los S/.1000 soles en comprar gallinas , arroz ,huevos y otros ingredientes que utilizará en la preparación de sus comidas..
texts.en:
At the age of 33, Rosa lives in her own house alongside her husband and their four children.  Rosa sells food and has a stand in her local market where she sells various typical dishes like chicken soup and ‘juanes’ [similar to tamales but made of rice and other ingredients], among others.  

At first, when she was single, she used to sell with her mother helping her with her business but several years ago when she got married she started to do it alone in said stand.  She also sells chickens at home.  

Previously she was unable to become independent and open her own business but thanks to her work and family support she was able to establish herself and now has a stable business.  With profits earned from the food sales she hopes to continue growing and improving her business in order to offer better service and increase sales.

This is her first Kiva loan and she’s very grateful for the economic support she received for it will help her manager her business which is why she commits to be punctual with her payments.  Rosa will invest the 1,000 soles to buy chickens, rice, eggs and other ingredients she’ll use to prepare her dishes.

loans.use: to buy chickens, rice, eggs and other ingredients.

loans.name: Marta Lidia

texts.es: Marta, tiene 58 años de edad, casada, vive en una colonia del municipio de Puerto Cortes junto a su hijo y su esposo. Hace 3 años que ella decidió por tener un negocio propio y estableció una pulpería donde vende productos de la canasta básica familiar como granos básicos, refrescos, churros, azúcar, manteca, condimentos, productos enlatados, pastas, jabón, etc. El préstamo que ha solicitado es por 10,000 lempiras es su segundo prestamo en ODEF con el cual va comprar churros, refrescos, granos básicos y otros abarrotes para surtir la pulpería y atraer mas clientes. Su plan es ampliar el negocio.
texts.en:
Marta, 58, is married and lives in a neighborhood in Puerto Cortes with her son and husband.  Three years ago she decided to have her own business and opened a grocery store where she sells basic family staple items like basic grains, soft-drinks, packaged snacks, sugar, shortening, condiments, canned goods, noodles, soap, etc.

The loan she’s requested is for 10,000 Lempiras and it’s her second ODEF loan.  She will use it to buy packages snacks, soft-drinks, basic grains and other grocery items to stock her grocery store and attract more customers.  Her plan is to expand the business.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for her store.

loans.name: William

texts.en:
William lives in the Eldoret area of Kenya, which is primarily a milk producing area. He has five children and has been farming for five years. His income sources include milk, eggs, crops, and other personal business. He says that what he finds most enjoyable about farming is: 'grazing his animals'. His biggest challenge is 'getting dairy feed.' Animals on the farm have been given the names of 'zulii'.

William was asked why he chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan; he replied: 'they come to us.'  William was also asked what he learned during Juhudi's required micro-finance training session; he replied: 'record keeping.' His highest monthly expense is farming costs. When asked 'How will this loan benefit his family?'; William replied: 'I will pay school fees in time.'

As part of Juhudi's loan appraisal process, each borrower's assets are evaluated. William owns the following: 'a cow, poultry, and a bicycle' but does not own a 'pig, pump, motorcycle, or automobile'. Juhudi Kilimo also tries to measure any change in living standards due to administered loans. William has in his household 'a mosquito net and solar power' but does not have 'electricity, running water, a sewing machine, TV, or DVD'.

Note: To create this loan profile, Juhudi Kilimo used a mobile device to gather information in the field and then sent the data to a central online repository, thus reducing paper use, making the process more efficient, and keeping costs down.

loans.use: to purchase poultry.

loans.name: Merlin Maricela

texts.es: Merlin, tiene 46 años de edad, es soltera por viudez, tiene a su cargo 5 hijos con quienes vive en el municipio de San Francisco, Atlántida. Ella inicio su negocio de cría y venta de ganado y cerdos. Hace 6 años estableció una pequeña pulpería para obtener otros ingresos para el sostenimiento familiar. vende manteca, harina, azucar, cafe, pan, sal, frijoles, condimentos, refrescos y otros, tambien tiene cria de cerdes para vender.Ha decidido solicitar un préstamo por 10,000 lempiras para surtir la pulpería con más productos de consumo diario como granos básicos, lácteos, refrescos, churros, manteca, azúcar, productos de limpieza etc. para satisfacer la demanda de los clientes. su plan es que el negocio crezca y poderle dar calidad de vida a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Merlin, 46, is single due to widowhood.  She has five children in her care and she lives in the municipality of San Francisco, Atlántida.  She started a business raising and selling cattle and pigs.  Six years ago she opened a small grocery store to earn extra income to support her family.  She sells lard, flour, sugar, coffee, bread, salt, beans, condiments, soft-drinks and others.  She also raises pigs to sell.

She’s decided to request a 10,000 Lempira loan to stock the store with more basic staple items like basic grains, dairy products, soft-drinks, packaged snacks, lard, sugar, cleaning supplies, etc. to meet customer demand.  Her plan is that the business grows and to be able to give her children quality of life.

loans.use: to stock her store.

loans.name: Sofia

texts.en:
Sofia is a married mother of three children, all of whom attend school. She lives at a rental house that has electricity, but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and transport.

For the past three years, she has operated a clothes-selling business, selling from door to door to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of the high cost of transportation. 

She dreams of expanding and establishing a boutique business in the future. She will use the loan of Kshs (KES) 20,000 to buy more clothes for resale, so she can get a good profit and support her family.

loans.use: to buy more clothes for resale.

loans.name: Dora Yannin

texts.es:
Dora, es una joven trabajadora, habitante de la ciudad de Granada, casada, madre de un hijo. Ella es dueña de un puesto de granos básicos. Este negocio lo inicio con ayuda de un tío quien le sugirió que vendiera granos básicos para que subsistiera ya que su abuelita había muerto quien era la persona que la había criado. Su tío le dio su primer saco de arroz que vendiera. Actualmente tiene 10 años vende arroz, maíz, frijoles, trigo por libra su esposo trabaja como albañil y es así como ambos salen adelante cada día. 
Ella está requiriendo el crédito para comprar arroz al por mayor. El crédito le permitirá comprar a un mejor precio y mantenerlo pues durante el invierno el precio sube y así podrá comprarlo antes que incremente. Le gustaría tener un distribuidora de alimentos al por mayor.
texts.en:
Dora’s a young worker living in the city of Granada.  She’s married and the mother of one son.  She owns a basic grains stand.  

She started the business with help from her uncle who suggested that she sell basic grains so she could support herself since her grandmother who had raised her had died.  Her uncle gave her her first sack of rice to sell.  Now, she’s been selling rice, corn, beans and wheat by the pound for ten years.  Her husband works in construction and this is how the two of them get ahead day to day.

She needs credit to buy rice at wholesale.  The loan will make it possible for her to buy at a better price and to store it for the winter because during winter the price rises and she will be able to buy it before this price rise takes place.  She’d like to have a wholesale food distribution center.

loans.use: to buy rice at wholesale.

loans.name: Richard

texts.en:
Richard was born in 1982 at Makiro – Mabanga, Kebisoni. He is married and has two children. He is educated, and he was a primary school teacher for several years, under public service. Later, he changed to the private sector, to begin his own business. He started his business in 2010, with the aim of generating daily income. After starting his business, he found out that his capital was not enough to run the business. He joined UGAFODE Microfinance Limited (MDI) in 2011, for financial assistance to boost his business. He was able to expand his business and now caters to a variety of customers.

With this loan, Richard is going to add more stock to his business, with the aim of getting more customers. He goes ahead to thank MDI for the support which it has given him in his business endeavors, which impacts his family’s well-being.

loans.use: To buy retail stock

loans.name: Maritza

texts.es:
Maritza a sus 62 años de edad es una mujer muy trabajadora y responsable, es viuda y vive sola en su casa propia.Su principal actividad es la agricultura, tiene sus terrenos a una hora de donde vive, antes ella acompañaba a su esposo a las chacras pero a raíz de su muerte ah tenido que hacerse cargo sola de sus terrenos pero por motivos de salud y su avanzada edad no puede ir a cuidar sus tierras todos los días, por lo que ha empezado a criar gallos para luego venderlos y de esa manera percibir ingresos extras, al principio se le hizo muy difícil hacerlo todo sola, ya que estaba acostumbrada a trabajar con su esposo, ella solía acompañarlo a todos lados, pero gracias a su fortaleza a logrado salir adelante.Lo que ahora espera es que su negocio siga creciendo y que sus animales aumenten para que sus ventas también aumenten y mejore sus ingresos.Esta es su primer crédito con Kiva, y esta muy agradecida por la oportunidad que se le presenta para obtener una línea de financiamiento el cual le será muy útil.
En esta oportunidad solicitara S/.500 soles con el cual contratará a un trabajador del lugar para que despeje el pasto de sus chacras ya que ella no puede hacerlo.
texts.en:
At the age of 62, Maritza’s a very hardworking, responsible woman. She’s a widow living alone in her own house.  Her main activity is agriculture.  Her parcels of land are located an hour away from where she lives.  Her husband used to go with her to work the land but since he’s died she’s had to take care of all the chores alone but because of her health and her advanced age she can no longer care for her land every day which is why she’s started to raise roosters to then sell as a way of earning extra income.

At first, it was very difficult to do everything by herself since she was used to working with her husband.  She used to accompany him everywhere.  But thanks to her strength she’s managed to get ahead.  What she hopes for is that her business will continue growing and that her animals will increase so that her sales will too and her income will improve.

This is her first Kiva loan and she’s very grateful for the opportunity being offered to have a line of credit that will be very useful.  On this occasion she’ll request 500 soles to hire a local day laborer to weed her fields because she can no longer do it.

loans.use: to hire a local day laborer.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es: María tiene 32 años de edad, es casada y vive acompañada de su esposo y sus 2 hijos. Su actividad principal era la agricultura pero hace mas de un año y por motivos de salud ya no acompaña a su esposo a las chacras, por eso decidio poner una tienda de productos comestibles en su casa y así percibir más ingresos económicos con el unico fin de ayudar a su esposo en los gastos de su hogar,poco a poco a logrado salir adelante y ahora tiene un negocio estable gracias a su empeño y su trabajo.Con los ingresos y las ganancias que percibe de las ventas espera ampliar su negocio y seguir creciendo para mejorar su nivel de vida y el de su familia.Este es su primer crédito con Kiva, y esta muy agradecida por el apoyo económico recibido ya que le permite seguir con sus objetivos laborales.El dinero solicitado de S/.800.00 lo invertirá en la compra de productos comestibles tales como leche ,arroz, azúcar,entre otros para así surtir su tienda.
texts.en:
María, 32, is married living with her husband and two children.  Her main activity used to be agriculture but over a year ago because of health reasons she stopped accompanying her husband to the fields and this is why she decided to open a grocery store at home to earn extra income with the only goal in mind to help her husband with household expenses.  She’s gradually moved forward and now she has a stable business thanks to her dedication and work.  With income earned and profits gained from the sales she hopes to expand the business and to continue growing in order to improve her and her family’s standard of living.  

This is her first Kiva loan and she’s very grateful for the economic support she’s getting because it will allow her to reach her work goals.  The requested 800 soles will be used to buy food items like milk, rice and sugar, among others to stock her store.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Runyinya Kigugu Tukwatanis Group

texts.en:
Aidah is a Ugandan citizen aged 48 years. She is married and has five children, and she lives in Runyinya – Kinombe, Rukungiri District. She does ordinary jobs as an agriculturalist, including a pig-raising project, which she does with her husband in order to take care of their family. Aidah and her husband work hand-in-hand to make sure that their piggery project is sustainable. As of now, they have over 50 pigs and piglets, inclusive.

Aidah and her husband sought financial assistance from UGAFODE Microfinance Limited (MDI) - Rukungiri Branch, Aidah becoming a member of a borrowing group called Runyinya Kigugu Tukwatanis Group. She will use her share of this loan for the piggery project, in the form of hiring labour and buying feed, among other uses.

She is very grateful for the assistance advanced to her, in the form of financing, on different occasions by UGAFODE Microfinance Limited (MDI), and she hopes they continue doing the same.

loans.use: To buy feed and hire labour for the pigs' care

loans.name: Furaha

texts.en:
Furaha is a married woman, who has three school-going children. They live at their own house, which has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past one year, she has had a tailoring business, operating from the market, where neighbours and passersby are potential customers. In addition, she operates a motorcycle business to supplement her earnings. She faces a major challenge of seasonality, in her place of operation.

With the KES 50,000 she wants to purchase cloth materials and needles, and to repair her broken sewing machine.

loans.use: to purchase cloth materials and needles, and to repair her broken sewing machine.

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
Judith is originally from the Dominican Republic and has been in the hair industry for the past 25 years. Judith first moved to New York City where she opened her first hair salon. She owned and operated this salon for 7 ½ years before relocating to Washington, DC. 

In 2006, Judith opened her second salon in the neighborhood of Adams Morgan in Washington, DC. The studio currently employs 9 stylists. Judith is requesting a $5,000 loan to purchase additional inventory and products for her hair salon. She plans to build a display shelf at the front of her salon to sell hair products to her customers. Judith is married and has a 22-year-old daughter and two teenage sons. In the future, Judith hopes to open an additional hair salon in Maryland.

loans.use: to purchase inventory for her hair salon

loans.name: Gloria Suyapa

texts.es: Gloria, tiene 39 años de edad, casada, tiene 3 hijos y vive en una colonia del municipio de Choloma, Cortes. Gloria trabajo por muchos años en una maquila donde adquirió experiencia en confección de ropa. Luego quedo sin empleo y decidió poner su propio taller de elaboración de ropa intima para damas. Ella ha solicitado prestamos en otra institución y actualmente a decidido solicitar uno en ODEF por 23,000 Lempiras para comprar la materia prima como telas, hilos, elásticos y otros materiales para la confeccion de ropa intima. Su idea es incrementar las ventas y que siempre haya demanda para sus productos.
texts.en: Gloria, 39, is married and has three children; she lives in a neighborhood in the municipality of Choloma, Cortes.  Gloria worked for many years in an assembly plant where she gained experience making clothes.  When she became unemployed she decided to open her own women’s underwear manufacturing shop.  She’s requested loans from another institution but has now decided to ask ODEF for one for 23,000 Lempiras to buy raw materials like fabric, thread, elastic and others to make intimate ware.  Her idea is to increase sales since her products are always in demand.

loans.use: to buy sewing supplies.

loans.name: Karen Waleska

texts.es: Karen, tiene 32 años de edad, es madre soltera, tiene una hija con quien vive en una aldea del municipio de San Pedro Sula. Karen siempre se ha dedicado al comercio, hace 6 años que decidió por dedicarse a la venta de frutas y verduras de la temporada como chiles, zanahorias, repollo, mangos, tomates, cilantro y otros. El negocio lo tiene establecido en un local del mercado de la ciudad. Esta solicitando un préstamo por 15,000 lempiras para comprar verduras y frutas de la temporada y poder vender por cantidades grandes a sus clientes. Tiene como meta crecer con el negocio para poder ahorrar y arreglar su casa para mejorar su condición de vida.
texts.en:
Karen, 32, is a single mother; she has a daughter that lives with her in a village in the municipality of San Pedro Sula.  Karen’s always worked in commerce.  Six years ago she decided to sell seasonal fruit and vegetables like chilies, carrots, cabbage, mangoes, tomatoes, cilantro and others.  Her business is located in a stand in the city’s market.  

She’s asking for a 15,000 Lempira loan to buy seasonal fruit and vegetables to be able to sell to her customers in large amounts.  Her goal is to grow in business in order to save to fix her house and improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy seasonal fruit and vegetables.

loans.name: Mujeres Solidarias Group

texts.es:
Diomedes  es miembro del  grupo Mujeres Solidarias

Diomedes de 49 años, es separado y tiene 06 hijos. Diomedes no vive con con sus hijos, pero económicamente está pendiente de ellos. El trabaja realizando transporte público empezó como cobrador pero gracias a un amigo que le enseño, aprendió a manejar; ahora trabaja haciendo servicio de transporte publico,antes alquilaba un carro para poder trabajar, con mucho esfuerzo ha podido comprar su propio carro con el que trabaja,en algunas oportunidades también realiza trabajos eventuales de albañilería, estos ingresos le permiten darle a sus hijos una buena educación y sustento diario. En esta oportunidad ha solicitado un nuevo crédito para comprar llantas para su carro, de esa manera su unidad estará operativa para que pueda seguir trabajando, más adelante también quiere mejorar su casa y continuar apoyando a sus hijos.
Diomedes está agradecido a los inversionistas de todo el mundo por su  préstamo y el de su grupo comunal , porque gracias a esta ayuda pueden salir adelante.
texts.en:
Diomedes is a member of the Mujeres Solidarias group. He is 49 years old, separated, and has six children. Diomedes does not live with his children, but he supports them financially. He works in public transport. He began as a conductor, but thanks to a friend who taught him how, he learned to drive. He now works providing public transport services. Previously, he rented a car to work with, but with a lot of effort, he has managed to buy his own car, with which he works. Sometimes, he also does odd jobs as a builder. This income means he can give his children a good education and daily support. 

On this occasion, he has requested a new loan to buy tires for his car. In this way, his car will be in good working order and he can continue to work. In the future, he also wants to make home improvements and keep supporting his children. Diomedes is grateful to the investors all over the world for his loan and that of his group, because thanks to this help, he can move forwards.

loans.use: to buy tires.

loans.name: Las Pioneras Group

texts.es: Albina es integrante del grupo “Las Pioneras” conformada por 07  mujeres responsables, la gran mayoría de ellas vecinas de la zona. Albina se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza lo cual lo realiza a pedidos, como actividad segundaría vende gelatinas y chupete de hielo. Se siente feliz pues gracias a su esfuerzo puede seguir apoyando a su familia. A futuro le gustaría poner un restaurante, pues así asegura ella tendrá mayores ganancias. El crédito solicitado lo destinará para la compra de perfumes, cremas, colonias y de esta manera tener que ofrecer a sus clientes. Albina tiene  52 años de edad casada con 02 hijos en etapa escolar. El grupo “Las Pioneras” agradece el crédito brindado. Albina se encuentra sentada es la segunda del lado izquierdo y viste polo rojo y pantalón crema. Jacinta no pudo estar presente por motivo de trabajo.
texts.en:
Albina’s a member of the “Las Pioneras” (The Pioneers) group which is a group of seven responsible women for the most part neighbors from the zone.  Albina works selling beauty products to order; as a secondary activity she sells gelatin treats and frozen pops.  She feels happy because thanks to her efforts she can continue supporting her family.  In the future, she’d like to open a restaurant because she’s sure to earn higher profits that way.  The requested loan will be used to buy perfume, creams and colognes in order to have stock to offer her customers.  Albina’s 52-years-old, married and has two school age children.  Albina is seated second from the left and is wearing a red shirt and cream pants.  

The “Las Pioneras” group is thankful for the granted loan.  Jacinta was unable to attend because of work.

loans.use: to buy perfume, cream and cologne.

loans.name: Yohaira

texts.es: Yohaira de 24 años de edad se dedica a la fabricación de productos de repostería en su domicilio ubicado en el municipio de Soledad, a 15 minutos de la ciudad de Barranquilla, donde habita. Ella tiene  5 años de experiencia e inició cuando una persona cercana a su familia, le trasladó su experiencia en un negocio parecido, pues ella la observaba día a día y logró aprender a elaborar productos de repostería y desde allí inició su amor por esta actividad.  Así fue que reunió poco a poco un capital con el que compró la herramienta básica y materias primas e insumos y dio marcha a su sueño emprendedor en el año 2010.  Sus ventas las realiza a crédito, mientras sus compras las hace de contado en un su día laboral que inicia desde las 8 de la mañana hasta las 7 de la noche. Sus principales clientes son los locales de repostería quienes hacen sus pedidos y les remiten nuevos clientes. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace ala Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará insumos para la fabricación de ricos prostres especialmente brownies, que son los productos que mas rotan en su negocio y generan mayor rentabilidad, lo cual hace de su credikiva una inversión exitosa.
texts.en:
Yohaira, 24 years old, has a business making baked goods at home. She lives in the neighbourhood of Soledad, 15 minutes away from the city of Barranquilla. 

She has five years of experience and got her start when a family friend passed on her experiences in a similar business. Yohaira observed her every day and managed to learn to make baked goods. Her love for this type of work began from there.

Bit by bit, she raised capital to buy basic tools, primary materials and supplies, and got her entrepreneurial dream rolling in 2010. Her sales are conducted on credit, while she makes her purchases with cash. Her working day runs from eight in the morning to seven at night. Her main customers are bakeries that put in orders and also refer her new customers.

She is currently applying for a Kiva loan, which is her first loan with the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation. With this loan, she will buy supplies to make delicious desserts, especially brownies, which are her most popular product and generate high returns. This means that her Kiva loan will be a successful investment.

loans.use: to buy baking supplies to make brownies in larger volumes.

loans.name: Giannina Marylin

texts.es:
Giannina de 27 años es estudiante Universitaria de Administración de Negocios 
Giannina estudia esta carrera por vocación, porque se siente con la capacidad para afrontar nuevos retos.Giannina aspira a tener un puesto como administradora en alguna empresa de prestigio, actualmente labora como secretaria en una entidad, los ingresos que percibe por ese trabajo le sirven para costear algunos gastos de sus estudios como libros y útiles. Con el préstamo que ha solicitado a EDAPROSPO podrá realizar el pago de su matrícula y un ciclo en la universidad, esto es una gran ayuda para ella porque le permite un descuento adicional por pagar el ciclo completo, de esa manera Giannina podrá concentrarse solo en sus estudios y cumplir sus sueños de ser una gran profesional.
texts.en:
Giannina, 27, is a university student majoring in Business Administration.  She’s studying this career because it’s her vocation; she feels capable of facing new challenges.  Giannina hopes to get a job as a manager in a prestigious firm.  She currently works as a secretary for a firm and the income she earns from this job is useful for her to pay for some of her educational expenses like textbooks and school supplies.

With the loan she’s asked from Edaprospo, she will be able to pay tuition and fees for a university term.  This is of great help to her because she gets an additional discount by paying for the entire cycle at once.  In this way, Giannina will be able to focus just on her studies and reach her dream of becoming a great professional.

loans.use: to pay tuition and fees.

loans.name: Rugiatu

texts.en: This is 47 year-old Rugiatu. She is married and has two children aged 16 and 13 years. In 1996, Rugiatu established her empty five gallon rubber containers business. She began her business to support her child's education. Her business is located in city centre and her main customers are both men and women. Working seven days a week and 10 hours a day, she earns about SLL1,000,000 every month from her business. She would like a loan in the amount of SLL4,000,000. Rugiatu has already received and successfully repaid two loans and now requires this loan to buy more empty five gallon rubber containers. She hopes that this loan will increase her capital base. In the future, Rugiatu plans to complete the construction of their house. She also wants to continue supporting her children's education. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more empty five-gallon rubber containers.

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca is 40 years old and lives in Montserrado County, which has the largest freeport and is the number one commercial county in Liberia. She is married with four children aged between 18 and 25, one of whom lives at home and goes to school. 

Unfortunately Rebecca herself did not go to school, but she is good at managing her business. For the past three years she has been selling charcoal at the local market. She started this business with money given to her by her husband who sells wood. 

Rebecca enjoys her business because the business gives her more money. She sells six days a week, from 7 am to 5 pm, and most of the time she uses a pickup truck to get her goods to her shop. She is requesting a loan to purchase more inventory for her business. Her plans are to build a house and one day build a store.

loans.use: to purchase more inventory for her charcoal business.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Please meet 43-year-old Esther, from Paynesville South in Liberia.  Paynesville South is a suburb of the capital city of Monrovia.  It is one of the areas in Montserrado County with the highest population and best standard of living.  There are good roads, access to water, affordable rents and many transportation options in the area.

Esther is married and her partner works as a wood cutter.  Her four children are between the ages of 6 and 21.  Only two of her children go to school right now, and three are living with her.  She describes herself as a serious woman.

Esther owns her own charcoal business, which she has been running for the past ten.  She began doing her business with her husband, who cut wood for charcoal.  In her business, she faces transportation issues.  Her favorite part of her business is the profit she makes, every time, from her business.  One day, she hopes to own a house.  She intends to use the loan to buy empty rice bags, and to pay the cost of transporting her charcoal to her shop. She is grateful for your support!

loans.use: to buy empty rice bags, and pay the cost of transporting her charcoal to her shop.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es: Maria de 57 años de edad, habita con su cónyuge en la ciudad de Cartagena; ella es madre de 4 hijos en edades adultas y genera ingresos con la actividad de confecciones, desde hace 7 años cuando emprendió su aventura de negocios, aunque hace 10 ya tenia experiencia en este oficio, pues con sus  aptitudes para las artes y el oficio, lo practicaba elaborando prendas de vestir sobre medidas y ganaba dinero. Poco a poco su negocio ha ido creciendo; ella trabaja diariamente desde las 12 del día hasta las 7 de la noche , elaborando y vendiendo prendas a su clientela,  constituida por sus vecinos y amigos además de referidos de estos,  que recomiendan su trabajo basado en la calidad, con la que elabora  todas sus prendas. Últimamente su maquina se daña con mucha frecuencia y para responder a su clientela y continuar sosteniendo su negocio, necesita una maquina de confecciones nueva. Esta es la razón por la cual acude a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará su maquina, teniendo como meta el éxito de esta inversión el aprovechamiento de los pedidos de ropa para adultos e infantil,  que han hecho sus clientes. Ella también tiene como principal meta familiar,  apoyar la gestión de su esposo en su hogar, para compartir los gastos y generar más bienestar para toda su familia.
texts.en:
María, 57, lives with her spouse in the city of Cartagena.  She’s the mother of four adult children and she earns income making clothes.  She started her business venture 7 years ago although she has 10 years’ experience in this line of work because with her skills and aptitude for this work she worked making clothes to order and earned money doing so.

Gradually her business has been growing.  She works every day from noon until 7 at night making and selling articles of clothing to her clientele consisting of her neighbors and friends as well as others referred by them.

Lately, her machine breaks down frequently and in order to continue meeting customer demand and staying in business she needs to buy a new sewing machine.   This is the reason she’s calling on a Kiva loan, her first financing with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, to buy her machine.  Her goal is a successful investment since she has pending customer orders for adult and children’s clothes.  Also, her main family goal is to support her husband with household expenses and to generate more well-being for her entire family.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine.

loans.name: Mamia

texts.en:
37-year-old Mamia operates a cook shop selling rice and soup in the Paynesville South area of Liberia.  It is a suburb of the capital city of Monrovia and one of the most populated areas in Montserrado County.  The area boasts one of the best standards of living in the county with affordable rents, good roads, access to water and lots of transportation options.
 
She is married and has five children between 16 and 10 years old. Three of her children are currently attending school and all of them live at home.  She completed 6th grade before starting her business.  She describes herself as a good businesswoman.

Mamia has had a cook shop business for the past 21 years.  She works 12 hours, six days a week at her business.  Her greatest challenge in business is the rainy season when she hardly gets any customers. She intends to use the loan to buy rice, pepper, fish, charcoal etc. She started her business with help from her husband who sells charcoal.  She likes her business because it helps buy some items for her home. In the future, she wants to own a house.  

She wants to thank the lenders for supporting BRAC Liberia and its borrowers.

loans.use: to buy rice, pepper, fish, charcoal etc.

loans.name: Comfort

texts.en:
This is 43-year-old Comfort from Liberia. She resides in Paynesville South, a suburb just outside Monrovia. The area is one of the most populated areas in Montserrado County with one of the best standards of living in the country.  Good roads, access to clean water, affordable rents and plentiful transportation options makes Paynesville South one of the most popular places to live.
 
Comfort is single with four children between the ages of 17 and 9.  Four of her children currently are attending school and are living with her in her home. She runs a table business selling doughnuts.  She describes herself as a serious businesswoman. She started her business two years ago, using money given to her mother. Typically, she works 7 am to 4 pm from Monday to Saturday at her business and transports her goods to her business by bus.  She cites her greatest challenge as limited capital.  She is proud of her business because it supports her home.

Using the proceeds of this loan, she intends to purchase oil, sugar, flour etc.  In the future, she plans to build her house and educate her children.  She sincerely thanks you in advance for your support.

loans.use: to purchase oil, sugar, flour etc.

loans.name: Mable

texts.en:
Mabel was born in 1957 at Nyamabare, Kebisoni, Rukungiri District. She is married with five children, two of whom attend school. Mabel is a cattle farmer and carries out cattle fattening at Nyamabare – Kebisoni. This is her major source of income. She collects money from her farm milk and cow sales and with this income, she started constructing a house at her residence. When the house reached the roofing stage, she could not buy the roofing sheets by herself. She therefore decided to join UGAFODE Microfinance Limited (MDI) for financial assistance to help fund the roofing process. 

Mabel goes ahead to thank UGAFODE Microfinance Limited (MDI) for the support that it has given her during her business endeavors plus her family’s well being. She is a hardworking woman.

loans.use: To buy iron sheets

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther, 49, operates a shop selling goods such as charcoal, in the Paynesville South area of Liberia.  Paynesville South is a suburb of the capital city of Monrovia, and one of the most populated areas in Montserrado County.  The area boasts one of the best standards of living in the country, with affordable rents, good roads, access to water and lots of transportation options.

Esther is married and has four children, between 18 and 30 years old.  One is currently attending school and lives at home.  Esther, herself, completed the 6th grade, before starting her business.  She describes herself as a good business woman. She has engaged in a charcoal business for the past five years.  She works eight hours per day, six days a week, at her business.  Her greatest challenge in business is the rainy season.

She intends to use the loan to buy more charcoal, which she will sell at her business. She started her business with help from her husband.  She likes her business, because she has more customers.  In the future, she wants to own a house. She wants to thank the lenders for supporting BRAC Liberia and its borrowers.

loans.use: to buy more charcoal to resell

loans.name: Luis Alonso

texts.es: Don Luis, tiene 59 años de edad, casado, tiene 3 hijos con quienes vive en un Barrio del municipio de Yoro. Hace 14 años que don Luis decidió por tener su propio negocio de venta de mercadería y achinería como ser ropa, sandalias, tenis, gorras, útiles escolares, desodorantes, presto barba, talcos, cremas, etc. el negocio lo tiene establecido en un local del mercado de la ciudad. Ha decidido obtener un préstamo por 15,000 Lempiras para comprar ropa como pantalones, camisas, mochilas, sandalias y otros para tener variedad de productos en el inventario y aumentar las ganancias. Su meta es mantener fuerte el negocio para darle mejor calidad de vida a su familia y lograr tener un propio local.
texts.en: Luis, 59, is married and has three children living with him in a neighborhood in the municipality of Yoro.  Fourteen years ago Luis decided to have his own business selling merchandise like clothes, sandals, tennis shoes, caps, school supplies, deodorant, shaving cream, talc, creams, etc., and low-cost novelties.  His business is located in a stand in the municipal market.  He’s decided on a 15,000 Lempira loan to buy clothes like pants and shirts and backpacks, sandals and others to have a variety of products in stock and increase profits.  His goal is to have a strong business to provide better quality of life for his family and to succeed in having his own locale.

loans.use: to buy clothes, backpacks, sandals and others.

loans.name: Rosa Nolvia

texts.es:
Doña Rosa es una mujer de 40 años de edad madre de 3 hijos los cuales dependen de ella y su esposo en todos los aspectos. Ella tiene un grado de educación primario completo el cual pudo terminar gracias al esfuerzo, dedicación y apoyo que sus padres le brindaron; pero no pudo seguir por la falta de apoyo económico. Ella tiene mucha experiencia en el trabajo de la agricultura ya que sus padres le enseñaron desde muy pequeña a trabajar la tierra en donde es cultivado el café y granos básicos como maíz, arroz y frijoles. Sus clientes son los diferentes compradores que llegan a la zona y también las bodegas en la zona urbana donde es vendido su producto directamente. 

Hoy en día ella solicita ayuda para la compra de insumos como ser: abono, fertilizantes, foliares entre otros para el mantenimiento de sus cultivos ya que con este apoyo podrá proteger sus cultivos de café y hortalizas y estará más seguro de plagas entre otros.

Su sueños es mejorar día a día sus cultivos poder incrementar un poco más sus cosechas en variedad y calidad ya que sus hijos son la prioridad más grande, sus estudios y otras necesidades que diariamente se presentan para el mejoramiento de su familia.
texts.en:
Rosa’s a 40-year-old mother of three children who depend on her and her husband for everything.  She completed elementary school which she was able to do thanks to her effort and dedication and to the support she got from her parents but was unable to continue for lack of economic support.  She has much experience working in agriculture since her parents taught her when she was still little to work the land where she grows coffee and basic grains like corn, rice and beans.  Her customers are various buyers who come to the zone and also warehouses in the urban zone where her product is sold directly.

Today, she’s asking for a loan to buy supplies like manure, fertilizer, leaf fertilizer, etc. for crop maintenance because with this support she’ll be able to protect her coffee and vegetable crops and keep them safe from infestations, among others.

Her dream is to improve her crops more every day and to be able to increase the variety and quality of her crops since her children’s schooling and other daily needs that arise are her greatest priority for her family’s improvement.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies.

loans.name: Adil

texts.en:
Adil is a 48-year-old, honest and hardworking businessman. He has three kids and a housewife and they all live happily and peacefully in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Adil has been running a cloth shop for four years. He has limited stock to offer his customers. He has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan. He will buy a new variety of cloth to sell and this will increase his sales.

Adil wants a bright future for his children. With the help of this loan, he can expand his business, and his net income and savings will also be increased. After making more profit, he will pay the educational expenses of his children. Adil is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to expand the clothing shop business

loans.name: Massah

texts.en: 43 years old, Massah operates a table market selling goods such as pepper, bitter ball, okra, etc in the Paynesville South area of Liberia.  It is a suburb of the capital city of Monrovia and one of the most populated areas in Montserrado County.  The area boasts one of the best standards of living in the county with affordable rents, good roads, access to water and lots of transportation options. She is single with three children between 15 and 6 years old, all of whom are living at home with her and currently attending school. The last grade she finished before getting to business is fourth grade. For the past 10 years, she has been selling pepper, bitter ball, okra, etc in the local market. She started this business with money given to her by her mother and she enjoys her business because the business gives her more money.  She sells six days a week, from 7 am to 6 pm and most of the time, she uses a shared taxi to get her goods to her shop. She is requesting a loan to purchase more inventories for her business. She plans to build a house and educate her children.

loans.use: to purchase more vegetables to sell

loans.name: Rosa Idalia

texts.es:
Rosa tiene 21 años de edad, esta acompañada  y tiene dos hijos. Se dedica desde hace más de cinco años al comercio de frutas y verduras que ella y sus padres cultivan. Pero ahora ella esta vendiendo en el cafetín de la escuela pasteles, enchiladas, turrones, charamuscas, panes con pollo, refrescos y desea ampliar aún más la variedad de alimentos como elaborar pupusas. Algunas cosas que necesita para el negocio, su familia la cosecha; pero otras debe de irlas a comprar a un pueblo que esta a cuatro kilómetros de distancia y el transporte es bien escaso. 

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar mercadería para elaborar alimentos y mejorar la infraestructura del cafetín, debido a que cuando llueve se le mojan las cosas. Al comprar más mercadería evitara estar viajando tanto al pueblo ahorrándose tiempo y dinero.  Su deseo es enviar a sus hijos a la escuela y que terminen la universidad, ampliar su cafetín y convertirlo en una gran tienda de productos básicos para que los clientes no viajen tan lejos.
texts.en:
Rosa is 21 years old and has a partner and two children. She has been selling fruits and vegetables that she and her parents grow for more than five years. Now she is selling cakes, enchiladas, candies, popsicles, chicken sandwiches, and soft drinks at the snack stand of a school. She wants to increase the variety of products even more, offering products like "pupusas" (thick corn tortillas stuffed with beans, cheese or meat). Her family provides her with some things that she needs for her business, but others she needs to purchase from a village four kilometres away, and transport is hard to come by.

The loan she is asking for from Fundación Campo is to buy supplies to make different food items and improve the infrastructure of her stand, since things get wet when it rains. By buying more merchandise, she will avoid having to travel so often to the village and will thereby save time and money. Her desires are to send her children to school and that they finish university. She also hopes to expand her stand and grow it into a large store with basic products so that her customers don't have to travel so far.

loans.use: to buy supplies to make food items and improve the infrastructure of her snack stand, since things get wet when it rains.

loans.name: Luis Alberto

texts.es:
Luis es un hombre de 45 años, vive en la ciudad de Ica, en el distrito de Santiago con sus dos hijos, a quienes ama y son su principal razón en la vida, el es una persona muy amable, trabajador y entusiasta, que dedica todos sus esfuerzos por sacar adelante a su familia, ya que el siempre ha sido padre y madre para sus hijos; lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos y por la necesidad que tuvo de trabajar desde muy joven, Luis no pudo estudiar la carrera profesional de Administración de Empresas que deseaba, en sus ratos libres le gusta ver películas y en algunas ocasiones cocina unos riquísimos Chicharrones para compartir con su familia.
Por iniciativa propia, con mucho empeño y dedicación, Luis trabaja como vigilante en un fundo agrícola de su ciudad, Luis trabaja todos los días brindando servicios de seguridad y puede hacerlo por un aproximado de 10 horas, el se siente a gusto realizando su labor y cree que le va bien por su buen desempeño y por el trato amable que brinda a los demás.
Luis se encuentra muy agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá apoyar a su segundo hijo para que pueda pagar los gastos del trámite documentario para la obtención de su título profesional, de esta manera Luis podrá lograr su gran sueño de ver a sus hijos convertidos en buenos profesionales.
texts.en:
Luis is 45 years old, and lives in the city of Ica, in the district of Santiago with his two children, who he loves and who are his reason for living. He is a very friendly, hard-working and enthusiastic individual, who devotes all his efforts to moving forwards with his family, since he has always been both the father and mother of his children. 

Unfortunately, due to a lack of money and because of the need, he had to work from a young age. Luis was unable to study the degree course in Business Management he wanted to. In his free time he enjoys watching films and cooking delicious Chicharrones (pork crackling) to share with his family. 

On his own initiative, with much effort and determination, Luis works as a watchman on an agricultural estate in his city. Luis works for around 10 hours every day providing security services, and he enjoys his job and believes that it is going well thanks to his hard work and the kind manner in which he treats others.

Luis is very grateful to Kiva lenders, because thanks to the support provided by them he will be able to help his second child to pay the costs of paperwork to obtain his professional qualification. In this way, Luis will be able to achieve his big dream of seeing his children become successful professionals.

loans.use: to pay the costs of his child's degree paperwork.

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.es:
Juan es un hombre de 50 años, es soltero, vive en la ciudad de Camaná, el es una persona muy amable, trabajador y entusiasta, que dedica todos sus esfuerzos por salir adelante; lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos y por la necesidad que tuvo de trabajar desde muy joven para ayudar a sus padres, Juan no pudo estudiar la carrera profesional de Agronomía, en sus ratos libres le gusta jugar futbol con sus amigos y en algunas ocasiones cocina un riquísimo Chupe de Camarones para compartir con su familia.
Por iniciativa propia, con mucho empeño y dedicación, Juan se dedica a la agricultura, el cuenta con una pequeña parcela donde cultiva frejoles, el trabaja todos los días por un aproximado de 10 horas realizando laboreas de campo, Juan se siente a gusto realizando su labor y cree que le va bien por su experiencia y por el trato amable que brinda a los demás.
Juan se encuentra muy agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá cubrir los gastos de abono, riego y cosecha de su cultivo, de esta manera Juan podrá asegurar el crecimiento adecuado de su cultivo, así pues él seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de ampliar la variedad de su cultivo.
texts.en:
Juan, 50, is single living in the city of Camaná.  He’s a very kind, hardworking, enthusiastic person who focuses all his efforts into getting ahead.  Sadly, for lack of economic resources and because he needed to start working very young to help his parents, Juan was unable to study Agronomy.  In his free time he enjoys playing soccer with his friends and sometimes cooks a delicious shrimp stew to share with his family.

On his own initiative and with much effort and dedication, Juan works in agriculture.   He has a small parcel of land where he grows broad beans.  He works every day for about 10 hours working in the field. Juan feels good going his work and thinks he does well because of his experience and the kind way he treats others.

Juan is very grateful to Kiva lenders because thanks to the support they provided he will be able to cover costs of manure, irrigation and harvesting his crop and in this way Juan will be able to insure the proper growth of his crop and he will be able to continue working and striving to reach his great dream: to expand the variety of his crops.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies and pay irrigation costs.

loans.name: Nkanga 1 Tukoregye Group

texts.en:
Lydia is an upright Ugandan citizen, who is in her late 50s. She is married and has seven children, two of whom attend school. She has been selling retail commodities like soap and sugar, among others, to her community members in her retail shop, for a period of 18 years. She works from 8.00 am to 5.00 pm daily, and she is able to make a small monthly profit through the sale of her retail products.

With this loan, Lydia is hoping to increase her retail shop's stock and see herself progress. She says the main business challenge she is facing is the high cost to ferry merchandise from Rukungiri Town to Ndere-Ruhinda, approximately 38 KM away. She says the extra income generated as a result of this loan will enable her to improve the welfare of her family. In the future, Lydia plans to build her own business empire, where all the basic, necessary requirements can be found in one place -- hers. She uses her profits to pay school fees, and cover household expenses. Her dream is to one day be able to build and finish a house. She thanks UGAFODE Microfinance Limited (MDI) for the good service it renders to its esteemed clients.

loans.use: To buy retail stock, to resell at her shop

loans.name: Oswaldo

texts.es:
Oswaldo es un señor casado de 58 años quien tiene 8 hijos, 2 mujeres y 6 hombres quienes viven en Sololá.
El  se dedica a la elaboración de pan,  realiza está actividad  ya que su padre le enseño como elaborar diferentes panes para surtir su panadería  y así ofrecerles una  variedad de panes a  sus clientes.  A través de lo que vende obtiene ingresos y ganancias aceptables para poder mantener a su familia y así salir adelante.
El está solicitando un préstamo de Q 2,125.00 para capital de trabajo para ampliación de su negocio y de esta manera mejorar sus ingresos.
Sueña con tener un local grande en donde vive, para ofrecerles un mejor servicio a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Oswaldo is a married man aged 58, who has 8 children, 2 women and 6 men, who live in Sololá.
He works making bread, which he does because his father taught him how to make different types of bread to stock his bakery and offer a variety of bread to his customers. Through the bread he sells, he makes enough earnings and profits to support his family and, in this way, move forwards.
He is requesting the loan of Q 2,125.00 for working capital in order to expand his business, and in this way, boost his earnings.
He dreams of having a large bakery in his home, to offer a better service to his customers.

loans.use: obtain working capital to expand his business.

loans.name: Hasan

texts.en:
Hasan is a 24-year-old single man from the city of Rafah. He has worked as a taxi driver for three years, and this has been the only source of income for the family. 

Hasan would like to buy a new engine for his car to improve its capacity and enable him to work more hours using it. For this reason, Hasan took a  Murabaha loan from FATEN. This loan will help Hasan to cover the costs of buying a new engine. This will improve his car's condition and enable him to increase his income. 

Hasan appears in the photo beside his taxi.

loans.use: to buy a new engine for his taxi.

loans.name: Humaira's Group

texts.en:
Humaira is 27 years old. She lives in Lahore, Pakistan. She is a responsible mother of six children. Her husband is a milk seller. He purchases milk from the dairy farm and sells it in the market at a profitable price. 

Humaira as a member of 2 person lending group has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan to help her husband to cover the cost of purchasing milk and reselling it in the main market at a good price. This will help him to continue his business. Humaira is very thankful to Kiva.

Note: In the picture Humaira holds a passbook in her hand.

loans.use: To purchase milk to resell.

loans.name: Toir

texts.ru: Тоир живет в Хатлонской области в районе Шахритуз. Ему 40 лет. Он женат и имеет четверых детей. У него один сын и трое дочерей. Его жена занимается земледелием. Тоир целеустремленный и предприимчивый человек. Он хочет начать деятельность в сфере животноводства и заняться купле-продажей крупнорогатого скота. При дворе его дома имеется коровник. К тому же ему не нужно закупать корм для скота. Он будет давать скоту природную траву, которая растет у них на равнинах а для зимы он будет сушить и откладывать про запас скошенную траву. Тоир планирует закупать в месяц по трех голов крупнорогатого скота, откармливать в течение 30-35 дней и затем продавать с наценкой на скотном рынке своего района. Чтобы начать деятельность, он обратился за кредитом и ждет Вашу поддержку.
texts.en: Toir lives in Shahrituz district in the Hatlon region. He is 40 years old. married and has four children: one son and three daughters. His wife is a farmer. Toir is a goal-oriented and enterprising man. He wants to start a livestock business and sell cattle on the markets. He has a great cow barn on his property and he doesn't need to buy special feed for his animals. Instead, he will be feeding his cows pasture grass in summer and put up hey for them for the winter. Toir plans to buy three cows a month, feed them for 30-35 days then sell for a profit at the local livestock market. To start his business Toir has turned to us for a loan and hopes for your support.

loans.use: to purchase three calves for feeding and resale

loans.name: Iqbal

texts.en:
Iqbal is a milk seller by profession. He sells milk in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. He is the only earning person in the family. He wants to provide quality education to his children, and to do that he has to save a huge amount of money. But daily expenses are increasing every day and his income is insufficient even to sustain his family life. He is facing a load shedding problem in his area as well and because of that he can't preserve milk in the freezer. 

Presently he needs to purchase food for buffaloes. For that he has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan to purchase food for his buffaloes and for the maintenance of cartage. He hopes that the loan will be helpful for the growth of his business.

loans.use: to purchase food for his buffaloes and for the maintanance of cartage.

loans.name: Sonia Group

texts.en:
Sonia is a 27-year-old housewife. She lives with her husband and five children in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Since 2007, her husband has been running a general store, and he works very hard to meet their family's needs. He needs additional capital for the growth of his business, as his demand from clients is increasing day by day. Therefore his wife Sonia has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan for her husband's store. He will purchase a variety of products including flour, milk packs, eggs, pulses, detergents, oils, etc. to keep up with the increased demand of clients. Sonia and her husband are very hopeful that the loan will be a lucky and productive one for their family. The second woman in the photo is shabana and she wants loan for her husband's vegetable shop. Her husband would purchase fresh vegetables and renovate his shop. This would increase their net income and savings. 

NOTE: In the picture Sonia is raising her hand.

loans.use: To purchase a variety of goods for her general store.

loans.name: Ayesha

texts.en:
Ayesha is 36-year-old married woman. She lives in Lahore, Pakistan. She has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan for her beauty salon business. She recently started this business to help her husband in generating income as her husband's income is insufficient to meet the household expenses. 

With the help of the loan amount she will purchase a variety of cosmetic products for the beauty salon including make-up kits, eye shadow, lipsticks, and nail colours. She has excellent beautician skills. Her customers always appreciate her services. She hopes that the loan will be helpful for her business.

loans.use: To purchase cosmetic products for her beauty salon.

loans.name: Mughal

texts.en:
Mr. Mughal is a 45-year-old man who lives with his family in Lahore, Pakistan. Since 2005, Mughal has been running his own clothing business near his house, which is a very successful business for his family. He purchase pieces of clothes in various colours from different areas and sell them in the market.

He wants to purchase pieces of clothes to resell them at a profitable price but, due to financial constraints, he finds it difficult. Therefore, he has requested a loan from Kiva's partner, BRAC Pakistan. This will not only help him to grow his business, but will also increase his net income and savings. He is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to purchase clothes to sell

loans.name: Akbar

texts.ru: Акбар женат. Ему 21 год. Он с женой, родителями и двумя сестрами живет в центральном районе города Душанбе. Он молодой и целеустремленный человек. Акбар имеет среднее техническое образование. Он по профессии технолог. Жена Акбара портниха, она у себя на дому принимает заказы. Акбар запрашивает кредит для приобретения грузовой машины марки ЗИЛ. Он хочет заняться услугой перевозки грузов. У него имеется двухлетний опыт работы в этой области. Теперь Акбар хочет начать деятельность на собственной грузовой машине. В будущем Акбар планирует за счет дохода от деятельности купить еще одну грузовую машину марки КАМАЗ.
texts.en: Akbar is 21 years old, married and lives with his wife, his parents and two sisters in Dushanbe. He is a young and goal-oriented man. Akbar has a technical degree and Akbar's wife is a seamstress who works from home. Akbar is requesting a loan to purchase a ZIL truck because he wants to open a transportation business. He has two years experience driving large trucks. Now Akbar wants to venture out on his own and buy his own vehicle. In the future Akbar plans to use the profits from his business to purchase another large truck of the KAMAZ brand.

loans.use: to purchase a ZIL truck for goods transport

loans.name: Iman

texts.en:
Iman is a conservative woman, she asked her husband to take her place in the photo.
Iman is a 33-year-old mother of four children. Her husband is a government employee in the daytime and as a side job he mixes scents to make perfumes.

Iman is now applying for a loan to assist her husband in his side business to make an additional income beside his basic salary. She wants to get him more scents and new shapes of bottles.

loans.use: to buy more scents and new shapes of bottles for her husband's business.

loans.name: Victor

texts.es:
Víctor es un señor casado de 46 años quien tiene 8 hijos 5 mujeres y 3 hombres ellos actualmente viven en Sololá.
El se dedica a la agricultura lleva realizando esta actividad desde hace 25 años, ya que  su padre le enseño esta labor desde pequeño.  Es así como de esta manera obtiene ingresos aceptables para solventar los gastos familiares.
El esta solicitando un préstamo de Q 3,000.00 para capital de trabajo para cultivo de cebolla.
Su mayor sueño es construir dos cuartos,  esto lo pretende llevar a cabo  a través de sus ganancias que obtiene en lo que produce, esto lo hace con el fin de mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Víctor is a married man aged 46, who has 8 children, 5 women and 3 men. Today, they live in Sololá.
He has made a living in agriculture for the past 25 years, because his father taught him that profession from a young age. This is how he makes enough money to pay the household expenses.
He is requesting a loan of Q 3,000.00 for working capital to grow onions.
His biggest dream is to built two rooms. He hopes to achieve this through the profits he makes from his produce. He dreams of this in order to improve his families living conditions.

loans.use: obtain working capital to grow onions.

loans.name: Kolu

texts.en:
Kolu is 29 years old, and she operates a market table where she sells palm oil, in the Sinkor area of Liberia.  It is a suburb of the capital city of Monrovia, and one of the most populated areas in Montserrado County.  The area boasts one of the best standards of living in the country, with affordable rents, good roads, access to water and lots of transportation options.

Kolu is married and has four children, aged between 5 and 10. Her children are living at home with her and are currently attending school. Kolu, herself, stopped her education at fifth grade. For the past two years she has been selling palm oil in the local market. She started this business with money given to her by her husband. She enjoys her business, because the business gives her more money.  She sells six days a week, from 7:00 AM to 6:00 PM. Most of the time, she uses a shared taxi to get her goods to her shop. She is requesting a loan to purchase more palm oil, to resell at her business. Her future plans are to build a house and to educate her children.

loans.use: to purchase more palm oil, to resell at her market table

loans.name: Amelia

texts.en: Amelia is 38 years old and lives in the Paynesville South area of Liberia.  It is a suburb of the capital city of Monrovia and one of the most populated areas in Montserrado County. The area boasts one of the best standards of living in the county with affordable rents, good roads, access to water and lots of transportation options. She is single with four children between 9 and 6 years old, all of whom live at home and attend school. The last grade she finished before getting to business is fourth grade. For the past six years, she has been selling pepper, bitter ball, okra, etc in the local market. She started this business with money given to her by her mother and she enjoys her business because the business gives her more money. She sells six days a week, from 7 am to 5 pm and most of the time she uses a taxi to get her goods to her shop. She is requesting a loan to purchase more inventories for her business. She plans to build a house and educate her children.

loans.use: to purchase more vegetables to sell

loans.name: Las Colorinas Group

texts.es: El grupo “Las Colorinas” está conformado por mujeres muy trabajadoras y responsables que viven en la misma comunidad y se conocen desde hace mucho tiempo. El nombre del grupo lo eligieron ellas mismas porque en la comunidad donde viven hay árboles con el nombre de colorín y como solo son mujeres se nombraron "Las Colorinas". Doña Enedina quien es la representante del grupo platica que tiene 29 años de edad está casada desde hace 12 años con el señor Romualdo, juntos han formado una familia con 2 niños de los cuales uno ya se encuentra estudiando su educación primaria. Doña Enedina tiene una tienda de abarrotes desde hace 10 años cuenta que la inició porque fue idea de ella y su esposo inició vendiendo solo dulces en una mesita de madera pero poco a poco fue vendiendo productos de abarrotes. Ahora está solicitando un crédito a la institución para poder comprar más abarrotes como detergente, leche, huevo, azúcar, sal, semillas, productos enlatados, refrescos, y pan que es lo que normalmente se vende más en la comunidad. Por lo que comenta, Doña Enedina no ha tenido ninguna dificultad con su tienda de abarrotes aunque su sueño es hacerla crecer y volver a vender carnes frías y productos lácteos como yogurt y así obtener más ganancias y mejorar la calidad de vida de sus hijos para que les permita terminar una carrera profesional. Así Como Doña Enedina y el resto del grupo están muy contentos y agradecidos con la institución ya que gracias al crédito les permitirá invertir en sus actividades económicas. Como Doña Catalina, Juana, María Guadalupe, Julia, Olivia invertirán en la cría de borregos Gregoria, invertirá en la cría de cerdos.
