texts.en: The "Las Colorinas" ("the coral trees", in English) group is made up of hard-working and responsible women who live in the same community and who have known each other for a long time.  The group's members chose the name for the group themselves because there are coral trees growing in their local area.  Enedina represents the group and she tells us that she is 29 years old, has been married for a year - to a man named Romualdo -, and together with her husband they have a two children - one is already at primary school.  Enedina has had a grocery store for ten years.  The idea was Enedina's and it all started with her husband selling sweets from a wooden table but, little by little, they started selling groceries.  Now, Enedina is applying for a loan in order to buy more groceries such as detergent, milk, eggs, sugar, salt, seeds, tinned goods, drinks and bread, which is what usually sells most in the community.  According to Enedina, she has not had any difficulties with her grocery store but she says her dream is to expand the business and to begin selling cold meats and dairy products, such as yoghurts, again.  That way she will earn more and can improve her children's quality of life so that they can study to be professionals.  Enedina and, indeed, the whole group, are very happy and grateful to the institution as, thanks to the loan, they will be able to invest in their businesses.  Catalina, Juana, María Guadalupe, Julia and Olivia will invest in raising yearling sheep.  Gregoria will invest in raising pigs.

loans.use: to stock up their grocery store.

location.town: San Pedro El Alto, San Felipe del Progreso

loans.name: Flor De Maria

texts.es: Flor, es una humilde comerciante, originaria de Granada, madre soltera tiene 2 hijas que están estudiando la primaria. Ella es dueña de un pequeño kiosco donde vende café, sándwich, snacks y jugos. Este negocio lo empezó hace tres años cuando solo vendía café, pan y golosinas. Hoy en día con ayuda de su mama atiende venden café con leche, repostería, frescos, snacks y dulces, pero le gustaría ampliar más su kiosco vendiendo comida, jugos, gaseosas enlatadas, variedades de dulces y snacks. Hoy  está solicitando el crédito para comprar  platos, vasos, cubiertos desechables, azúcar, café, pan, repostería, galletas y dulces. Ya que son los productos que más vende a diario. Su meta principal por la que lucha cada día son sus hijas las cuales desea darle estudios que ella no puedo tener.
texts.en:
Flor is a humble merchant from Granada; she’s a single mother of two daughters who are attending primary school.  She owns a small kiosk where she sells coffee, sandwiches, snacks and juice.  The business started three years ago with just coffee, bread and snack sales.   Today, with her mother’s help, she sells coffee with milk, pastries, blended fruit drinks, snacks and candy but she’d like to expand her kiosk and sell food, juice, canned soft-drinks and a variety of candy and snacks.

She’s asking for a loan to buy plates, glasses, disposable cutlery, sugar, coffee, bread, pastry, cookies and candy since these are the products she sells the most every day.  Her main goal she strives for daily is her daughters for whom she wants to provide the schooling she wasn’t able to have herself.

loans.use: to buy plates, glasses, disposable cutlery, sugar, coffee, bread, pastries, cookies and candy.

loans.name: Idalia De Los Angeles

texts.es: Idalia, de 45 años de edad, de oficio comerciante se dedica a vender ropa interior, vive en la ciudad de Granada, madre de 4 hijos de los cuales solo el menor esta a cargo de ella. Antes se dedicaba a vender ropa de manera ambulante pero ahora tiene su pequeño puesto de ropa y cosmeticos. La temporada del dia de las madres esta cerca y por eso esta solicitando el financiamiento para comprar mercaderia tales como ropa interior para mujer, perfumes, cremas, cosmeticos. Con el financiamiento podra comprar mercaderia para vender y aprovechar la temporada de ventas altas y asi invertir mas en su negocio.
texts.en: Idalia, 45, is an underwear merchant living in the city of Granada.  She’s mother of four children but only the youngest is still in her care.  She used to sell clothes from place to place but now has a small clothes and cosmetics stand.  Mother’s Day season is near which is why she’s asking for a loan to buy merchandise like women’s underwear, perfume, creams and cosmetics.  With the financing she’ll be able to buy merchandise to sell and take advantage of high sales seasons thus investing more in her business.

loans.use: to buy women's underwear, creams and perfume.

loans.name: Abduhalil

texts.ru: Абдухалил трудолюбивый человек. Ему 27 лет. Он разведён и не имеет детей. Он более 7 лет занимается собственным бизнесом. Он опытный мясник. Абдухалил покупает скот, сам режет и продает на своей лавке. Абдухалил уже имеет большой опыт и профессионально выполняет свою работу. Местные жители довольны его работой и покупают мясо с его лавки. Он хочет развивать бизнес и поэтому запрашивает займ на сумму 7500 сомони для покупки скота. Абдухалил кредитуется первый цикл и обещает погасить займ во время. Он ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Abduhalil is a hardworking 27 year old man. He is divorced and has no children. For more then seven years Abduhalil had his own business. He is an experienced butcher who purchases his own cattle, slaughters them and sells meat in his store. He has a lot of experience and is a professional in his trade. Local residents like the quality of his work and purchase meat from his store. Abduhalil wants to develop his business and is requesting a loan of 7500 somoni to purchase cattle. This is his first time to apply for a loan and Abduhalil promises to repay it on time. He hopes for your kindness.

loans.use: To buy cattle for developing butcher business

loans.name: Kholniso

texts.ru: Холнисо молодая незамужняя девушка. Ей 26 лет. Она живет с родителями, младшими сестрами и братьями в районе Шахритус. Холнисо и ее родители занимаются земледелием. Холнисо очень трудолюбивая девушка. Сейчас она хочет начать новую деятельность и выбрала для этого сферу животноводства. Холнисо имеет место для разведения скота. Она обратилась за кредитом и планирует в месяц закупать по двух голов крупнорогатого скота, откармливать в течение месяца и продовать с наценкой на скотном рынке. Холнисо очень надеется на реализацию своих планов при Вашей поддержке.
texts.en: Kholniso is a young single woman. She is 26 years old and lives with her parents and younger siblings in the Shahrituz region. Kholniso and her parents are farmers. She is a very hard working woman and wants to expand into raising livestock as well. Kholniso has a good place to raise her cattle. She has turned to us for a loan which she will use to buy her first two cows. She plans to feed the animals for a month then sell them at the local livestock market for a profit. Kholniso really hopes to be able to make her dreams a reality because of your support.

loans.use: to purchase two cows and feed for them

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
This is 47-year-old Samuel. He is married, and has five children, ages 24, 21, 17, 13, and 10 years old. Samuel has one additional dependent, a relative who is going to school, who lives with him. 

In 2003, Samuel established his food business. He began his business because he wanted to develop his family. Working seven days a week and ten hours a day, he earns about 1,800,000 SLL every month from this business. 

He would like a loan in the amount of 4,000,000 SLL. Samuel requires the new loan in order to buy bags of groundnuts, pepper, and Maggi (a flavor enhancer) for his business. He hopes that this loan will enable him to increase his monthly profits by approximately 400,000 SLL.
Samuel still wishes to support his children’s schooling through the university level and build a big store. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy bags of pepper, Maggi, and groundnuts for his business.

loans.name: Mahdayub

texts.ru: Махдаюбу 44 года. Он женат и является отцом пятерых сыновей. Махдаюб со своей семьей живет в городе Куляб. У него среднее специальное образование. Он по профессии водитель. Махдаюб на протяжении 5 лет работал в этой области. Ему нравится эта деятельность и он снова хотел бы заниматься этим делом. У Махдаюб имеется часть денег на покупку автомобиля, а оставшуюся часть он хочет взять в кредит. С этим намерением он запрашивает кредит для приобретения автомашины и тем самым начать услугу предоставления маршрутного такси.
texts.en: Mahdayub is 44 years old. He is married and a father of five sons. Mahdayub lives with his family in Kulob and has a technical degree as a driver. He has been working as a taxi driver for five years. He likes his work and wants to continue. Mahdayub has saved enough money to partially finance the purchase of a taxi cab and he plans to borrow the rest. For this reason he is requesting a loan which he will use to purchase a taxi cab and be able to offer transportation services on a shuttle taxi route.

loans.use: to purchase a taxi cab

loans.name: Llajaira Rosa

texts.es:
Llajaira es una mujer de 25 años, es soltera, vive en la ciudad de Pisco con sus padres y hermanos, ella es una persona muy amable, trabajadora y entusiasta, que tiene un gran deseo de superación; lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos y por la necesidad que tuvo de trabajar desde muy joven, Llajaira no pudo estudiar la carrera profesional de Enfermería que deseaba, en sus ratos libres le gusta hacer deporte y en algunas ocasiones cocina un riquísimo Ají de Gallina para compartir con su familia.
Por iniciativa propia, con mucho empeño y dedicación, LLjaira trabaja en su pequeño negocio de venta de ropa, ella vende prendas de vestir tanto para damas, caballeros y niños, LLajaira trabaja todos los días por un aproximado de 12 horas y cree que le va bien por los buenos precios y por el trato amable que brinda a los demás.
LLajaira se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la compra de mayor cantidad y prendas de vestir, como polos, pantalones, chompas y otros, de esta manera LLajaira tendrá su negocio mejor abastecido y podrá atender a mas clientes, así pues ella seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de tener su propia casa.
texts.en:
Llajaira is 25 years old, single and lives in the city of Pisco with her parents and brothers.  She is very friendly, hard-working and enthusiastic and has a strong desire to move ahead in life.  Unfortunately, due to a lack of financial resources and due to the fact that she had to work from a very young age, Llajaira was unable to study nursing as she had wanted.  In her spare time she likes to play sports and sometimes she will prepare a tasty "ají de gallina" (a traditional, chicken-based, Peruvian dish) to share with her family.

Through her own initiative and with a lot of determination and dedication, Llajaira works with her business selling clothes.  She sells clothing items for men, women and children. Llajaira works every day for around twelve hours and she believes that everything is going well for her because of her good prices and because of the friendly service she gives to customers.

Llajaira is very grateful to Kiva lenders as, thanks to the help provided, she will be able to buy clothes, such as t-shirts, trousers, sweatshirts, in bulk.  With this, Llajaira will have her business better stocked and she will be able to tend to more customers.  She will continue to work and put in the effort in order to achieve her big dream of owning her own house.

loans.use: to buy merchandise.

loans.name: J. Mercy

texts.en:
J. Mercy, who is 42 years old, operates a market table, selling goods such as pepper, bitter ball and okra, in the Congo Town area of Liberia.  It is a suburb of the capital city of Monrovia, and one of the most populated areas in Montserrado County.  The area boasts one of the best standards of living in the county, with affordable rents, good roads, access to water, and lots of transportation options.

Mercy is married and has four children, aged between 8 and 24. Two of them are living at home with her and are currently attending school. The highest grade that Mercy finished, before getting into business, is grade 11. For the past seven years she has been selling pepper, bitter ball, okra, and other food items in the local market. She started this business with money given to her by her mother. She enjoys her business, because the business gives her more money. Mercy sells six days a week, from 7;00 AM to 6:00 PM. Most of the time, she uses a shared taxi to get her goods to her place of business. She is requesting a loan to purchase more items like pepper, bitter ball, and okra, to resell at her business. Her plans are to build a house and to educate her children.

loans.use: to purchase more items like pepper, bitter ball, and okra, to resell at her business

loans.name: Esteban

texts.es:
Esteban es  un joven soltero de 22 años quien actualmente vive con sus padres en Sololá.
El se dedica a la compraventa de  abarrotes  en su  comunidad donde tiene su tienda. Eligio esta actividad ya que es una fuente de ingresos aceptable y que atreves de ello contribuye a la economía familiar.
El ha observado que las ganancias que le genera su negocio  son buenas de manera que esta solicitando un préstamo de Q 8,000.00 para ampliar su negocio de abarrotes y así ofrecerles un mejor servicio a sus clientes.
Su sueño es tener un local grande, en donde pueda variar sus productos para su negocio, ya que por el momento su local es de lámina.
texts.en:
Esteban is 22 years old and single.  He is currently living with his parents in Sololá.

Esteban makes a living buying and selling on groceries in his community, where he has his store.  He chose this work as it is a suitable source of income and with it he can contribute to the family kitty.

Esteban has noticed that his business is earning him good money so he is applying for a loan of 8000 Quetzal in order to expand the business and offer better service to his customers.

He dreams of having big premises where he can stock a variety of products.  Esteban's current store is made of metal sheets.

loans.use: to expand his grocery store.

loans.name: Georgina's Group

texts.en:
Rebecca, Comfort, Pearl, Anitu, Adzo, Georgina, Margeret, Millicent, Lucy and Lydia are the members in this group. They sell rubber bowls, foodstuffs, detergent, maize, charcoal, cassava dough, soft drinks, ladies wear and plantain, respectively. They reside in the Teshie community. They have been together since January 2011. They are taking their second loan with KIVA.

Georgina is a 26-year-old corn and cassava dough seller who is married to Prosper, a 30-year-old. He works with an electricity company. They are blessed with two children, both of whom are in school. She has been with ID Ghana for the past two years and is the new leader of this group. 

She has been doing this business for four years now. She works from Mondays through Saturdays. Without ID Ghana’s training on savings, she would not have made it this far. 

This is her second loan and she needs GHS 700 to buy more maize to prepare corn and cassava dough to sell to her customers. 

The group needs a total of GHS 4,200 to buy more goods to sell to their customers in the community.

loans.use: To buy more maize to prepare corn and  cassava dough to sell

loans.name: Edith

texts.en: Edith is 35 years old and operates a table market selling goods such as plantain, cassava, sweet potatoes, etc. in the Paynesville South area of Liberia.  It is a suburb of the capital city of Monrovia and one of the most populated areas in Montserrado County. The area boasts one of the best standards of living in the county with affordable rents, good roads, access to water and lots of transportation options. She is married with three children between 15 and 9 years old, all of whom are living at home with her and are currently attending school. She does not read nor write. For the past 10 years, she has been selling plantain, cassava, sweet potatoes, etc. in the local market. She started this business with money given to her by her husband. She enjoys her business because the business gives her more money. She sells six days a week, from 7 am to 6 pm, and most of the time she uses a shared taxi to get her goods to her shop. She is requesting a loan to purchase more plantain, cassava, sweet potatoes etc for her business. Her plan is to build a house and educate her children.

loans.use: to purchase more plantain, cassava, sweet potatoes, etc. to sell

loans.name: Ludmila

texts.ru: Людмила торгует женской одеждой на рынке. Благодаря предыдущему кредиту она смогла увеличить оборот и заработать дополнительную прибыль.В этом году лето настало очень быстро и спрос на летнюю одежду резко увеличился. Людмила просит предоставить ей 10,000 гривен на закупку сезонной одежды - сарафанов, блуз и халатов. Она надеется увеличить продажи и соответственно прибыль.
texts.en: Ludmila sells women's clothes at the market. Thanks to a previous loan she was able to improve her goods turnover rate and earn additional profits. This year the summer came early and there is demand for summer clothes. Ludmila is requesting a loan of 10,000 griven to purchase seasonal clothes - sarafans, blouses and robes. She hopes for a sharp increase in sales and her profits.

loans.use: to purchase seasonal clothing

loans.name: Victor

texts.ru: Виктор имеет свой бизнес. Он продает сувениры, печатную продукции, а также канцтовары. Недавно у Виктора возникли финансовые сложности в связи с необходимостью оформить документы на свой киоск на рынке. Виктору пришлось вынять деньги из оборота и заплатить за оформление документов. Теперь, когда все позади, киоск официально принадлежит Виктору и его уже никто не сможет отобрать. Виктор просит предоставить ему кредит в размере 21,000 гривен на закупку большой партии сувениров. Закупая оптом Виктор получает скидки, что увеличивает его прибыль.
texts.en: Viktor has his own business. He sells souvenir, newspapers, magazines and office supplies. Recently he was faced with financial difficulties when he had to file paperwork for his market stall. Viktor had to take money out of his business to pay filing fees for the documents. Now that this is behind him, the market stall officially belongs to Viktor and no one will be able to take it away from him. Viktor is requesting a loan of 21,000 griven to purchase a big batch of souvenirs. By buying in bulk he will receive a discount which will help him increase his profits.

loans.use: to cheaply purchase souvenirs in bulk

loans.name: Kijapan Group

texts.en: Mary is a married woman with three children and two dependents. She is a resident of the Maganjo Kijapan zone. She is a first-time borrower in UGAFODE Microfinance LTD and has borrowed 500,000 UGX. She deals in buying and selling charcoal, a major item that is in demand by many of the low-income earners because it's affordable. The purpose of the loan is to buy more sacks of charcoal for her business. Her challenge is weather because during the rainy seasons, vehicles cannot go to villages to collect charcoal. This leads to delays. The high tax rate and high transport charges are some of her other challenges. However, she has been able to earn a living from her business and to look after her children. Her dream is to buy a plot of land for her children and build rentals for them, which will help her reduce her rent costs.

loans.use: To buy charcoal to sell

loans.name: Evan's Group

texts.en:
The seven members of Evan's Group are married, and the majority of them live in extended family systems. They average 33 years of age, and five of them have children, while the other two members have no child. They all live in Teshie, and they know each other through relatives and their income-generating activities in the market in Teshie, Accra. The members of the group have businesses sewing accessories, and selling diverse goods, including vegetables, ceramic and plastic bowls, provisions, cooked rice and beans, and second-hand clothing. With a view to increasing their capital, the group members decided to approach ID-Ghana for a loan.

Evans (the only male group member, standing on the right) is a clothing seller. He is planning to use his part of the loan to buy one bale of clothing from the market, which he will resell to customers.  With this loan he hopes to make an average monthly profit of GHS 100 and, as is the case for other members in the group, this profit will be used to reinvest in the business. 

The group members need a total amount of GHS 3,450 to be able to expand their businesses.

loans.use: to buy one bale of clothing from the market, and resell the clothes to customers.

loans.name: Annie

texts.en:
37-year-old Annie operates a cook shop (restaurant) selling rice and soup in the Sinkor area of Liberia.  It is a suburb of the capital city of Monrovia and one of the most populated areas in Montserrado County. The area boasts one of the best standards of living in the county with affordable rents, good roads, access to water and lots of transportation options. 
She is married and has five children, between ages 10 and 16. Three are currently attending school and two of them live at home. She completed 6th grade before starting her business. She describes herself as a good business woman.
Annie has had a cook shop business for the past 21 years. She works 12 hours a day, six days a week at her business. Her greatest challenge in business is that during the rainy season she hardly gets customers. She intends to use the loan to buy more rice, pepper, fish, charcoal, etc. She started her business with help from her husband who sells charcoal. She likes her business because it helps her buy some items for the home. In the future, she wants to own a house.  
She wants to thank the lenders for supporting BRAC Liberia and its borrowers.

loans.use: to buy more rice, pepper, fish, charcoal, etc.

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.es:
Juan Carlos es un señor casado de 29 años, actualmente tiene 2 hijos hombres quienes viven en Sololá.
El se dedica a la compraventa y reparación de celulares desde hace 8 años. Actualmente cuenta con un local en donde vive. Eligió esta actividad ya que le genera ingresos aceptables para cubrir los gastos de su familia.
El esta solicitando un préstamo de Q 7,000.00 para capital de trabajo para compraventa de celulares y repuestos.
Sueña con mejorar su local e incrementar su mercancía para estar a la vanguardia de la tecnología y así ofrecerles un mejor servicio a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Juan Carlos is a 29-year old married man.  He currently has 2 sons who live in Sololá.  He has made his living buying and selling cell phones and repairing them for 8 years.  He currently has a store where he lives.

He chose this activity because it generates sufficient income to cover his family's expenses.  He is applying for a loan of Q 7,000.00 for working capital for the purchase and sale of cell phones and replacement parts.

He dreams about improving his store and increasing his merchandise to be at the vanguard of technology and thus offer his customers better service.

loans.use: to buy and sell cell phones and replacement parts.

loans.name: Isatu

texts.en:
This is 36-year-old Isatu. She is married and has two children who are 14 and 10 years old. In 2006, Isatu established her groundnut and beans business. She began her business because she wants to actualize her dream of independence and that is her only source of income. 

Working 7 days a week and 11 hours a day, she earns about Le 1,000,000 SLL every month from this business. She would like a loan of 4,000,000 SLL. Isatu has already received and successfully repaid two loans, and now require a new loan in order to buy groundnuts and beans. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately 300,000 SLL. 

Isatu used the proceeds from her last loan to provide a livelihood for her family and pay school fees for her children.  Isatu was unable to start building a house because she was not able to make enough profit to do so.  However, Isatu still wishes to support her children’s education to university level and to build a dwelling house for her family.  She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy groundnuts and beans

loans.name: Wilmer Domingo

texts.es:
Wilmer es un hombre de 58 años, vive en la ciudad de Chincha con su esposa y su joven hijo, a quienes ama y son su principal razón en la vida, el es una persona muy amable, trabajador y entusiasta, que junto con su esposa dedican todos sus esfuerzos por sacar adelante a su familia; lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos y por la necesidad que tuvo de trabajar desde muy joven para ayudar a sus padres, Wilmer no pudo estudiar la carrera profesional de Ingeniería Mecánica que deseaba, en sus ratos libres le gusta leer periódicos y en algunas ocasiones cocina una riquísima Carapulcra con Sopa Seca para compartir con su familia.
Por iniciativa propia, con mucho empeño y dedicación, Wilmer trabaja como chofer de taxi, brindando servicios de transporte en su ciudad, el trabaja todos los días por un aproximado de 12 horas y cree que le va bien porque conoce las zonas donde encontrar mayor cantidad de pasajeros.
Wilmer se encuentra muy agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar el mejoramiento de su vivienda, ya que desea tarrajear las paredes y ponerle piso de concreto a su hogar, de esta manera Wilmer podrá brindar mayor seguridad y bienestar para su familia, así pues él seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de ver a su convertido en un buen profesional.
texts.en:
Wilmer is 58 years old and lives in the city of Chincha with his wife and young son, who he loves and who are his main reasons for life.  He is a friendly, hardworking, and enthusiastic person who dedicates all of his efforts to getting his family ahead.  Unfortunately he had to go to work at an early age to help his parents, due to lack of financial resources and he was not able to study for the professional mechanical engineering career he desired.  He likes to read newspapers in his spare time and at times cooks a delicious carapulca with dried soup to share with his family.

On his own initiative and with great dedication and effort, Wilber works as a taxi driver, providing transportation  services in the city.  He works for about 12 hours every day and believes that things are going well for him because he knows where to find large numbers of passengers.

Wilmer is very grateful with the Kiva lenders because thanks to their help he will be able to make improvements to his house.  He wants to finish the walls and add a concrete floor.  In this way Wilmer will be able to provide more security and wellbeing to his family.  He will continue working and making an effort to achieve his greatest dream of seeing his son begin a professional career.

loans.use: to make home improvements.

loans.name: Mujeres Unidas Al Progreso Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Mujeres Unidas al progreso  está en su Vigésimo primer ciclo  del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas se comprometieron a trabajar y a ayudarse entre todas para salir adelante. Están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, donde 2 de las 19 señoras se encuentran por debajo de la línea de pobreza, es decir con ingresos muy bajos, pero pese a ello están trabajando por mejorar sus vidas.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra.  Marta, quien en su  encuesta mostró un nivel de pobreza dentro del nivel uno, es decir con ingresos muy bajos, pero ella es consciente que a través del esfuerzo y el trabajo continuo podrá mejorar  su situación de pobreza. Ella se dedica a la venta de ropas y por medio de este trabajo es que quiere ayudar a su familia y darles lo que necesitan.
Ella solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de prendas de invierno, ya que se acerca el frio y quiere seguir trabajando para su familia y también para ir mejorando su microemprendimiento.
texts.en:
The group called Mujeres Unidas Al Progreso [Women United for Progress] is in its twenty-first term of the women's committee program, where they all committed to work and help each other in order to get ahead.

They are doing the poverty elimination survey, where 2 of the 19 women are below the poverty line. That is, they have very low income.  But in spite of this, they are working to improve their lives.

One of the members is Marta, who in her survey showed a poverty level within level one -- that is, with very low income.  But she is aware that through effort and continuous work, she will be able to improve her poverty situation.

She makes her living selling clothes, and it is through this work that she wants to help her family and give them what they need.  She is applying for this loan in order to invest it in the purchase of winter clothing, since the cold season is approaching.  She wants to continue working for her family and also to continue improving her micro-enterprise.

loans.use: to buy winter outfits to sell.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary lives in Montserrado County, the capital city of Liberia, which is well known as the commercial city of Liberia. She is 44 years old and married with nine children between 17 and 25 years old. Only five of her children are in school and live at home. For the past 10 years, she has been selling used clothes in the community market. She started this business with help from her mother and learned this way of selling from her. She likes her business because it gives her more profit. She is requesting a loan to buy more used clothes for her business. She wishes to get money to educate all of her children and own a house.

loans.use: to buy more used clothes to sell

loans.name: Mamie

texts.en:
Mamie is 39 years old and lives in the Congo Town, Liberia.  It is a suburb of the capital city of Monrovia and one of the most populated areas in Montserrado County.  The area boasts one of the best standards of living in the county with affordable rents, good roads, access to water and lots of transportation options. Mamie is married with three children aged between 7 and 20; only one lives at home and is currently attending school. The last grade she finished before getting into business is 1st grade. 

For the past six years Mamie has been selling fresh fish in the local market. She started this business with money given to her by her mother. She enjoys her business because the business gives her more money.  She sells six days a week, from 7am to 5pm, and most of the time she uses a taxi to get her goods to her shop. She is requesting a loan to purchase more fresh fish for her business, Her plans are to build a house and educate her children.

loans.use: to purchase more fresh fish for her business

loans.name: Amigos Del Comercio Group

texts.es:
La señora Catarina Elizabeth es de estado civil unida de hecho tiene 43 años de edad, curso los 6 años de educación primaria, tiene 4 hijos y 2 de ellos estan estudiando, ella se dedica al comercio, inició ese negocio vendiendo con su madre y en la actualidad lleva 10 años de experiencia.

Decide organizar un grupo para poder soliticar un préstamo que le servirá para ampliar su capital de trabajo comprando mercadería como: ropa de niños y niñas, en el futuro desea ver su negocio prospero con mas capital de trabajo; las demás integrantes del grupo se dedican al comercio.
texts.en:
Catarina Elizabeth is 43 years old, married, and has a sixth grade education.  She has four children and two of them attend school.  She is a merchant and began this business selling with her mother.  She has 10 years' experience.

She decided to become part of this group so that she can request a loan that will help her buy merchandise such as children's clothing.  In the future she wants to see her business prosper with more working capital.  The other members of the group are merchants.

loans.use: to buy merchandise.

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
This is 43-year-old Rebecca from Liberia. She resides in Congo Town, a suburb just outside Monrovia.  The area is one of the most populated areas in Montserrado County with one of the best standards of living in the country:  good roads, access to clean water, affordable rents and plentiful transportation options. 

Rebecca is single with two children aged 13 and 8. Her children are currently attending school and are living with her at home. She runs a shop selling charcoal.  She describes herself as a serious businesswoman. She started her business six years ago, using money given to her by her fiancee.  Typically, she works 7am to 4pm from Monday to Saturday at her business and transports her goods to her business by bus.  She cites her greatest challenge as small income.  She is proud of her business because it allows her to support her children.

Using the proceeds of this loan, she intends to purchase more charcoal.  In the future, she plans to build her house and educate her children.  She sincerely thanks you in advance for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more charcoal.

loans.name: Theresa

texts.en:
Theresa is 39 years old and lives in Montserrado County that is has the largest free-port and is the number one commercial county in Liberia. She is married with seven children between 14 and 25; unfortunately she did not go to school, but she manages her business well. 

For the past ten years she has been selling palm oil in the local market. She  started this business with money given to her by her husband who is a carpenter. She enjoys her business because the business gives her more money.  She sells six days a week, from 7am to 5pm, and most of the time she uses a bus to get her goods to her table. She is requesting a loan to purchase more palm oil for her business. Her plans are to build a house and own a shop.

loans.use: to purchase more palm oil for her business

loans.name: Con Dios Adelante 3,  4 & 5 Group

texts.en:
Ines is a members of the Con Dios Adelante (God Bless) 3, 4 & 5 group, which has 15 micro-businesswomen. They are involved in sales of clothing, shoes, natural products, food, etc. Ines lives in the city of La Romana. Its economy depends on tourism and the sugarcane industry. The city has a sizable population of Dominicans and Haitian immigrants who live in communities with very limited resources.

Ines is very excited to receive her fourth loan from Esperanza International, having satisfactorily repaid her previous loan and taken an important step in her business's growth. She has had her business for about six years. She started it with her own capital, after she saved money by doing different jobs. She is running a shoes sales business, and she is planning on investing the new loan in buying many dozens of tennis shoes, sandals, sneakers and casual shoes for women, kids and men. She sells the shoes by walking around, from her house, and from a place in a flea market once a week.

Ines’s family is made up of herself and her two children. She tells us that her greatest challenge is to have her own house. She really enjoys working and taking care of her children. She will use her profits to invest in her business and to start saving, this time to make possible one of her dreams, to have her own house.

loans.use: to buy dozens of shoes to sell

loans.name: Nueva Esperanza Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Nueva Esperanza  está en su primer ciclo 20º del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas trabajan y se ayudan por salir adelante. Están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza para conocer la situación de cada una de ellas.
Francisca, una de las miembros, se dedica a las ventas, ya que tiene una despensa en su casa. Es por medio de este negocio que ella trabaja y ayuda a su familia dándoles lo que necesitan y que no pasen por privaciones.
Francisca solicita este crédito para invertirlo en la compra de verduras, fideos, arroz, yerba, azúcar y demás insumos de primera necesidad, ya que quiere seguir dando a sus clientes los productos que necesitan. Agradece por esta oportunidad que está recibiendo, ya que no solo ella se ve beneficiada, sino también toda su familia.
texts.en:
The group called Nueva Esperanza [New Hope] is in its 21st loan cycle of the Women's Committee program, where they all work and help each other to get ahead.  They are doing the poverty elimination survey to get to know each member's situation.

Francisca, one of the members, makes her living in sales and has a small store in her house.  It is through this business that she works and helps her family, giving them what they need and so that they don't want for anything.  

Francisca is applying for this loan in order to invest it in the purchase of vegetables, noodles, rice, tea, sugar and other basic needs, because she wants to continue giving her customers the products they need.  She is grateful for this opportunity she is receiving, since it is not only her that benefits, but also her whole family.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, noodles, rice, tea, sugar, and more.

loans.name: Jovenes Emprendedores Group

texts.es:
El grupo denominado Jovenes Emprendedores está en su ciclo número 5 del programa de comité de jóvenes. Son 4 jóvenes que se unieron para poder trabajar juntos, generar un poco de ingresos para poder ayudar a su familia, y así sentirse útiles.
Karina es una de las integrantes, ella es presidenta la presidenta del grupo se dedica a la venta de comidas conjuntamente con su mama, y también estudia. Por medio de su esfuerzo por salir adelante ella logró mejorar su calidad de vida.  Ella tiene con su ingreso de su venta ambulante , solventa su gasto y su estudio  , recibe asistencia  permanente , asiste a reuniones de su comité, trabaja solidariamente con sus compañeros y mantiene  buen  pago con su grupo. Tienen la esperanza de ser el día de mañana grandes profesionales.
Karina solicita este crédito  para aumentar su venta, ya que necesita carne, verduras, harina, huevo y demás, con lo que podrá seguir haciendo sus comidas y vendiendo.
texts.en:
The group known as "Jovenes Emprendedores" (Enterprising Youth) are in their fifth loan cycle in the youth group program. They are four young people who came together so that they could work jointly, and generate a bit of of income to be able to help their families and feel useful. 

Karina is one of the members and is the chair of the group. She sells food with her mom and also goes to school. Through her effort to succeed, she has managed to improve her quality of life. With her income from her street vending, she has paid for her expenses and her studies. 

She receives on-going assistance, attends the group meetings, works supportively with her co-members, and maintains a good payment record with her group. They have the hope of someday being successful professionals. 

Karen is requesting this loan to increase her sales, as she needs meat, vegetables, flour, eggs and other items to enable her to keep making and selling her meals.

loans.use: To buy meat, vegetables, flour, eggs and other items.

loans.name: Marie

texts.en:
Marie is 40 years old, and lives in Montserrado County that has the largest free-port and is the number one commercial county in Liberia. She is a single woman with four children aged between 7 and 25; only two live at home and attend school.

Marie did not go to school. For the past 20 years she has been selling used clothes in the local market. She started this business with money given to her by her mother. She enjoys her business because the business gives her more money.  She sells six days a week, from 7am to 5pm, and most of the time she uses  taxi to get her goods to her shop. She is requesting a loan to purchase more used clothes for her business. Her plans are to build a house and educate her children.

loans.use: to purchase more used clothes for her business

loans.name: Bahaaeddeen

texts.en:
BahaaEddeen, who appears in the photo, is a 27-year-old engaged young man. He is employed and receives a low salary, which is not enough to cover all his needs.
BahaaEddeen has a small old house and wants to improve its condition to live in it after getting married this summer. Thus, he has taken a USD Youth Loan from FATEN to help him cover the cost of purchasing and installing new tiles in his house. Taking this loan will create for BahaaEddeen and his future wife a suitable home condition, enabling them to enjoy living in their house.

loans.use: to purchase and install tiles in his house.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy chicken mash and feed for her broilers and layers

loans.name: Con Dios Adelante 1 & 2 Group

texts.en:
Xiomara is the coordinator of Con Dios Adelante (Forward with God) 1 & 2. This group is made up of ten micro-entrepreneur women. The group is based in the city of La Romana, a rural area of the country dedicated to the harvest of sugarcane, in a batey (company town) founded for sugarcane workers, especially for Haitians. Xiomara lives with her long-term partner and her three children. She says that her most important challenges are to continue improving her business and to provide change for her family.

After her previous loans, her business is expanding and gaining more clients. Xiomara enjoys working and cooking for her family. She is running a sales business where she sells miscellaneous items such as cosmetics, shoes and clothes. She will use her loan to purchase many items to increase her business inventory. She is excited to receive her eighth loan with Esperanza. She has been part of this group for almost five years, and with each loan she has been able to improve her business. With her business profits, she saves and reinvests in her business when she needs to buy bigger orders. Xiomara thanks all of you for your support of her business and her group.

loans.use: to buy products such as cosmetics, shoes and clothes

loans.name: Maa Mangala Group

texts.en:
In the Balangir district of Odisha, India, Baijayanti Pada is one of the slum areas of Balangir Municipality which hails from Ward No.12. There is a special identity of this slum area which is that it is inhabited by the Mahar community (Weavers of Bamboo). Most of the inhabitants of this community are very poor and far away from the basic necessities of life like shelter and education. They reside in small huts and their children get rarely get good education. 

The main business of this community is making hand fans of bamboo and selling them in the market, railway station and bus stop and in nearby villages.The income they get from their business is spent hand to mouth for them. To overcome this situation, in the year 2010 six women of this community formed a Joint Liability Group named Maa Mangala with the objective of accessing a loan from Mahashakti Foundation for the overall development of their family, to improve their existing businesses. Archana, aged about 35, is the featured member, sitting on the extreme left with raised hand. She is married and resides in a small hut with her four-member family, comprised of her husband and two daughters aged 8 & 4.  

The business of Archana (making of bamboo hand fans) is a traditional business of their community. Archana and her husband jointly do the processing work and make hand fans. To procure raw materials, they have to go 100 kilometer away by train and bring back the raw bamboo. Both the wife and husband sell their products in the town market, railway station & bus station. They also supply their products to traders. 

Archana earns a monthly income of Rs.3000 from her business. This small income never meets the minimum needs of the family. So Archana wants to raise her production for more income. From the present loan she is planning to purchase more raw bamboo to last for a long time without any interruptions. She hopes this will help her to increase her income. Archana dreams of revamping her existing hut and constructing a house for her family.

The other five members of the group are Pakani, Nandi, Santi, Dali and Radhika who also do the same business.

loans.use: To pay for purchasing bamboo and coloring.

loans.name: Hayel

texts.en: Hayel, who appears in the photo, is a Palestinian single young man. He lives with his family in a small agricultural village. He works in agriculture with the rest of his family members. Hayel wants to contribute to the purchase of seedlings and a water tank to irrigate crops. He is requesting a 1,000 USD loan from FATEN to provide a share of the family's costs of purchasing the seedlings and a water tank to irrigate crops. It will allow Hayel and his family to produce a better crop and, thus, to increase their sales and to improve their income.

loans.use: to purchase seedlings and a water tank to irrigate crops.

loans.name: Maa Samlei Group

texts.en:
In the Balangir district of Odisha, India, Baijayanti Pada is one of the slum areas of Balangir Municipality which hails from Ward No.12. A special identity of this slum area is that it is inhabited by the Mahar community (Weavers of Bamboo). Most of the inhabitants of this community are very poor and far away from the basic necessities of life like shelter and education. They reside in small huts and their children rarely get good education. 

The main business of this community is making hand fans out of bamboo and selling them in the market, railway station and bus stations and nearby villages. The income they get from this is used hand-to-mouth for them. To overcome this  situation, in the year 2010 six women of this community formed a Joint Liability Group named Maa Samlei with the positive intention of accessing a loan from Mahashakti Foundation for the all round development of their family, to improve the existing situation. 

Lata, a vocal and active lady aged about 36 is the leader and also the featured member. She is sitting on the extreme right in the photograph with raised hand. She is married and lives with her husband, one daughter of 13, a son of 11, and 9-year-old twins.  

Lata is operating a traditional business of bamboo hand fan making and marketing. Lata and her husband jointly do the processing work and make hand fans. They procure the raw bamboo from a distance of 100 kms. Her husband goes by train to bring back the material. Both the wife and husband sell the finished products in the town market, railway & bus station. Apart from the making of hand fans, Lata also procures finished products from the neighbors and sells them in bulk to traders from other places. 

Lata earns a monthly income of 5000 INR from this business. According to Lata, this small income is not at all sufficient to meet the requirements of her family. So she wants to raise her production for more income. From the present loan she is planning to purchase more raw bamboo to last for a longer period and also purchase finished products to supply. Lata hopes to construct a house and provide better education to her children and lead a prestigious life.

The other five members of the group are Suchi, Kalyani, Surya, Gouri and Ritu who also operate the same business of hand fan making and selling.

loans.use: To pay for purchasing  bamboo, coloring and finished products.

loans.name: Maa Tarini Group

texts.en:
In the Balangir district of Odisha, India, Baijayanti Pada is one of the slum areas of Balangir Municipality which hails from Ward No.12. There is a special identity of this slum area is that it is inhabited by Mahar community (Weavers of Bamboo craft). Most of the inhabitants of this community are very poor and far away from the basic necessities of life like shelter and education. They reside in small huts and their children rarely get a good education. 

The main business of this community is making hand fans of bamboo and selling them in the market, railway station and bus stand and nearby villages. The income they get from this is hand-to-mouth for them. To overcome this  situation, In the year 2010 six women of this community formed a Joint Liability Group named Maa Tarini  accessing a loan from Mahashakti Foundation for the overall development of their family to improve their existing status. 

Guri, aged about 49, is one of these women, sitting on the extreme left with raised hand in the photograph. She is married and resides with her husband, one son of 26 years, and three daughters of 20, 18 and 10 years. Her second and third daughters are studying in +3 degree and 10th standard respectively. 

Guri is running her traditional business of bamboo crafts (making of bamboo hand fan).All Guri's family members jointly do the processing work and make hand fans. For the raw materials, her husband has to go 100 kilometers away by train and bring back the raw bamboo. Guri also procures ready-made products from the neighbors. Every week traders from 80 kilometers away come to Guri to take away the finished products.  

Guri earns a monthly income of Rs.5000 from her business. With this small income she can barely manage both the family needs and educational expenses of her daughters. On the other hand, her son and elder daughter have also grown up to marriageable age. So Gouri wants to increase the income of her family to  meet those expenses. From Guri's present loan a portion will be used for purchasing more raw bamboo and colour for making more hand fan and another portion will be used for procuring finished products. Guri believes that this will help her to increase her income level to some extent. Guri dreams of arranging the marriages of  her son and daughter in the near future.

The other five members of the group are Droupadi, Padmini, Santosini, Barsarani and Babby who also do the same business.

loans.use: To pay for purchasing bamboo, coloring and finished products.

loans.name: Mujeres Unidas Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Mujeres Unidas está en su primer ciclo del programa de comité, ellas están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza para saber la situación de cada una de ellas, y lo cual mostró que todas están con 
Rafaela, también hizo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza y está en un nivel medio, con ingresos muy básicos.
A través del esfuerzo y el trabajo continuo, capacitación e incentivo que le da la fundación ella se encuentra mejorando su situación de pobreza. Rafaela tiene una despensa pequeña en su casa y solicita de este crédito para la compra de insumos para su negocio, como ser frutas, verduras, carnes, panificados y demás, para vender  lo que le ayudará a tener a concretar su plan de negocio, el cual le ayudará a mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
The Mujeres Unidas group is in its first loan cycle for its committee. The group is taking a poll to eliminate poverty and to understand everyone's current situation and to show what everyone has at the moment. Rafaela took the poll and ranked in the middle level, with a very basic income.

Due to her efforts, her work continues. Training and incentives given by the foundation help her improve her situation of living in poverty. Rafaela has a small shop in her home. She is requesting this loan to buy products for her business such as fruits, vegetables, meat, baked goods, and more. She will then sell these, which will help her to have a concrete business plan. This will allow her to improve her profits.

loans.use: to buy fruits, vegetables, meat, baked goods, and more.

loans.name: Delfina

texts.en: Delfina is taking a loan of 1,000 USD to improve her business. She is married, and she is 34 years old. Her husband is a farmer. Delfina runs a kiosk that helps her to generate income for her family. She will use the loan to buy stocks to keep in her store such as Coca-Cola, Fanta, Sprite, Sagiko, cigarettes, coffee, sugar, breads, oil, and eggs. She opened her kiosk a year ago with her own working capital of 200 USD. Delfina is a hard working woman, and she hopes to run a bigger business in the future.

loans.use: To buy Coca-Cola, Fanta, Sprite, Sagiko, cigarettes, coffee, sugar, breads, oil, and eggs.

loans.name: Mirabai Group

texts.en:
Baijayanti Pada is one of the slum areas of Ward No.12. of Balangir municipality in Odisha, India. The special identity of this slum area is that it is inhabited by the Mahar community (Weavers of Bamboo).The inhabitants of this community are very poor and far away from the basic necessities of life like shelter and education. They reside in small huts and their children can rarely get a good education. 

The main business of this community is making hand fans of bamboo and selling them in the market, railway station and bus stand and nearby villages. The income they get from this is hand-to-mouth for them. To overcome this  situation, in the year 2010 six women of this community formed a Joint Liability Group named Mirabai to access a loan from Mahashakti Foundation to add some extra income for their family so as to improve their existing status. Bisaya, aged about 41, is one of them. The lady sitting second from right with raised hand in the photograph is Bisaya. She lives with her husband, one son of 25 years and two daughters of 20 and 18 in a small house. 

Bisaya is doing her traditional business of bamboo crafts (making bamboo hand fans).All Bisaya's family members do the processing work and make hand fans. Bisaya procures the raw materials from a distant place, 100 kilometer away. Bisaya sells the finished products in the town, railway station and bus stand. She earns a monthly income of 5000 INR from her business. This small income is barely enough for Bisaya to manage her family expenses. So to meet the expenses smoothly, Bisaya wants to increase the income of her family. From the present loan she is planning to purchase raw bamboo and coloring for making more hand fans. She believes that this will help her to increase her income level to some extent. Bisaya dreams of repairing her house and constructing another room for her family.

The other five members of the group are Gulapi (running a rice business along with tailoring) and Labani, Rabi, Gita and Sonia doing the same business of bamboo hand fan weaving.

loans.use: To pay for purchasing bamboo and coloring

loans.name: Natividad De Maria Group

texts.es:
Natividad de Maria está en su ciclo número 1º del programa de comité de mujeres están aprendiendo a trabajar juntas y tienen como meta crecer y ayudar a sus familias por medio del trabajo en conjunto.
Flora, una de las miembros, se dedica a la venta ambulante de frutas, ella es una persona muy trabajadora, que vio como una gran oportunidad la de formar parte de este grupo, ya que podrá mejorar su economía y también recibir capacitaciones para poder crecer como persona.
La Sra. Solicita de este crédito para la compra de frutas para su negocio que son manzanas, bananas, peras, naranjas, etc, lo que le ayudará a tener a concretar su plan de negocio, el cual le ayudará a mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
The communal bank "Natividad de Maria" is in its first loan cycle in the Program for Women's Committees.  They are learning to work together, and they have a goal to grow and to help their families through their joint work.

One of the members is Flora, who has a business selling fruit in an itinerant manner.  She is a very hardworking person who saw a great opportunity in becoming a member of this group, because she will be able to improve her finances and also receive training so that she can grow as a person.

Flora is requesting this loan to buy fruit for her business, including: apples, bananas, pears, oranges, etc.  This will help her to carry out her plan for her business, which will help her to increase her income.

loans.use: to buy apples, bananas, pears, oranges, etc.

loans.name: Suhaieb

texts.en:
Suhaieb, who appears in the photo, is a 26-year-old man who is engaged to be married. He is employed in a foodstuffs company and earns a small salary, which is not enough to cover all his costs.

Suhaieb is preparing his house to get married this summer so he is requesting a 2,000 USD youth loan from FATEN to help him cover the cost of purchasing necessary construction supplies, such as cement, bricks and tiles. This will enable Suhaieb to complete his house in less time and to prepare a suitable home for his coming life with his new wife.

loans.use: To purchase cement, bricks and tiles

loans.name: Joana

texts.en:
Joana is applying for a loan of $1,000 to improve her business. She is 25 years old and married. Her husband is a driver.

She is running a business in her house by selling hard drinks (beer), soft drinks (sagiko, fanta, sprite), eggs, milk, salt, cigarettes, water and bread. She opened her kiosk in 2005 with working capital of $100. She is making a good income from this selling and she wants to buy more stock with the loan. 

Joana is living in a town near the main road, so many people come to buy and she is selling every day. She is happy with this program that helps her to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: To buy hard drinks (beer), soft drinks (fanta, sagiko, sprite), eggs, milk, salt, cigarettes, water and bread.

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en: Cecilia has been offered a $1,000 loan to improve her business. She opened her kiosk in 2010 with her own working capital. She will use the loan to buy stock to keep in her store like rice, noodles, milk, water, eggs, books and salt. Cecilia is generating a good income from selling. She has been thinking of running a big business after years of involving herself in doing this business. She lives in a town with her family.

loans.use: To buy rice, noodles, milk, water, eggs, books and salt.

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en: Lucia is married. She has a kiosk to generate income for her family. She has been thinking how to run a big business, but she does not have enough working capital. She felt better when she applied for her first loan, with which she will buy some additional supplies to keep in her store, such as soft drinks, hard drinks, body lotions and biscuits. She is happy with TRM (Tuba Rai Metin) that offers loans to poor people.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, hard drinks, body lotions and biscuits.

loans.name: Filomena

texts.en: $1,000 has been offered to Filomena to improve her business. She has a kiosk where many people come to buy every day. She will buy some additional supplies such as biscuits, noodles, sugar and coffee. She has been involving herself in business activities since 2009. She feels so comfortable running  her business because she can earn money every day.

loans.use: to buy biscuits, noodles, sugar and coffee.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria is taking a loan of $1000 to improve her business. She is married and she is 29 years old. She is running a kiosk that helps her to generate income for her family. She will use the loan to buy stock to keep in her store such as water, oil, milk, salt, books, cigarettes, soap, rice, fish, slippers and pencils. She opened her kiosk in 2002 with her own working capital of $50. 

Maria is a hardworking woman and she hopes to run a bigger business in the future. She is happy with TRM (Tuba Rai Metin) that offers loans for poor people.

loans.use: To buy water, oil, milk, salt, books, cigarettes, soap, rice, fish, slippers and pencils.

loans.name: Kuña Aty Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Kuña aty está en su ciclo número 8 del programa de comité de mujeres. Están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, donde todas ellas a través del esfuerzo y el trabajo continuo y las aplicaciones de los comportamientos vitales de una mujer exitosa se encuentra mejorando su situación de pobreza.
Liz, la presidenta cuenta que su grupo esta luchando por salir adelante, mejorar la vida de cada una de ellas y dar a sus familias lo que ellas no pudieron tener. Ellas asisten a capacitaciones que las ayuda a crecer e ir mejorando. Liz se dedica a la venta de verduras, y con ello tiene los ingresos con los que mantiene la casa y los gastos del día a día.
Solicita de este crédito para la compra de locotes, cebolla, tomate, espinacas, y demás verduras para seguir invirtiendo en su microemprendimiento.
texts.en:
The group, Kuña Aty, is in its 8th cycle of the women’s committee program. They are doing a survey on the elimination of poverty. Through their efforts, continuing work, and the application of vital behaviors for successful women, all of them are improving their poverty situation.

Liz, the president, says that their group is fighting to get ahead, to improve each woman's life, and to give their families what they couldn’t have. They attend trainings that help them to grow and continue improving. Liz sells vegetables, and with them she makes the income to maintain her house and take care of her day to day expenses.

She is applying for this loan to buy green peppers, onions, tomatoes, spinach, and other vegetables to continue investing in her microbusiness.

loans.use: to buy green peppers, onions, tomatoes, spinach, and other vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Khaled

texts.en:
Khaled is a 36-year-old married man and the father of two sons and three daughters. He is employed and earns a small salary, which is barely enough to cover all the family's needs.

Khaled and his family were in need of a new refrigerator in their house, especially in summer season, so he took a Murabaha loan from FATEN to help him cover the cost. This loan will impact Khaled's family's living condition positively. Khaled's photo was taken in front of the refrigerator he has bought.

loans.use: to buy a new refrigerator for his house

loans.name: Maa Maheswari-2 Group

texts.en:
Maa Maheswari - 2, a Joint Liability Group, was formed in the year 2010 by four active women of Bhawanipatna town of Kalahandi district in Odisha, India. Simanchlam is one of the members of this group, sitting on the extreme left with raised hand in the photograph. She is 43 years of age and lives with her husband and two sons of 23 and 20 years. Her family migrated to this town in the last 40 years from the neighboring state of Andhra Pradesh in search of employment and settled here permanently. 

Simanchlam is running a goldsmith business in her house with the active support of her husband. Her elder son also helps his father. This is the traditional business of her family. They make different designs of ornaments and do polishing work by using traditional methods. From this business she earns a monthly income of 4000 INR with which is very hard for Simanchlam to manage her family's expenses. So she is thinking to increase the income of her business by adding some design machines and new accessories to her workshop. This will help her to get more output in less time and generate more time to work. 

From the present loan Simanchlam is planning to purchase an ornament-designing machine and some goldsmith accessories. Simanchlam hopes to open another workshop in the town for her sons in the near future. The other three members of this group are Sujata, Rina and Puspa who are running an auto repair center, a general store and an automobile shop respectively.

loans.use: To pay for  purchasing  an ornament-designing machine and  goldsmith accessories

loans.name: Malakiah

texts.en:
Opening a coffee shop has been a long time dream for Malakiah and her business partner April.  From the tantalizing aroma of a fresh hand-poured coffee to the social buzz found at local coffee shops, the full coffee experience has always excited them.  

Last March they decided to finally take the plunge, quitting their jobs and emptying their 401Ks to open Broke Girl’s Coffee Bar in the urban community of Normal Heights.  

The combination of eclectic décor, a large outdoor patio with a performance stage and locally sourced coffee beans make Broke Girls a San Diego gem worth discovering.  However, what makes this café truly special is its two owners with their contagious smiles and their deep care for the community.
Though Malakiah and April were able to complete a lot of the initial build out of their coffee bar with their own funds, they quickly ran out of capital and needed extra help.  They will use their $10,000 Kiva loan to finish the plumbing, as well to finish furnishing and stocking the shop with initial inventory for opening.

There is already a lot of interest from the community that is eager to welcome this new coffee bar to the scene.  Malakiah and April hope that their coffee bar will become a gathering place for the community, featuring the talents of local musicians and artists.  Furthermore, as members of the sober community, they hope to host meetings and gatherings helping people get sober.

video.title: Kiva Borrower Malakiah from United States

loans.use: to finish the plumbing, as well to finish furnishing and stocking the shop with initial inventory

loans.name: 1 De Marzo Group

texts.es:
El comité ´´1° De Marzo” se formó con la unión de varias vecinas de la ciudad de Santaní. Todas las integrantes del comité desarrollan actividades independientes, como la cría de animales, modista, y docente.
La Sra. Bernardina es modista y fabrica sabanas y uniformes para colegios, y cuenta que gracias al buen trabajo que hace, ya tiene una  clientela bien formada. Ella junto a sus compañeras formó un grupo muy unido y capaz de realizar conjuntamente actividades que fortalecen su compañerismo.
Bernardina solicita de este crédito para la compra de telas e hilos, para seguir con sus confecciones y cumpliendo también así con los pedidos de sus clientes.
texts.en:
The 1° de Marzo communal bank was formed by several neighbors in the city of Santaní.  All the members of the bank work in independent activities such as raising animals, dressmaking, and teaching.

Bernardina makes dresses, blankets, and school uniforms.  She says that, thanks to her good work, she already has well established customers.  She and her colleagues formed a very close group that's capable of working together to strengthen their camaraderie.

Bernardina's requesting this loan to buy fabric and thread to continue with her clothing and fill her customers' orders.

loans.use: to buy fabric and thread

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
Elena is married and has two children. She has her own business. She sells yarn at the city's central market and has her own retail outlet. Elena has 15 years of work experience. She is hardworking and responsible. 
Elena wants to develop her business in order to improve the family's welfare. She is requesting a loan in the amount of 10,000 hryvnia (UAH) to refill an inventory of popular types of yarn.

loans.use: to purchase additional supplies of yarn

loans.name: San Agustin Group

texts.es:
El comité San Agustin se formo con la unión de 15 señoras de la ciudad de Santaní. Cada integrante tiene un microemprendimiento en el cual trabaja y se esmera por ir mejorando. Ellas son mujeres jefas y madres que luchan por sus familias.
Perla es una de ellas, quien se dedica a la cría, faena y venta de animales de corral, como ser cerdos, gallinas y demás. Nos dice que esta oportunidad que está recibiendo es muy valiosa para ella, ya que muchos no le quisieron dar esta chance.
Solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de balanceados para sus animales, para que de esa forma no les falte nada.
texts.en:
The Saint Agustin committee is made up of fifteen women from the city of Santané. Each member has their small enterprise where they work. They hope to improve their businesses. They are in charge of their businesses and are also mothers that struggle for their families. 
Perla is one of the members of the group. She raises, works with and sells domesticated animals such as pigs, chickens and other animals. She told us that this opportunity, of which she is the recipient, is very valuable to her. Many others don’t have this opportunity. She is asking for this loan in order to buy food for the animals. If she can do this she will not lack anything.

loans.use: to buy balanced food for the animals.

loans.name: Joaquina

texts.en: Joaquina is  taking a loan of $ 600 to improve her business. She is running a kiosk that helps her to generate income for her family. She will use the loan to buy stocks to keep in her store such as slippers, cigarettes, soft drinks (Coca-Cola, Sprite, Sagiko and Fanta) and biscuits. She opened her kiosk in 2003 with her own working capital of $ 300.00.  She is a hard working woman and she hopes to run a bigger business in the future.

loans.use: to buy slippers, cigarettes, soft drinks (Coca-Cola, Sprite, Sagiko and Fanta) and biscuits.

loans.name: Sofia

texts.en:
Sofia is a 45-year-old responsible mother of five children living in Rawalpindi, Pakistan along with her husband and children. Her husband is a government employee and three of her children are currently studying in school. Her husband’s income is not enough to meet the household and educational expenses of their children and they are facing many hurdles in life. Sofia is helping her husband with the income by having a cloth business in her house for the past three years. 
She has requested a loan from Kiva’s partner BRAC Pakistan to expand her business. The main purpose of the loan is to open a small boutique in the market. In this way she would get more customers and her sales would be increased. She would save some money from the profit amount and pay the educational expenses of her children. Sofia has a bright vision and this loan could help her to fulfill her dreams. She is very thankful to BRAC Pakistan and Kiva for their support.

loans.use: To open a boutique

loans.name: Virgen De Fatima Group

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Caacupé se unieron 14 mujeres que quieren salir adelante y trabajar para poder ayudar a sus familias a dejar la pobreza atrás. Ellas vieron una gran oportunidad de progreso en el programa y decidieron formar su comité.
La señora Heriberta es integrante del comité,  ella solicita su crédito para invertirlo en compra de telas para confección de ropas, ya que ese es su principal trabajo y por medio de esto ayuda a su familia.
Cuenta que desde pequeña ha trabajado y se ha esforzado, todo lo que construyo en la vida es producto de su lucha y fuerza. Agradece por esa oportunidad que recibe, pues le será de mucha ayuda.
texts.en:
In Caacupé city a group of fourteen women meet. These women want to move forward and work in order to help their families and leave their previous lives of poverty. They saw the opportunity to progress with this program and so they decided to form a committee. 
Mrs. Heriberta is a member of this committee. She is asking for this loan in order to buy fabic to sew clothes. This is her main occupation and a way that she can help her family. Since she was little she has been working. Everything that she has earned in her life has been a product of her own struggle and effort. She is thankful for the  opportunity to receive this loan, as it will be a great help to her.

loans.use: to buy fabric to make clothes.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth is a 40-year-old woman and is married to Leonard, 53, who is working at a repair shop. They have five children: Septiadi, 18, who is working; Defrid, 15, a Junior High School student; David, 13 and Samuel, 9, both are in Elementary School; and the last one is Arthen, 5 years old. 
In order to help her husband in generating more income, Ruth cooks the simple lunch for 10 people who are working in a repair shop. The owner of the repair shop pays 350.00 IDR (Indonesian Rupiah) per week to provide food for the employees. 
Her husband plans to resign from his work, to start a new business as a fisherman. Currently, they have a small boat and it is ready to operate but unfortunately they need some money to buy a flashlight, trawl lead, floats, etc. She got information that TLM provides a business loan for small business entrepreneurs like her. She then requested a loan amount of 4,000,000 IDR from TLM .

loans.use: to buy a flashlight, trawl leads, floats, etc

loans.name: Mohammed

texts.en:
Mohammed is 26 years old, married, and has two children. He lives in Taiz, Yemen. He works hard in a small company buying mobile recharge cards then selling them to his customers to get profit. He works hard to complete studying for a bachelor's degree and to improve his family's expenses.  
He is requesting a youth loan for 100,000 YER (Yemeni Rial) from AMB which he will use to purchase mobile recharge cards  to sell to his customers to expand his business. In the future, he hopes to be a successful merchant in order to open a phone accessories store and earn an increased income, which will enable him to provide his household expenditures.

loans.use: to purchase mobile recharge cards  to sell to his customers to expand his business.

loans.name: Kuña Kyrey Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Comité Kuña Kyre’y está en su ciclo número 7mo.  Del programa de comité de mujeres, donde cada una de ellas está trabajando por mejorar sus vidas y las de su familia. Están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza para saber en qué situación esta cada una, donde 6 integrantes se encuentran por debajo de la línea de pobreza, es decir con ingresos muy bajos.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Edith  es una de estas mujeres, ella se encuentra trabajando en la venta de bijouterie y conforme vaya recibiendo las capacitaciones quiere seguir creciendo y mejorando la inversión que está haciendo. Ella es una persona muy humilde, pero con muchos sueños y metas.
Solicita de este crédito para la compra de bijouterie para la venta, y por medio de esto siga ganando un poco mas de ingresos para ayudar a su familia.
texts.en:
The group called Comité Kuña Kyre'y is in its 7th loan cycle with the Women's Committee program, where each one of the members is working to improve her life and that of her family.  They are doing the poverty elimination survey in order to know each member's situation.  Six of the members are below the poverty line; that is, they have very low income.

One of the members, Edith, is one of these women.  She works selling costume jewelry.  Accordingly, as she is receiving training, she wants to continue growing and improving the investment she is making.

She is a very humble person, but with many dreams and goals.  She is applying for this loan to buy costume jewelry for selling.  In this way, she would like to continue earning a little more income in order to help her family.

loans.use: to buy costume jewelry for selling.

loans.name: Edgar Enrique

texts.es:
Edgar es un señor casado de 35 años quien tiene 2 hijos 1 mujer y 1 hombre quienes viven en Sololá.
El se dedica al cultivo de arveja china  y suchini  se ha  dedicado  a esta actividad desde hace 5 años. Eligió esta labor  porque es muy rentable debido a que es un producto certificado,  esto permite que tenga precios aceptables en el mercado nacional e internacional.
El esta solicitando un préstamo de Q 5,000.00 para compra de semilla y fertilizantes para cultivo de suchini.
Su sueño es comprar una cuerda de terreno, para  incrementar su producción ya que actualmente solo cuenta con 2 cuerdas de terreno.
texts.en:
Edgar is a married, 35-year-old man who has two children, one female and one male.  They live in Sololá.  He makes a living cultivating snow peas and zucchini.  He has worked in this activity for five years.  He chose this work because it is very profitable due to the fact that it is a certified product and this allows him to have acceptable prices in the national and international market.

He is requesting a loan of 5,000 quetzales (GTQ) to purchase seed and fertilizer for the cultivation of zucchini.  His dream is to purchase a cuerda (a plot of land) to increase his production since he currently only has two cuerdas of land.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer for zucchini cultivation.

loans.name: Catarina

texts.en: Catarina is applying for a loan of $1,000.00 to improve her business. She is 31 years old and is married with two children. She is running a business in front of her house in which she sells gasoline. She is making a good income from selling gasoline and she wants to increase her stock with the loan. She is living in a town near the main road, so many people come to buy and she is selling every day. She opened her kiosk in 2009 with her own working capital of $45.00.

loans.use: to buy gasoline to sell.

loans.name: Mujeres Virtuosas Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Mujeres Virtuosas  está en su ciclo número 8º , según la encuesta de eliminación que ellas han hecho para saber su situación, 15 mujeres se encuentran por debajo de la línea de pobreza, es decir con ingresos muy bajos, y es por esa razón que se están esforzando el doble.
Maria, una de las miembros, tiene un negocio de venta de bebidas, cuenta que con este trabajo y sumada a las capacitaciones que recibe, está mejorando y saliendo adelante, y todo lo que aprende aplica a su negocio. Ella comenta que los fines de semana es cuando mas clientes tiene, es por eso que solicita de este crédito para poder comprar bebidas y surtir su negocio con mas vinos, cervezas, gaseosas y demás, y así seguir invirtiendo en su negocio, el cual es su única fuente de ingresos.
texts.en:
The Mujeres Virtuosas group is in their eighth cycle. According to the survey on the elimination of poverty, 15 women find themselves below the poverty line. Their earnings are very low and so they are striving with twice the effort. 
Maria is one of the members. She has a business selling drinks. With this work and the trainings she has received, she is improving and moving forward. Everything that she learns, she applies to her business. She comments that she has the most customers during the weekends. She is requesting a loan in order to purchase beverages and stock her store with more wines, beers, soft drinks and other items. With this, she can continue investing in her business which is her only source of income.

loans.use: purchase wines, beers, soft drinks and other items in order to sell them.

loans.name: Marie

texts.en:
Meet 37-year-old Marie from Waterloo, in the western rural area in Sierra Leone. She is married with two children, ages 15 and 20 years. They are currently attending school. 

In 2000, Marie established her palm oil business. She began her business because she needs to create income to support her family. She works at the business every day from morning to night. She says that the main challenges to her business are lack of finances to operate her business and transportation problems.

Marie requires a loan in order to purchase more gallons of palm oil for resale. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to have a permanent business location and increase her business. 

In the future, Marie plans to open a big palm oil store. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more gallons of palm oil for resale.

loans.name: Jose

texts.es: Jose, de 47 años de edad , esta casado y tiene 3 hijos con quienes vive en su casa propia.Jose se dedica a la venta de repuestos de vehículos motorizados como bujías, cadenas, palieres,  entre otros. También se dedica a la reparación de estos vehículos , arregla motores, sistemas eléctricos, entre otros. Este trabajo lo realiza en un local al interior de su propia vivienda.
