Currently she asks for a loan to buy fabrics with the goal of finishing a product that has been ordered from her. She hopes that with this investment she can improve the quality of life at home and meet the demands of her customers.

loans.use: to buy fabrics.

loans.name: Brayan Esneider

texts.es:
Brayan es un joven de 18 años de edad, amante a las motocicletas, pasión que le permitió desarrollar el potencial para la mecánica. Desde hace un año se dedica a la reparación de motocicletas. Actividad que se ha convertido en la forma de ganarse la vida y ayudar en su casa con los gastos del hogar. Sueña con ingresar a la universidad y perfeccionar sus conocimientos con el fin de expandir su negocio y mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia.
Con el fin de garantizarles a sus clientes  un se servicio de calidad, Brayan se encuentra solicitando un crédito que invertirá en la compra de herramientas de mano.
texts.en:
Brayan is an 18 year old young man who loves motorcycles. This passion has allowed him to develop his potential as a mechanic. For a year he has worked repairing motorcycles. This activity has become the way he earns his living and helps his family with the household expenses.  He dreams of going to college and perfecting his knowledge in order to expand his business and improve his family's quality of life. 

In order to guarantee his customers quality service, Brayan is asking for a loan to invest in buying hand tools.

loans.use: to buy hand tools

loans.name: Joanina

texts.en: Joanina is taking a loan of $1,000.00 in order to improve her business. She is married and is running a kiosk that helps her to generate income for her family. She will use the loan to buy stock to keep in her store such as noodles, cigarettes, sugar, coffee, gasoline and biscuits. She opened her kiosk in 2011 with her own working capital of $200.00. Joanina is a hard working woman and she hopes to run a bigger business in the future.  She is very happy that Kiva partner TRM (Tuba Rai Metin) offers loans for poor people.  The loans have improved her living condition and attended for her child to find school. Her husband is a fisherman.

loans.use: to buy noodles, cigarettes, sugar, coffee  gasoline and biscuits.

loans.name: Zahr

texts.en:
Zahr, 41, is married and mother to two sons and two daughters. She is a conservative person who prefers not to have her photo published online, so her husband, Mamdooh, appears in her Kiva profile. This picture was taken in his grocery store.

Zahr is a housewife; her husband earns a low pension, which is not enough to cover the family's needs. For the past five years, Zahr's husband has had a grocery store, selling different types of groceries. This has been a profitable project but it does not generate enough to cover costs.

Zahr is requesting a Murabaha loan (see below for explanation) from Palestine for Credit and Development to help her husband purchase the basic groceries that customers often request, such as rice, sugar and milk, and to improve the store's condition with the installation of additional shelves. These investments will increase sales and the family's income.

loans.use: To purchase a stock of basic groceries and make improvements to the store's condition

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more parts and pay the mechanic.

loans.name: Maa Tarini Group

texts.en: Ranjita is an active and energetic married lady, who is 45 years old and a permanent resident of Bolangir town of Odisha, India. Bolangir district is one of the underdeveloped areas of Odisha. The lady in the middle with the raised hand in the photograph is Ranjita. Ranjita lives with her husband and two sons, who are 6 and 4 years old. To work and earn some income, Ranjita started a home shop business five years ago with her own investment. In 2010, when Ranjita got confidence in being able to run this business, she and five other like-minded women of her locality formed a group named Maa Tarini for availing loans from Mahashakti Foundation to develop their businesses. Ranjita specially sells ladies fancy items like bangles, talc, plastic items, cosmetics, ornaments, etc., from her house. Apart from that, she has a tailoring machine stitching ladies garments. Ranjita buys stock for her home shop in her town. Presently, she is selling fancy items worth 300 Indian rupees (INR) to 500 INR per day, from which she gets 15 to 20% profit. From this small income, she barely manages her family's expenses. So, she wants to increase the volume of her business to increase her income. With this present loan, Ranjita wants to purchase ladies fancy items and different varieties of bangles. Ranjita is confident enough to have a business of her own and hopes to give a better education to her two sons. The other five energetic group members are Ful, Kousalya, Nirupama, Duhita and Saibalini who are running a carpenter and meals supply, broiler, meals hotel, vegetable vending business and tailoring centre respectively.

loans.use: to pay for purchasing bangles, talc, plastic items, cosmetics, ornaments, etc.

loans.name: Carlos Alberto

texts.es:
Carlos Alberto de 38 años de edad, considera que haber creado su propio negocio ha sido la mayor bendición que ha recibido. “Gracias a esta fuente de empleo hoy mi familia tiene un futuro mejor” estas son las palabras con las que Carlos narra su principal motivo de felicidad.
Asegura que las ventas en el sector son buenas y que lo único que le ha preocupado son algunos clientes que no cancelan la cuenta. Pero a pesar de inconvenientes como este, el siempre mira adelante con la satisfacción y el anhelo de un mejor porvenir. Hoy desea incrementar su nivel de ventas, por lo cual se encuentra solicitando un crédito que invertirá en la compra de surtido (bebidas y mecatos)lo que le permitirá mejorar la calidad de vida en su hogar.
texts.en:
Carlos Alberto is 38 years old.  He believes that starting his own business has been the best blessing he has received.  Carlos says about his motivation for happiness, "thanks to this source of employment, today my family has a better future." 

He ensures that his sales are good and the only thing that worries him are that some customers do not pay off their bill.  In spite of these problems, he always looks ahead with satisfaction and the hope of a better future.  

He wants to increase his level of sales, so he is requesting a loan to invest in the purchase of merchandise (drinks and cakes), which will allow him to improve his household's quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase drinks and cakes.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 46 years old, married, and a mother to four children. She is a resident of Kagadi, Uganda, and is currently building a home for her family.

Mary owns a retail shop where she sells general merchandise. She has been in this business for 13 years, and also farms to supplement her business. A major challenge she faces is inadequate capital. Mary is requesting a loan to buy sugar, soap, and cooking oil to sell in her shop. 

She dreams of working in the wholesale industry in the future.

loans.use: to buy sugar, soap, and cooking oil to sell

loans.name: Crhristian

texts.es: Christian de 28 años de edad, se dedica a la venta de mercancía (ropa) desde hace 6 años, debido a que por su inexperiencia en el mundo laboral, le fue difícil conseguir empleo y necesitaba generar ingresos para colaborarle a su madre con los gastos del hogar. Esta actividad, al aprendió de forma empírica y hoy es un gran maestro en el mundo de los negocios. Se encuentra solicitando un crédito que invertirá en la compra de surtido con el fin de satisfacer la demanda que tiene actualmente. Sueña con tener una cadena de almacenes y comenzar a importar.
texts.en: Christian is 28 years old. He has sold merchandise (clothes) for 6 years. Due to his work inexperience, it was difficult for him to get a job to help his mother with the household expenses. He learned this activity on the job and now he is a master in the world of business. He is asking for a loan to invest in buying stock to satisfy the demand his customers have right now. He dreams of having a chain of stores and starting to import.

loans.use: to buy clothes wholesale.

loans.name: Carolina

texts.en: Carolina is applying for a loan of $1,000 from TRM (TubaRaiMetin). She is 30 years old. She is running a kiosk in front of her house. She will use the loan to buy stocks to keep in her store such as soft drinks (CocaCola, Sprite, Fanta, Sagiko), hard drinks (beer), noodles, sugar, coffee, salt bread and fish. She is making good money from selling and she wants to apply for bigger loan in the future. Carolina is living in a town near by the school; her kiosk is located in a strategic place where many people come to buy including students.

loans.use: To buy soft drinks (CocaCola, Sprite, Fanta, Sagiko) and hard drinks (beer), noodles, sugar, coffee, and salt bread.

loans.name: Pert's Group

texts.en:
A married father of three children, Pert is 32 years old and lives in a rural village of Moung Russey, Cambodia. Of his three children, two are still dependent on him for support and attend school. To support their family, Pert and his wife farm rice and plant cassava as a main source of income. They have been in this business for 10 years.

Pert is in his third cycle with VisionFund. He paid back his previous loans, which has helped relieve his family’s burden. He is now leading a group of two to apply for another loan. He plans to use his portion of the loan to purchase fertilizers, pesticides, and seeds for his farmland, as well as to pay for labor. 

He hopes this loan will enable him to increase his family’s income and to improve their quality of life.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers, pesticides, and seeds for his farmland

loans.name: Daniel

texts.es:
Daniel de 21 años de edad, es un joven emprendedor, gracias a su esfuerzo y dedicación hoy cuenta con su propio negocio dedicado a la recarga y venta de extintores, Sueña con ampliar su negocio y mejorar las ventas, razón que lo ha motivado a solicitar un crédito que invertirá en la compra de mercancía y la adecuación del local para la prestación de un mejor servicio.
Desea ingresar a la universidad y graduarse como un gran administrador. Asegura que su mayor prioridad es su familia, por lo cual se esfuerza a fin de garantizarle a su madre una calidad de vida digna.
texts.en: Daniel is 21 years old and is a young entrepreneur. As a result of his hard work and dedication, he has his own business refilling and selling fire extinguishers. He dreams of growing his business and improving his sales, and for this reason, he is requesting a loan to invest in the purchase of supplies and to improve his store so that he can offer a better service. He hopes to go to college and graduate as a successful businessman. He states that his priority in life is his family, and that is why he will do his best to be able to give his mother a decent quality of life.

loans.use: to buy fire extinguishers.

loans.name: Gabriel Jaime

texts.es:
Gabriel Jaime, es un gran emprendedor, un hombre con grandes retos a nivel personal y profesional. Se encuentra casado y tiene un bebe de tres meses de edad. Asegura que su familia es lo más importante y que su bienestar es su tarea más importante. 
Cuenta que la cocina es una de sus grandes pasiones, por lo cual desea perfeccionar el arte y capacitarse en la elaboración de bizcochos y cubiertas con el fin de crear su negocio en un futuro próximo. En la actualidad no cuenta con los recursos económicos para dicha inversión por lo cual se encuentra solicitando un crédito para comenzar a capacitarse.
texts.en: Gabriel Jaime is a great entrepreneur and a man with great personal and professional challenges.  He is married and has a three month old baby and he assures us that his family is the most important thing and their wellbeing is very important.  Cooking is one of his greatest passions and he wants to perfect the art and train himself on making cookies and coverings so he can start a business in the near future.  He doesn’t have the financial resources so he is asking for a loan so that he can begin training.

loans.use: to attend cooking classes.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is 31 years old, and is a father to three children aged between 8 and 2. 

He owns a retail business in Kagadi, Uganda where he sells general merchandise. He has been in this business for five years, and in addition to his retail shop, John carries out farming to supplement his earnings. 

John plans to build a good residential house for his family. Inadequate capital is a major challenge to his business. His dream is to own a wholesale shop. John intends to use the loan to buy sugar, water and other general merchandise to sell.

loans.use: to buy sugar, water and other general merchandise to sell.

loans.name: Om-Amr Group

texts.en:
This group is called Om-Amr which consists of four ladies who live in Taiz, Yemen. They are helpful members who have known each other for many years. They have applied for a loan of 230,000 YER. 

Dhakra is 25 years old, and is a mother of two children. She is the breadwinner, and works to earn household expenses for her family. Dhakra owns an old house which she intends to remodel. She has requested a youth loan of 60,000 YER from AMB in order to buy construction materials to use for remodelling her home. She hopes to improve her living standards.

loans.use: to buy construction materials to use for remodelling her home.

loans.name: Delia

texts.es:
Delia, de 67 años de edad, es viuda y madre de ocho hijos a quienes crió y educó durante mucho tiempo sola, ya que su esposo falleció hace ya bastante tiempo, actualmente vive en su casa propia con dos de sus hijos pequeños.Delia se dedica a la venta de bebidas gasificadas por eso acondiciono un lugar en su hogar ,en donde antiende a todos sus clientes. Lleva realizando éste trabajo por 2 años y lo hace sola.
Hace mucho tiempo que se dedicaba a la venta de verduras, pero como fue creciendo su negocio, también quiso hacer crecer su inversión y multiplicar su ganancia, así que decidió cambiar de productos y ahora le va mucho mejor, tiene buenas ventas y eso le permite tener mayor ganancia, ahora desea seguir creciendo y poner una fuente de soda en su local.Este será el segundo préstamo con Kiva y está muy contenta de saber que tendrá un apoyo financiero para seguir adelante, además se compromete a ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas.Con el monto solicitado de 1500 soles, comprará bebidas gasificadas en mayor cantidad y variedad .
texts.en:
Delia is 67 years old, widowed, and the mother of eight children whom she raised and educated alone over time because her husband passed away a long time ago.  She lives in a home of her own with two of her youngest children.  Delia sells carbonated drinks and set up an area in her home where she serves her customers.  She has done this work alone for two years.

She was selling vegetables a long time ago, but she began growing the business and also wanted to make another investment and multiply her earnings, so she decided to change products and now things are going much better for her.  She has good earnings and now she wants to continue growing and set up a soda fountain in her place.  This will be her second Kiva loan and she is very happy to know that she has financial backing with which to continue ahead.  She is also committed to being on time with her payments.  She will use the 1,500 PEN from this loan to buy a variety of soft drinks in quantity.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks.

loans.name: Anatoliuos

texts.en:
Anatoliuos is a hardworking man aged 25. He operates an internet cafe in the town Kagadi, Uganda, which he started in 2011. His love for computers and improved technology helped him start up this business. 

He describes himself as an ambitious man and dreamx of buying a vehicle and getting married. Anatoliuos is requesting a loan to buy a laptop for use in the cafe.

loans.use: to buy a laptop for use in the cafe.

loans.name: Faber Alonso

texts.es:
Faber es agricultor desde la edad de ocho años, actividad que aprendió de su hermano mayor. 
Hoy a sus 25 años sigue dedicado a esta actividad, la cual se ha convertido en su fuente de ingresos para su sostenimiento. 
En la actualidad tiene sembrados de papa criolla y maíz, productos que comercializa en el mercado del pueblo. Asegura que una de sus grandes pasiones es la ganadería, por lo cual desea alternar las dos actividades y para ello se  encuentra solicitando un crédito que invertirá en la compra de una vaca lechera. Asegura que esta inversión le permitirá mejorar la calidad de vida de su núcleo familiar.
texts.en: Faber has been a farmer since he was eight years old. He was taught how to farm by his older brother. He is 25 years old now and continues working in this area, which has now become his main source of income. He currently has Andean potato and maize crops, products that he sells at the local market. He is passionate about cattle rearing and wants to be able to carry out both agriculture and cattle rearing. For this reason, he is requesting a loan to invest in the purchase of a dairy cow. He is sure that this investment will allow him to improve the quality of life of his close family.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Frederman Daniel

texts.es: Frederman, originario de Granada se dedica a ofrecer el servicio de transporte de coche fue beneficiado con su primer crédito Kiva el cual utilizo para comprar accesorios para su coche, logro pintarlo, ponerle llantas y darle una mejor apariencia a su carruaje. Ahora desea adquirir otro coche para ir ampliando su negocio pues desea participar en ferias turísticas para promover sus servicios de cochero en Granada ciudad visitada por muchos turistas. Este crédito lo usara específicamente para comprar un caballo y llantas. Esto le permitirá ir armando poco a poco su segundo coche para trabajar.
texts.en: Frederman is originally from Granada and provides transportation services by car.  He got his first Kiva loan which he used to buy accessories for his car, painted it, bought new tires, and gave it a better appearance.  Now he wants to buy another car so he can grow his business and participate in tourist fairs to provide his services in Granada, a city visited by many tourists.  He will use this loan to buy a body and tires.  This will allow him to build his second car little by little so he can work.

loans.use: to buy a body and tires.

loans.name: Julius

texts.en:
Julius is a 26-year-old married man with two children. He currently resides in Kagadi, Uganda. 

Julius operates a retail business, and he has been in business for a period of six years. He also raises pigs, from which he earns additional income to supplement his business. He would like to complete his house which he started despite inadequate capital, which is also affecting his business growth. 

Julius is requesting a loan to buy water, sugar and salt to sell.

loans.use: to buy water, sugar and salt to sell.

loans.name: Anatoli

texts.en:
Anatoli is a 28-year-old married man, and is a father to three children. He lives in Kagadi, Uganda.

He owns a spare parts shop where he sells bicycle and motorcycle spare parts. He has been in this business for four years. He also engages in farming maize to supplement his business income.

He dreams of building a residential house for his family and expanding his business to new areas. Anatoli intends to use the loan to buy spare parts to sell.

loans.use: to buy spare parts to sell.

loans.name: Stella

texts.en:
Stella is a 41-year-old married woman with five children, who are all in school. She is employed by local government as a primary teacher, a service she has offered for a period of 18 years. She was inspired by the teaching profession by the way teachers behaved and their smartness. 

She faces a challenge of being paid a low salary, while her dreams are to educate her children up to university, and to build a permanent residential house. Stella is requesting a loan to buy nails and iron sheets to complete construction of her house.

loans.use: to buy nails and iron sheets to complete construction of her house.

loans.name: Evernice

texts.en:
Evernice is a 32-year-old married woman with three children who are all in school. She is employed by local government as a primary teacher, a service she has offered for a period of 12 years. She was inspired to be a teacher by her desire to nurture young people. 

She faces the challenge of being paid a low salary, while her dreams are to build a permanent house and start a retail shop. Evernice intends to use the loan to buy nails and iron sheets to complete construction of her house.

loans.use: to buy nails and iron sheets to complete construction of her house.

loans.name: Erlita

texts.en:
Erlita is applying for a loan to improve her business. She runs a business from her house selling gasoline. 

She makes a good income from selling gasoline, and she would like to buy more stock with the loan. 

Erlita lives in a town near by the main road, so many people come to buy gasoline, and she sells gasoline every day. She opened her kiosk a year ago.

loans.use: to buy more gasoline to sell.

loans.name: Celestina

texts.en:
Celestina is requesting a loan to improve her business. She runs a kiosk that helps her to generate income for her family. She will use the loan to buy stock to keep in her store, such as ice and refrigerated soft drinks (Coca-Cola, Sprite, Sagiko and Fanta) and rice. She opened her kiosk in 2007. 

Celestina is a hard working woman and she hopes to run a bigger business in the future. She is married and has three children.

loans.use: to buy ice and refrigerated soft drinks (Coca-Cola, Sprite, Sagiko and Fanta), and rice to sell in her kiosk.

loans.name: Filomena

texts.en:
Filomena is 23 years old, and is single. She runs a business from her house selling gasoline. She opened her business a year ago with a start-up capital of $50.00.

Filomena makes a good income from selling gasoline. She is living in a town near the main road, so many people come to buy gasoline, and she is selling gasoline every day.

She is applying for a loan of $1,000.00 to improve her business. She would like to buy more stock with the loan. 

Filomena is very happy with this loan because it will help her to improve her living conditions, and she hopes to apply for a bigger loan in the future.

loans.use: to buy gasoline to sell from her kiosk.

loans.name: Francisco Javier

texts.es: Francisco es un campesino de una vereda del municipio de Sonsón, Antioquia. Se dedica a la agricultura y ganadería desde su juventud. En la actualidad tiene sembrados de papa criolla y tomate de árbol y cuenta con dos vacas lecheras. Hoy se encuentra solicitando un crédito que invertirá en la compra de una vaca con el fin de aumentar la producción de leche la cual comercializa entre sus vecinos, mejorando así la calidad de vida de su núcleo familiar y garantizándoles a sus cuatro hijos menores de edad una buena educción. Sueña con sacar adelante a su familia y permanecer siempre en unidad.
texts.en: Francisco is a farmer from a small community in the municipality of Sonsón, Antioquia. He has been working in agriculture and cattle rearing since he was young. He is currently growing Andean potatoes and tamarillo, and he has two dairy cows. He is requesting a loan to buy a cow so that he can increase milk production which he will sell to his neighbors. In this way, he will be able to improve the quality of life of his close family and guarantee an education for his four young children. His dream is to help his family progress in life and for them to remain united.

loans.use: to buy a cow.

loans.name: Albertina

texts.en:
Albertina is33 years old, and is married with four children. Her husband is a farmer. 

Albertina runs a kiosk that helps her to generate income for her family. She is requesting a loan to improve her business. She will use the loan to buy stock to keep in her store, such as soft drinks (Sagiko, Fanta, Coca-Cola, Sprite), beer, noodles, sugar, coffee, salt, eggs and cigarettes. 

She opened her kiosk in 2009 with her own start-up capital of $80.00. Albertina is a hard working woman and she hopes to run a bigger business in the future. She is very happy that TRM (Tuba Rai Metin) offers loans for poor people, and she hopes to improve her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks (Sagiko, Fanta, Coca-Cola, Sprite), beer, noodles, sugar, coffee, salt, eggs and cigarettes to sell in her store.

loans.name: Kanchi

texts.en:
Kanchi is 30 years old. She is married and has two children; one is aged 7. In 2000, she established her meat shop business. Working six days a week and four hours a day, she supports her family.  

She has already received and successfully repaid six loans from Patan BPW and used her most recent to buy chickens for her business. In the future, Kanchi plans to uplift the economic condition of her family. She thanks you for your support.   

In Nepal, the meat is always fresh. In small stalls along busy roads, open-air butcher shops sell chicken, goat, and water buffalo by the kilo. The stalls are piled high with product and sales are brisk. With the help of a Kiva loan, BPW's borrowers are able to purchase additional stock at better prices. This increase in purchasing volume creates greater profit margins for the borrower.

loans.use: to buy chickens for her business.

loans.name: Secundino

texts.es:
Secundino es una persona muy trabajadora y emprendedora, que lucha por poder salir adelante, el sigue trabajando con su empresa de transportes, y también en su venta de articulo de primera necesidad. Cuenta que el crédito anterior que ha recibido de Kiva lo ha ayudado mucho a seguir con su trabajo.
solicita nuevamente de un crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de artículos de primera necesidad, como ser bebidas, comestibles, verduras, frutas y demás, y con ello poder seguir con su negocio. Esta muy agradecido por esta oportunidad que esta recibiendo, ya que este sería su tercer crédito con Kiva.
texts.en:
Secundino is a very hard-working and enterprising person who fights to get ahead. He continues to work in his transport company and his grocery store. He says that the previous loan he received from Kiva really helped him to continue with his work. 

He is requesting another loan so he can invest it in purchasing basic items, such as drinks, food products, vegetables, fruit, and other items, and continue with his business. He is very grateful for the opportunity he is receiving as this will be his third loan with Kiva.

loans.use: to purchase drinks, food, vegetables, fruit, and other items

loans.name: Spartak

texts.en:
Young businessman Spartak is still engaged in his lavash (Armenian bread) production and food shop managing. 

With the first loan from Kiva, Spartak bought some circulating assets for his bread production. His business is going well and enlarged after Kiva lenders' support. His bread production profit allowed him to start a new agricultural business in his village of Tsovagyugh, which is in Sevan area. Spartak and his father built a barn for animals and started their new farming business. 

Spartak breeds cows, bulls and sheep in his farm. Spartak says that it is too hard to be engaged in bread production and farming at the same time, but with his father's help, he does his best in order to enlarge and increase his newly created farm.
 
This time Spartak needs a loan of 1,000,000 Armenian drams to buy two cows and a young calf and hopes to receive a good profit from farming. Spartak is sure that this second loan will have the same success for him.

loans.use: To buy two cows and a young calf.

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en:
This very hardworking lady, Julieta, is still engaged in farming and animal breeding in her lovely village, Tsovagyugh, which is in the Sevan region. She lives with her husband, and they both work hard day and night in order to sustain their family needs, and sometimes, they help their children’s families. 

Thanks to her previous loan from Kiva, Julieta enlarged her animal breeding business, and she added to the number of her bee families. She started to sell more honey of high quality, and not only to her neighbors. The resellers are coming to her farm and buying her tasty and useful honey from her farm. Julieta is very happy and appreciative of her agricultural business.
 
Julieta asks again for a loan from Kiva lenders to buy a lot of fodder for her animals and to buy new beehives.

loans.use: to buy fodder for her animals and to buy new beehives.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to extend his workshop.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a refrigerator and supplies for her family

loans.name: Simon

texts.en: Simon is 44 years old and living in Masindi, Uganda. He is married and charged with a responsibility of looking after four of his children. A good father that he is, his dream is to educate them up to the University. He deals in a business of cutting grass, and his major clients are schools and hospitals. He also has a transport business. The high cost of fuel and delays in payment affect his business growth, while his dream is to buy at least five mowing machines and hire workers, who will be remitting to him 70% of the earnings. Simon intends to use the loan to buy a mowing machine.

loans.use: to buy a mowing machine.

loans.name: Karangura Farmers Associations Group

texts.en:
Matiya is a 46-year-old married man living in Fort Portal, Uganda. His main business is selling palm oil, the business he started in 2008 with an aim of improving his family income. He faces hardships of unpredictable weather changes; however, he has a vision of educating his children up to higher levels of learning. 

Matiya is requesting a loan to buy seedlings for planting. He is a member of the above mentioned group, where each one guarantees the other in accessing a loan.

loans.use: to buy seedlings for planting.

loans.name: Godfrey

texts.en: Godfrey lives in Masindi, Uganda. He is married and is responsible for looking after three children. He is a farmer producing maize and groundnuts and has been farming since 2003. He earns additional income from a salon business. His major clients are produce dealers. His dreams are to construct a permanent house for his residence and to become a model farmer. Godfrey intends to use the loan to pay labor for weeding and to buy fertilizer.

loans.use: to pay labor for weeding and to buy fertilizer.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy construction materials,such as bricks and sand, to complete his house.

loans.name: Adriano

texts.en: Forty-nine-year-old Adriano lives in Masindi, Uganda. He is married and responsible for taking care of six children. He is a farmer and also earns income from selling charcoal. Thieves hinder his business. His dream is to venture into commercialized agriculture. Adriano is requesting a loan to buy fertilizer and pay to weed his farm.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pay to weed his farm.

loans.name: David

texts.en: David lives in Masindi, Uganda. He is married and has a retail shop business selling items such as sugar, salt and other general merchandise. His major clients are the general public. He is challenged with inadequate capital while his dream is to expand his business to new areas. David is requesting a loan to buy general merchandise such as salt and soap to sell.

loans.use: to buy general merchandise such as salt and soap to sell.

loans.name: Luis Alberto

texts.es: Luis Alberto de 58 años es padre de tres hijos y desde joven ha trabajado en diferentes oficios. Desde hace algunos años decidió independizarse y crear su propio negocio con el fin de compartir más tiempo con su familia y mejorar calidad de vida en el hogar, Es así como creó su miscelánea la cual administra y abre diariamente. En la actualidad desea invertir en la compra de artículos de papelería con el fin de satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes y mejorar la calidad en el servicio, por lo cual se encuentra solicitando un crédito ya que no cuenta con recursos propios. Sueña con garantizarle a su familia una mejor condición económica y a su hijo menor la oportunidad de realizar sus estudios universitarios.
texts.en: Luis Alberto is 58 years old and is the father of three children.  He has been working in different trades since he was very young.  He decided to go out on his own a few years ago and create his own business so he can spend more time with his family and improve the quality of life in his household.  This is how he created his store which he manages daily.  He wants to invest in paper goods so he can satisfy his customer demand and provide better service, so he is asking for a loan because he doesn’t have his own resources.  He dreams of providing better financial conditions for his family and a university education for his son.

loans.use: to buy paper goods.

loans.name: Alvard

texts.en:
Alvard is 51 years old and lives in Aralez village, which is in the Ararat region. Alvard has three children. She lives with her younger son, daughter-in-law and grandchild. Alvard has a higher education; she graduated from State Armenian Pedagogical University. For more than 30 years, Alvard has worked as a teacher in her village school. She has a good reputation as a teacher and many students. But as her teacher’s salary is not high, Alvard at the same time is engaged in farming and an agricultural business. Alvard breeds cows and sheep, and she has a plot of land near her house where she grows potatoes, tomatoes, cucumbers, etc. The products from agriculture, Alvard and her husband sell in the regional fruit markets and Yerevan wholesale markets. The income from agriculture allows Alvard to meet her big family's needs. 

Alvard decided to enlarge her fruit garden and to establish a new apple orchard in her plot of land. For this purpose, she asks from Kiva lenders a loan of 2,000 U.S. dollars. This deal will help Alvard to have a new apple garden, and after few years, she hopes to receive a good harvest from her new garden.

loans.use: To establish a new apple orchard in her plot of land.

loans.name: Rajab

texts.en: Rajab lives in Masindi, Uganda. He is married and has one child. He is a farmer who grows and sells maize and produce. He has been in business since 1998. His major clients are produce dealers. His dreams are to complete his house and educate his child up to the university. Rajab faces challenges of unpredictable weather changes. Rajab intends to use the loan to pay workers for weeding and to buy fertilizer.

loans.use: to pay workers for weeding and to buy fertilizer.

loans.name: Armen

texts.en:
Armen is still engaged in furniture production in his basement that has been converted into a workshop. He rents a small furniture shop in his town, where he sells furniture that he produced. 

This is Armen’s second loan from Nor Horizon and second deal with Kiva. The previous one helped him to enlarge his furniture production and to add to the number of furniture assortments. He started to produce sofas and armchairs in his workshop. It was new for him, but he overcame all the difficulties and during six months became able to produce high quality upholstered furniture. He has a lot of clients and orders from them because they prefer to buy Armen’s handmade furniture.

Armen asks from Kiva a loan to buy a lot of raw materials for producing upholstered furniture and kitchen furniture. He hopes to make all his orders on time with Kiva lenders' support.

loans.use: To buy a lot of raw materials for producing upholstered furniture and kitchen furniture.

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
As a married parent of ten children, Vilma works hard to support her family.

She has an ambulant fruit-vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from raisings pigs. Vilma is borrowing 12,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) through NWTF to purchase additional fruits to sell.

Vilma has been sustaining her business activities through her past 21 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional fruits to sell.

loans.name: Freda

texts.en: Freda is 45 years old and lives in Masindi, Uganda. She is a single mother of four children and is solely responsible for looking after them. She has been a teacher for the last six years and she was inspired into service by her desire to serve her community. Her dream is to educate her sister and children to attain degrees despite limited income. Freda intends to use the loan to pay tuition for her children.

loans.use: to pay tuition for her children.

loans.name: Harriet

texts.en: Harriet is a 45-year-old hardworking woman living in Fort Portal, Uganda. She has been dealing in agriculture since 1990 as well as tailoring to increase her income. She has a dream of completing her rental houses although she is faced with a lack of enough capital. Harriet will use the loan to complete her rental houses by buying bricks and paying for labor..

loans.use: to complete her rental houses by buying bricks and paying for labor.

loans.name: Nelson De Jesús

texts.es:
Nelson de 36 años de edad, es un hombre trabajador, ama su familia y asegura que su negocio es su única fuente de ingresos con la cual sostiene a su familia.
Se dedica a la venta de frutas y verduras en una pequeña legumbrería desde hace algunos años. Sueña con mejorar su condición económica y expandir su negocio. En la actualidad se encuentra solicitando un crédito  que invertirá en la compra de surtido con el fin de incrementar sus ventas y posicionarse en el mercado local.
texts.en:
Nelson is 36 years old and is a hardworking man.  He loves his family and tells us that his business is his only source of income with which to support his family.

He sells fruits and vegetables in a small shop and has done so for several years.  He hopes to improve his financial condition and expand his business.  He is asking for a loan so he can buy products so he can increase his sales and set up in the local market.

loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Silvia Inés

texts.es:
Silvia de 49 años de edad, es una mujer entregada a su familia y hogar. Desde hace algunos años se dedica a la talabartería como actividad económica, debido a que el dinero que devenga su esposo no es suficiente para el sostenimiento familiar. Con el fin de cumplir con la producción solicitada, se encuentra solicitando un crédito que invertirá la compra de cuero e insumos (pegantes, hebillas)
Sueña con tener una gran empresa y convertirse en una fuente de empleo para las personas más vulnerables de su comunidad.
texts.en: Silvia is 49 years old, and she is a woman dedicated to her family and household. For many years, she has worked at a leather goods shop because the money her husband earns is not sufficient for the family's sustenance. With the goal of completing requested orders, she is requesting a loan that she will invest in the purchase of leather and supplies (glue, buckles). She dreams of having a big business and of making it a source of work for the most vulnerable people in her community.

loans.use: to buy leather and supplies (glue, buckles).

loans.name: Silvina

texts.en:
A $1,000 loan is offered to Silvina to improve her business. She has a meat jerky business, where many people come to buy every day. She will buy some seasonings such as salt, soy sauce and pepper powder. She has been involving herself in business activities since 2007. She feels so comfortable to run her business because she can earn money every day.

Running a business has made Silvina independent because she can be responsible for herself and also help her family. She hopes to run a bigger business in the future.

loans.use: to buy meat jerky seasoning, such as salt, soy sauce, pepper powder and other items.

loans.name: Narine

texts.en:
Narine is 41 years old and lives with her husband and parents close to Kapan city. Narine graduated from Kapan State Medical College and for more than 10 years has worked as a nurse in Kapan hospital. Narine with her husband is also engaged in an agricultural business. Narine has a lot of chickens and a plot of land where she grows vegetables and fruits. Narine and her husband sell their products in Kapan  markets. Narine is very happy that she is a nurse in the hospital and does her work with pleasure but, at the same time, the salary is too low. That’s why she engaged in the agricultural business which is more profitable and allows her to support her family. 
Narine needs a loan of 600.000 Armenian drams to buy 30 young chickens and seedlings for her garden. She is counting on support from Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To buy 30 young chickens and seedlings for her garden

loans.name: Yusta

texts.en: Yusta is a 50-year-old hardworking widow with four children living in Fort Portal, Uganda. She mainly does outside catering, selling food on a large scale to parties, and farms as a side income to enhance her standard of living. She is faced with the challenge of people who owe her money and affect her business. Her dream is to construct a house and start up a hotel. Yusta intends to use the loan to pay school fees for her children

loans.use: to pay school fees for her children.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en: Agnes is a 39-year-old married woman with three children living in Fort Portal, Uganda. She has been running a retail shop since 2009 and has been able to pay school fees for her children. She has a dream of creating a bigger business to increase her income base. High competition and rainy seasons are her major challenges. Agnes will use the loan to add stock such as soap and cooking oil to sell.

loans.use: to add stock such as soap and cooking oil to sell.

loans.name: San Miguel Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado  San Miguel está en su 1° ciclo del programa de comité de mujeres. Están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, donde 10 integrantes están por debajo  de la línea de pobreza, es decir con ingresos muy bajos. Ellas están aprendiendo a trabajar juntas y a ayudarse las unas a las otras.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra.  Dora, quien en su última encuesta mostró un nivel de pobreza dentro del nivel uno, es decir con ingresos muy bajos, ella a través del esfuerzo y el trabajo continuo se encuentra mejorando su situación de pobreza, pero igualmente está consciente de que este trabajo y esfuerzo que está haciendo debe ser continuo y permanente para lograr un éxito total, ya que con ello podrá dar un mejor bienestar a su familia. Entre el trabajo que ella hace es la venta de productos agrícolas. También cabe destacar que las señoras del grupo en su mayoría son analfabetas y que ahora están retomando sus estudios.
La Sra.  Dora Solicita  este crédito para la compra  insumos agrícolas  lo que le ayudará a tener a concretar su plan de negocio, el cual le ayudará a mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
The group named San Miguel is on their first loan cycle with the Women’s Committee Program. They are doing the elimination of poverty survey. Ten members are below the poverty line with very low incomes. They are learning to work together and help each other. 

One of the members is Dora, who in her last survey showed a poverty level within level one (red), that is, with a very low income. Through continuous effort and work her situation is improving, but she is also aware that the work and effort she is putting in must be continuous and permanent if she is to achieve total success and be able to give her family better well-being. Selling farm products is one of the jobs she does. It is also fitting to point out that the majority of the women in the group are illiterate and are now retaking their studies.

Dora is requesting this loan so she can purchase farm supplies, which will help her to settle her business plan and improve her income.

loans.use: to purchase farm supplies to sell

loans.name: Kuña Kyrey Group

texts.es:
El comité  Kuña Kyrey, se conformó con la iniciativa de la una de las miembros. Actualmente se encuentran en el 2do ciclo, con 13 integrantes, todas trabajaran y se ayudaran para salir adelante. Están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, donde ocho  se encuentran por debajo de la línea de pobreza, es decir con ingresos muy bajos.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Maria, quien por medio de la venta de panificados está saliendo adelante. Cuenta que se hizo de muy buena clientela que siempre compra de ella sus panificados frescos y por medio de eso tiene los ingresos que necesita para cubrir las necesidades del día a día. Su sueño es poder tener una buena panadería donde poder seguir con su producción y también poder ayudar a otras personas dándoles trabajo.
La Sra. Solicita de este crédito para la compra harina, huevo, sal, levadura y demás, para poder seguir creciendo e invirtiendo en su plan de negocios.
texts.en:
The committee Kuña Kyrey formed due to the initiative of one of its members. Currently they are on their second loan cycle with thirteen members. They will all work and help each other to get ahead. They are doing the elimination of poverty survey. Eight of them are below the poverty line with very low incomes.

One of the members is Maria, who is getting ahead by selling baked goods. She says she has built up a very good clientele who always buy her freshly baked goods from her, thereby giving her the income she needs to cover day to day necessities. Her dream is to be able to have a good bakery where she can continue with her production and also be able to help other people by giving them work.

She is requesting this loan so she can purchase flour, eggs, salt, yeast, and other items in order to be able to continue growing and investing in her business plan.

loans.use: to purchase flour, eggs, salt, yeast, and other items

loans.name: Sebastián

texts.es:
Sebastían es un joven de 22 años de edad. Acaba de terminar de prestar el servicio obligatorio en la marina y desea capacitarse con el fin de adquirir conocimientos en el área de lácteos,  e iniciar con su proyecto de negocio a fin de ayudarles a sus padres con los gastos del hogar. Razón que lo ha impulsado a solicitar un crédito ya que no cuenta con los recursos para realizar dicha inversión.
Asegura que con esta capacitación tendrá los conocimientos para la producción de diferentes tipos de quesos, lo que le permitirá incursionar en este sector y mejorar las condiciones económicas en su hogar.
texts.en: Sebastián is a 22-year-old young man. He has just finished his obligatory service in the navy and wishes to train with the goal of acquiring knowledge of the dairy industry and beginning his business project so he can help his parents with the household expenses. This has inspired him to request a loan since he does not have the resources to make said investment. He is confident that from this training he will get the knowledge he needs to be able to produce different types of cheese, which will allow him to enter the dairy sector and improve his family’s economic conditions.

loans.use: to train in dairy production

loans.name: Raúl

texts.es:
Raúl vive en casa propia en la meseta de Achumani en la ciudad de La Paz, trabaja en uno de los hospitales de la ciudad de La Paz,  en el área de emergencia. Raúl es de profesión traumatólogo, con esta actividad el mantiene a su familia.

El crédito que solicita es para pagar la construcción de una vivienda en Coroico, para la cual necesita bastante material ya que como queda lejos de La ciudad, el material comprado anteriormente ya no sirve debido a que no fue guardado y el clima caliente y la humedad lo destrozaron.

El sueño de Raúl es poder jubilarse del hospital y hacer que su vivienda de Coroico se convierta en un hotel y poder vivir de los ingresos del mismo.
texts.en:
Raúl lives in his own house in the Achumani plateau in the city of La Paz.  He works in the emergency room of one of the city's hospitals.  Raúl is a traumatologist and, with this work, he is able to support his family.

Raúl is applying for a loan to pay for work on a building in Coroico.  For this work, he needs quite a lot of material.  With Coroico being quite far from the city, the material that Raúl bought before is now ruined as it was in storage and destroyed by the humidity and warm climate.

Raúl's dream is to be able to retire from the hospital and to convert his home in Coroico into a hotel and then live off the earnings from it.

loans.use: to buy material for a building in Coroico, where he is thinking of retiring.  He will convert the building into a hotel.

loans.name: Carmen Cenovia

texts.es:
Carmen a sus 63 años de edad, es una mujer llena de vida y con un proyecto claro por cumplir. Debido a su precaria condición económica, ha tenido que a travesar por muchas dificultades y laborar como empleada doméstica en varias casas de familia. En la actualidad se dedica a la venta de comidas rápidas desde su vivienda, actividad que alterna con la venta de productos por catálogo, con el fin de generar los recursos para el sostenimiento de su familia.
Se encuentra solicitando un crédito que invertirá en la compra de productos de la canasta familiar para la preparación de alimentos. Espera que con dicha inversión pueda mejorar su condición económica y su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Carmen, at 63 years old, is full of life and with projects that she wants to put into action.  Given her difficult financial situation, Carmen has had to deal with many difficulties and work as a domestic servant for various families.  She currently makes a living selling fast food from her home, which she does as well as selling catalogue products.  She does this work in order to earn money to support her family.

Carmen is applying for a loan that she will invest in buying basic staple goods to prepare food.  She hopes that, with this investment, she will be able to improve her finances and quality of life.

loans.use: to buy basic staple goods for preparing food.

loans.name: Annabel Teresa

texts.es:
La cliente Annabel vive en Guayaquil. Comenzó su negocio de venta de cosméticos cuando una de sus amigas le comenzó que podía vender cosméticos por catalogo y en diferentes horarios. Poco a poco mejoro sus ingresos. También la cliente hace trabajos en casa de limpieza para asi tener mas ingresos. 

Ella tiene muchas aspiraciones de seguir adelante en su negocio por eso quiere trabajar y también asi darle lo mejor a su hijo de 9 años que estudia en una escuela fiscal. Para poder dar una mejor educación ella quiere comprar una computadora y asi su hijo pueda hacer los trabajos que le envían ya que la computadora es una herramienta muy útil para los estudiantes.
texts.en:
Annabel lives in Guayaquil. She started her business of selling cosmetics when one of her friends also started selling cosmetics through catalogs. However, they work on different schedules. Gradually Annabel was able to improve her income. She also takes on housekeeping jobs as a way of earning more money.

Annabel has many aspirations of moving forward with her business, which is why she wants to work. She also wants to provide the best for her nine-year-old child who is studying at a state school. In order to provide a better education, Annabel wants to buy a computer so that her child can do the homework that is assigned. The computer is a very useful tool for students.

loans.use: to buy a computer for her child's schoolwork.

loans.name: Yulicia

texts.es:
Yulicia tiene 54 años de edad y vive en la ciudad de Pilcopata, ella es una persona trabajadora y emprendedora que sale adelante. Su actividad económica principal es la  venta de verduras y frutas como por ejemplo zanahorias, tomates, cebollas, naranjas, papayas, plátanos y piñas. Desde hace varios años que pertenece al banco comunal “Chacoq” y en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar frutas como piñas y papayas. 
(La ciudad de Pilcopata es la capital del distrito de Kosñipata dentro de la provincia de Paucartambo dentro del departamento de Cusco, Perú).
texts.en: Yulicia is 54 years old and lives in the city of Pilcopata.  She is hard-working and enterprising and is moving forward in life.  Yulicia's main work is selling fruits and vegetables such as carrots, tomatoes, onions, oranges, papayas, bananas and pineapples.  She has been a member of the "Chacoq" communal bank for some years and, on this occasion, she needs a loan to buy fruits such as pineapples and papayas.  (The city of Pilcopata is the capital of the Kosñipata district in the Paucartambo province of the department of Cusco, Peru).

loans.use: to buy fruits such as pineapples and papayas.

loans.name: Maria  Teodosa

texts.es: Doña maria de 42 años de edad,  posee una tienda donde vende pan, refrescos, aceites, verduras, frutas, golosinas y también de primera necesidad como: jabón y shampoo entre otras cosas tiene su negocio en su casa de habitación con las ganancias que obtienen de sus ventas logar cubrir algunas necesidades que tiene en su hogar, vive en casa propia con su esposo y sus tres hijos. Doña maria solicita un préstamo por medio del cual pueda surtir aún más la tienda de manera que pueda atender mejor a sus clientes y de esta misma forma mejorar sus ventas lo cual es su prioridad para sacar adelante su hogar.
texts.en:
Doña Maria, age 42, has a store where she sells bread, soft drinks, oil, vegetables, fruit, and snack foods. She also offers basic necessities, such as soap and shampoo among other things. Her business is located in her home and the profit she generates from her sales helps to cover some of her household needs.

Maria lives in her own home with husband and three children. She is requesting a loan so that she can restock her store with more items, thereby enabling her to provide better service to her customers. In this manner, she will be able to improve her sales since one of her priorities is to move her household forward.

loans.use: to buy bread, soft drinks, oil, vegetables, fruits, snack foods, soap, and shampoo.

loans.name: Imaculada

texts.en: Imaculada is taking a loan of $1000.00 to improve her business. She is running a kiosk that helps her to generate income for her family. She will use the loan to buy stocks to keep in her store, such as slippers, cigarettes, soft drinks (Coca-Cola, Sprite, Sagiko and Fanta) and biscuits. Imaculada opened her kiosk in 2009 with her own working capital of $400.00. She is a hard working woman and she hopes to run a bigger business in the future.

loans.use: to buy slippers, cigarettes, soft drinks (Coca-Cola, Sprite, Sagiko and Fanta) and biscuits

loans.name: Suzana

texts.en: $1,000.00 is offered to Suzana to improve her business. She has a kiosk where many people come to buy every day. Suzana will buy some additional supplies such as biscuits, noodles, sugar, coffee, and other items for her kiosk. She has been involving herself in business activities since 2008. Suzana feels so comfortable to run her business because she can earn money every day.

loans.use: to buy biscuits, noodles, sugar, coffee, and other items for her store.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fish vending business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 20000 through NWTF to buy additional stocks of fish to sell for her fish vending business.

Virginia has been in this business for 20 years. She also earns additional income from raising pigs.

Virginia has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of fish to sell

loans.name: Uterus Group

texts.en: Mariana is 27 years old and she is married. Mariana is one of the Uterus group (Uterus means hope) and she is requesting a loan, which she will use to buy some additional items such as noodles, sugar, coffee, salt, milk, cigarettes, water, Coca-Cola, Sprite, Fanta and Sagiko. Mariana is applying for this loan to improve her business. Uterus group are happy with this loan because it offers them change for their living conditions in the future.

loans.use: To buy noodles, sugar, coffee, salt, milk, cigarettes, water, Coca-Cola, Sprite, Fanta and Sagiko

loans.name: Neliya

texts.en: Neliya is taking a loan of $600.00 to improve her business. She is running a kiosk that helps her to generate income for her family. She will use the loan to buy stocks to keep in her store such as slippers, cigarettes, soft drinks (Coca-Cola, Sprite, Sagiko and Fanta), biscuits, and other items. She opened her kiosk in 2005 with her own working capital of $200.00. Neliya is a hardworking woman and she hopes to run a bigger business in the future.

loans.use: to buy slippers, cigarettes, soft drinks (Coca-Cola, Sprite, Sagiko and Fanta), biscuits, and other items

loans.name: Apolonia

texts.en: Apolonia is taking a loan of $1000 to improve her business. She is running a kiosk that helps her to generate income for her family. She will use the loan to buy stocks to keep in her store such as slippers, cigarettes, soft drinks (Coca-Cola, Sprite, Sagiko and Fanta), and biscuits. Apolonia opened her kiosk in 2011 with her own working capital of $500.00. She is a hardworking woman and she hopes to run a bigger business in the future.

loans.use: to buy slippers, cigarettes, soft drinks (Coca-Cola, Sprite, Sagiko and Fanta), and biscuits

loans.name: Juliana

texts.en:
A $1,000 loan is offered to Juliana to improve her business. Juliana has a kiosk where many people come to buy every day. She will buy some additional supplies such as biscuits, noodles, sugar, coffee and other items. Juliana has been involving herself in business activities since 2010. She feels so comfortable to run her business because she can earn money every day.
Running a business has made Juliana independent because she can be responsible for herself and also help her family. She hopes to run a bigger business in the future.

loans.use: to buy biscuits, noodles, sugar, coffee and other items

loans.name: Ana

texts.en: Ana has a kiosk to generate income for her family. She has been thinking about how to run a big business but she does not have enough working capital. She felt better when she applied for her first loan and she is applying for her second loan of $1,000. She will buy some additional supplies to keep in her store such as soft drinks, hard drinks, body lotion and biscuits. She is happy with TRM, (Tuba Rai Metin) which offers loans to poor people.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, hard drinks, body lotion and biscuits

loans.name: Lalamak Group

texts.en: Maria is one the Lalamak group (Lalamak means hope). She is requesting a loan, which she will use to buy some additional items to keep in her store, such as gasoline and petrol. Maria is happy with TRM (Tuba Rai Metin), who offer loans to poor people to improve their business for the future. Maria hopes to apply for a bigger loan in the future.

loans.use: To buy gasoline and petrol

loans.name: Serafina

texts.en:
Serafina is now applying for a loan of $1000 to improve her business. She opened her kiosk in 2012 with her own working capital of $200.  She earns a good income from her business.
She will use her loan to buy some stocks to keep in her store such as noodles, cigarettes, and biscuits. Serafina is a very hard working woman and wants to make her business bigger and improve her living conditions in the future.

loans.use: to buy noodles, cigarettes, and biscuits

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is a hard-working entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 19,000 through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell.

Evelyn successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

NWTF is re-listing Evelyn's business profile again in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell.

loans.name: Eugenia

texts.en: Eugenia is taking a loan of $1,000 from TRM (Tuba Rai Metin). She has a shop to generate income for her family. Eugenia has been thinking of how to run a big business but she does not have enough working capital. She felt better when she applied for her first loan. She will buy some additional supplies to keep in her store such as second-hand clothes, shoes and bags. Eugenia is happy with TRM (Tuba Rai Metin) who offer loans to poor people.

loans.use: to buy second-hand clothes, shoes, and bags

loans.name: Sejaltina

texts.en:
Sejaltina is now applying for a loan of $1,000 to improve her business. She opened her kiosk in 2001 with her own working capital of $850.  She earns a good income from her business.

She will use her loan to buy some stock to keep in her store such as body lotion, soft drinks, beer, noodles and rice. She is a very hardworking woman and doing business has become her regular activity for the past 11 years. She wants to make her business bigger and improve her living conditions in the future.

loans.use: to buy body lotion, soft drinks, beer, noodles and rice

loans.name: Rhea

texts.en:
Rhea works hard to support her family. She is married and has a business buying and selling vegetables in the Philippines.

Rhea requested a PHP 18000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional vegetables to sell.

Rhea has been in this business for six years now. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional vegetables to sell

loans.name: Sari Karya Group

texts.en:
Ni Ketut is head of the Sari Karya group and all members of the group are getting their seventh loan from MUK. The group still wanted to join the MUK until completely independent. Ni Ketut, after obtaining this loan, purchased three more piglets for fattening. Because the loan size is currently increasing, the other members used it to buy superior piglets and quality feed. 
At the time of the disbursement, all members present and the group obtained referrals from the branch manager about new saving programs, call  SIPURA (Savings For Holiday). All member gave an enthusiastic response and immediately joined the programs. In the picture, Ni Ketut is standing front row left and has raised her hand. Ni Ketut is very grateful to MUK for continuing to provide funding for their businesses.

loans.use: To buy three superior quality piglets for fattening.

loans.name: Roberosa

texts.en:
Roberosa is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a  business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 10000 through NWTF to buy more seafood to sell to her customers.

Roberosa successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

NWTF is presenting Roberosa's business profile again for funding of another loan in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more seafood to sell.

loans.name: Muon

texts.en:
Muon, aged 33, is a hard working mother who pursues a fish breeding business and has a position in a market as a fish vendor. She started her businesses in 2011 and everything was going so well. Since it is the main source of income to support her family’s living needs, she loves doing her business very much. She desires to make her business even more profitable.

She is requesting a loan amounting to $600 (US dollars) to buy small fish for breeding and feeds for her to nourish her fish. She hopes the loan will be granted to give her a helping hand in developing her business. With her perseverance, she will achieve all of her dreams especially for her children.

loans.use: to buy small fish for breeding and feed for her to nourish her fish.

loans.name: Eufemia

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Eufemia works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from raising pigs. Eufemia is borrowing PHP 13,000 through NWTF to purchase additional fishing equipment for her fishing business.

Eufemia has been sustaining her business activities through her past four loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional fishing equipment for her business.

loans.name: Freda

texts.en:
Freda is 50 years old and married with four children.

Freda is in the agricultural business, raising livestock in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to buy medicines and vaccines for her livestock.

She has been raising livestock for six years now and has borrowed five times in the past from NWTF and, more recently, from Kiva to sustain it.

Freda is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream, to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy medicines and vaccines for her livestock.

loans.name: Ma'ing

texts.en:
Ma’ing lives with his wife and one grandchild. His children already work and live in Denpasar. He works as a boat driver in one hotel near his house and escorts guests to diving or snorkeling. But his main job is as a salt farmer. He has four plots of salt ponds. 
Ma'ing needs a loan to purchase a water pump to support his business. This machine can make it faster to dry the ponds so he can more quickly produce salt. He hopes through this business that he can improve his family's income because he has a dream to renovate his house and buy more salt ponds.

loans.use: To purchase a water pump machine

loans.name: Panchashakha Group

texts.en: Panchasakha Joint Liability Group was formed in the year 2009 by five women from M. Rampur town in the Kalahandi district of Odisha, India. The purpose was to take a loan from Mahashakti Foundation and expand their businesses. Jyotshnarani is one of the members. The lady standing in front in the photograph with her hand raised is Jyotshnarani. She is 24 years old and lives with her husband and seven-month-old daughter. Jyotshnarani’s husband has been running a multifarious business that includes a photocopy center, stationary store, thread wholesaling and a cloth center for the last 12 years. After marriage, Jyotshnarani has been helping her husband. All these trades are running under one roof. Jyotshnarani gets a monthly income of 7,000 INR from the business. Out of this income, she is barely able to manage her household expenses along with her business expenses. So she wants to expand her business by taking a loan from Mahashakti Foundation. From the present loan, Jyotshnarani wants to purchase more stock of cold drinks, stationary, thread and blouse pieces. This will help her to reduce her purchasing and transportation costs, as she has to replenish her stock frequently. Jyotshnarani hopes to save enough to start a kid’s readymade garment shop and give a better education to her only girl child. The other four members of the group are Laxmi, Ramita, Labanya and Haripriya who are running a fancy store, a book stall, a Tiffin and meals hotel and a photo studio, respectively.

loans.use: To purchase cold drinks, stationary, thread and blouse pieces to sell.

loans.name: Mahbuba

texts.ru:
Махбуба женщина 54 лет. Замужем. Мать двоих детей. Дети у неё уже взрослые и у каждого своя семья. Сама Махбуба домохозяйка. Как то Махбуба ходила к своим родственникам в гости и ей посоветовали заниматься скотоводчеством. Это предложение ей очень понравилось. Вот уже 8 лет как занимается откормом и продажей крупно-рогатого и мелко-рогатого скота. Махбуба откармливает КРС у себя дома. В этом деле она имеет большой опыт. Это приносит дополнительный доход к семейному бюджету. Для Махбубы это не только работа но и  удовольствие, когда она ухаживает за животными. В данный момент Махбуба хочет купить КРС для откорма, но для этого у нее  недостаточно денежных  средств и она обратилась в организацию  Арванд. 
На полученный кредит  Махбуба планирует купить скота.  Она  заранее благодарит Арванд  за помощь и поддержку.
texts.en: Mahbuba is 54 years old and married with two children.  Her children are grown and have families of their own.  Mahbuba is a homemaker, but she was advised by her relatives to get started in raising livestock.  She liked this suggestion very much and she has now been involved in raising and selling sheep and goats for eight years.  Mahbuba also raises cattle at her home and she has a great amount of experience in this area - it brings in some extra money for the family budget.  For Mahbuba, raising animals is not just her work, it is a pleasure.  At the moment, she wants to buy cattle to raise, but she doesn't have enough money for this and she has turned to Arvand.  She plans to buy cattle with her loan.  She thanks Arvand in advance for their help and support.

loans.use: to buy cattle

loans.name: Chhan

texts.en:
Chhan is 34 years old, married, and lives with her spouse and two dependent children. She has operated in farming from a small village of the Prey Chor district for many years, whereas her husband has joined to work with a building team in the surrounding areas. With their perseverance and effort, the couple hopes in the future to be able to provide their children with a better quality of life and better financial stability.
 
This will be her second loan. The past loan from HKL has helped her family significantly improve their home. If the loan is granted, she will utilize it to buy a farm animal for the maintenance of her rice fields. She believes that, through her struggle and hardships, she will be able to provide all the needs for the sake of her children especially their education.

loans.use: to buy a farm animal for the maintenance of her rice fields.

loans.name: Gene

texts.en:
Gene is married and she works hard to support her family.

She has a pottery business in the Philippines, and earns additional income from her general store. Gene is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF in order to buy materials needed for her pottery business.

Gene has been sustaining her business activities through her past nine loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy materials needed for her pottery business.

loans.name: Jahonoi

texts.ru: Чахоной 38-летняя замужняя женщина. У нее двое дочерей и один сын. Она со своей семьей проживает в Спитаменском районе, в северной части страны. Ее муж занимается выращиванием сельскохозяйственной культуры. Сама Чахоной работает продавщицей в аптеке. Сейчас она хотела бы начать новый бизнес. Ее интересует купля-продажа крупнорогатого скота. При дворе ее дома имеется коровник, а также корм для скота. Чахоной запрашивает кредит для закупа двух голов крупнорогатого скота. Продолжительность откорма будет составлять 60-дней, после этого она планирует продать скот на скотном рынке, расположенный недалеко от ее дома. В новой деятельности ей будет помогать семья.
texts.en: Jahonoi is 38 years old and is married with one daughter and one son.  She lives with her family in the Spitamen region in the northern part of the country.  Her husband is involved in raising crops and Jahonoi works as a cashier at a pharmacy, but she wants to start her own business.  She is interested in buying and selling cattle.  She has a cowshed next to her home and feed for the herd.  Jahonoi is asking for a loan to buy two head of cattle.  Her stock of feed will last 60 days, after which she plans to sell the cows at the animal market not far from where she lives.  Her family will help her in this new business.

loans.use: to buy and sell cattle.

loans.name: Mahbuba

texts.ru: Махбуба женщина 35 лет. Замужем мать 1 ребёнка. Махбуба из семьи служащих. Мать и отец Махбубы учителя. Махбуба после окончания школы пошла по стопам своих родителей и поступила в педогогический институт в 1994 году. Окончив институт начала свою трудовую деятельность в средней школе в районе Спитамен. Муж Махбубы является мигрантом в РФ. Так как заработная плата в школьных учреждениях были низкие она была вынуждена бросить свою работу и заниматься торговлей. Вот уже более шести лет Махбуба занимается продажей женской обуви на  вещевом рынке района.   Махбуба очень ответственная, добросовестная  женщина с крепкой силой воли.   Для увеличения товарооборота ей необходимы денежные  средства и по этой причине она обратилась в организацию Арванд.  Махбуба хочет расширить свой бизнес  и на полученный кредит хочет закупить новый ассортимент женской обуви.   Махбуба благодарна  МДО "Арванд" за большую поддержку.
texts.en: Mahbuba is 35 years old and she is married with one child.  She comes from a family of civil servants; her parents are teachers and after finishing high school, Mahbuba followed in her parents footsteps and enrolled in the pedagogical institute in 1994.  On graduating from the institute, she started working in a high school in the Spitamen region.  Mahbuba's husband is a migrant worker in the Russian Federation.  Since the salaries in the school system are very low, she had to quit her profession and start working in a shop.  For more than six years, Mahbuba has been selling women's shoes in a local market.  She is a very responsible and conscientious woman with strong willpower.  She needs money to increase her trade, so she has turned to Arvand for help.  Mahbuba wants to expand her business and she will use this loan to buy a new assortment of women's shoes.  She thanks Arvand for their great support.

loans.use: to purchase of a new range of women's shoes

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a clothing sales business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 25,000 through NWTF to purchase more clothing to sell to her customers.

Helen successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

NWTF is presenting Helen's business profile for this new loan in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more clothing to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: La clienta vive en casa de sus padres con su hija de 2 años, ella se dedica  a la venta de pan francés lo hace de forma ambulante en las diferentes colonias que están cerca de su lugar de residencia, con las ganancias que obtiene de sus ventas ayuda en los gastos que tiene en su casa, la clienta esta solicitando un crediro que le permita poder comprar más pan francés por mayor para poder seguir con su trabajo ya que esa es única fuente de ingresos y asi poderle dar a su hija lo que necesita sin limitación alguna.
texts.en: The borrower lives in her parent's home with her two-year-old daughter, and makes a living selling French bread. She takes the bread from district to district near her home. With her earnings from this, she helps out with household expenses. The borrower is requesting a loan to buy more French bread in bulk so that she can continue her work, since it is her only source of income, and in this way give her daughter everything that she needs.

loans.use: to buy more French bread in bulk.

loans.name: Gabino

texts.es:
Gabino tiene 64 años de edad y vive en la ciudad de Pilcopata, él es una persona trabajadora y emprendedora que sale adelante. Su actividad económica principal es la venta de artefactos domésticos como por ejemplo planchas, televisores, radios y otras cosas más. Desde hace varios años que pertenece al banco comunal “Chacoq” y en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar artefactos como radios.  

(La ciudad de Pilcopata es la capital del distrito de Kosñipata dentro de la provincia de Paucartambo dentro del departamento de Cusco, Perú).
texts.en:
Gabino, 64, lives in the city of Pilcopata. He is a hardworking and enterprising person; a fighter. His main economic activity is selling home appliances such as irons, TV sets and radios. He has been a member of communal bank “Chacoq” for some years now and this time he is requesting a loan to buy appliances, e.g. radios.

(The city of Pilcopata is the capital city of the Kosñipata district, Paucartambo province, department of Cusco, in Peru).

loans.use: to buy home appliances, e.g. radios.

loans.name: Herminia Doris

texts.es:
Doris tiene 44 años de edad y vive en la ciudad de Pilcopata, ella es una persona trabajadora y emprendedora que sale adelante. Su actividad económica principal es la  venta de madera. Desde hace varios años que pertenece al banco comunal “Chacoq” y en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar madera. 
(La ciudad de Pilcopata es la capital del distrito de Kosñipata dentro de la provincia de Paucartambo dentro del departamento de Cusco, Perú).
texts.en: Doris is 44 years old and lives in the city of Pilcopata. She is hard-working and enterprising and is moving forward in life. Doris's main source of income is selling wood. She has been a member of the "Chacoq" communal bank for some years and, on this occasion, she needs a loan to buy wood. (The city of Pilcopata is the capital of the Kosñipata district in the Paucartambo province of the department of Cusco, Peru).

loans.use: to buy wood.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy iron, bronze, copper, cans, bottles, and other items.

loans.name: Heide

texts.en:
Heide is married and she works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell.

Heide has been in this business for four years and has previously received funds through Kiva.

Heide aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Irene

texts.en:
Irene is married and she works hard to support her family.

She earns a living by farming vegetables in the Philippines and earns additional income from hog raising and tricycle transport. Irene is borrowing PHP 23,000 through NWTF in order to buy fertilizers and pesticides for her vegetables.

Irene has been sustaining her business activities through her past four loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pesticides .

loans.name: Sonia

texts.es: Sonia, de 38 años, esta casada y tiene 4 hijos, tiene una casa propia en donde vive a lado de su familia.El trabajo de Sonia consiste en la venta de comida rápida. Ha destinado la parte delantera de su casa para acondicionar un pequeño restaurante en donde ofrece diariamente platillos como salchipapas, salchipollos, pollos broaster y otros productos que complementa con gaseosas o refrescos de frutas frescas. Se inició en este negocio hace tan solo 5 meses y desde entonces se siente muy motivada y con muchas ganas de continuar con su trabajo.Le gusta su trabajo porque lo realiza en la comodidad de su hogar y eso le permite sentirse segura aunque no le agrada las constantes lluvias que se presentan en esta temporada lo cual daña las calles impidiendo el paso continuo de la clientela que necesita.
